loans.name: Khaled Group

texts.en:
Khaled is a group which consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB. 

Rahima is a 53-year-old married woman with eight children living with her family in Sana'a, Yemen. Rahima is an enterprising and dynamic woman. She works as a housewife and her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. 

Rahima's house lacks many home appliances. Rahima puts many kinds of drinks and sweets inside the kitchen of the house without a refrigerator. That makes that food and water warm. Particularly, the climate now is very hot in this season (summer). For this reason, the house needs a refrigerator in order to keep the drinks and food in a good and cold condition. 

So, Rahima is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a refrigerator to keep the foods and drinks in a cold condition in the house. 

Rahima looks forward to buying a house and renting it out it in order to earn money.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to keep the food and drinks in a cold condition in the house.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a 50-year-old Ugandan woman who is married to Deo and has 5 children aged 28, 26, 24, 22, and 20. Most of them are in higher education institutions. She runs a boutique and is also a farmer who grows maize and beans to help her earn income for her family. She has been running her boutique for the last 6 years.

Jacinta has applied for a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) to boost her business and thus increase her income. She hopes she will earn well after the sale of the garments. She faces challenges of competition from people with similar businesses. She hopes to overcome these challenges with continuous financial support. She is hardworking.

loans.use: To buy garment stock to sell in her boutique

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en: Ma. Theresa owns and manages a general store, selling groceries in her local community to make a living. She has been doing this for eight long years. She successfully repaid her previous business loan. She became a member of GDMPC in 2011. Recently, she took out a new loan to buy more goods to sell. She plans to make her store a general merchandise business some day.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Nhóm 07 Thôn 7 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Năm works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Năm is 31 years old, and she is married with two children.
Năm is the group leader of the Nhóm 07 thôn 7 Quảng Lưu solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

This is Năm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Năm has been involved in this business for nine years.
The main hardship that Năm faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Năm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn 2 Thống Nhất -Quảng Vinh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tần Lê works in agriculture, raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Tần Lê is 42 years old and married with two children. She is the leader of a seven-member group, the Nhóm 01 Thôn 2 Thống Nhất -Quảng Vinh solidarity group. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

This is Tần Lê's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tần Lê faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tần Lê hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
This is Flordeliza, 53, a resident of Araneta, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Luisito, the owner of their auto repair shop, and mother to five children. By the grace of God, Flordeliza has managed to support all her children’s educational needs. At the present time, she is working hard to be able to maintain her finances for her youngest child’s college education.

Flordeliza operates an auto repair shop. Her husband is the main mechanic and she handles finances, accounts, inventories and promotion. They offer repair, check up and beautification of all types of cars, jeepneys and any type of vehicle that is referred to them.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy supplies like wiring, putty paint and others similar items. 

Flordeliza hopes to find a better place for her repair shop. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies when she attends the fellowship.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for supplies like wiring, putty paint and other accessories needed in her auto shop.

loans.name: Minovar

texts.en: Minovar is a careful mother of three children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Minovar has been busy with an agrobusiness for more than 20 years. She grows wheat. She earns additional income from animal husbandry. She lives in an agricultural region, so she has a good opportunity to develop her agrobusiness. She manages the business alone. With the profit from her business, she organized the wedding party of her son. She is asking for a loan to buy a refrigerator for her household. She really needs to refrigerate in the hot summer season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for her household

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Catherine is 42 years old and has three children who are in school.

Catherine has a food vending business in the Philippines. Catherine requested a 7,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Catherine has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Catherine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia sells snacks in her village for subsistence. She brought this to reality through hard work and determination. From that time on, she has actively prepared some snacks to sell. It allows her to earn well considering other sources of irregular income, too.

A loan from GDMPC will absolutely help Virgilia to buy more snacks to sell. The availability of this fund is a channel to offer more to her customers. She hopes to sustain their daily needs and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more snacks to sell

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn 2 Thống Nhất -Quảng Vinh Group

texts.en:
Liên works in agriculture raising poultry. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Liên is 31 years old, and she is married with 2 children.

She is the leader of a 7-member group, the Nhóm 02 Thôn 2 Thống Nhất -Quảng Vinh solidarity group. Liên lives with 2 dependents in the Quang Xuong district, a rural town in the Thanh Hoa province. This is Liên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Liên has been involved in this business for 6 years.The main hardship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Luciana has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from food vending.

Luciana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 24-year-old married lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She deals in baking bread along with arts and crafts where she gets extra income to add to what her husband makes to make ends meet. She faces the challenges of low capital and losses. However, she hopes to buy land and build a good house for the family. Sarah needs a loan to buy wheat flour to use for baking.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour to use for baking.

loans.name: Sagrado Corazón De Jesú Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sagrado Corazón de Jesús está en su 5º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde una de las 19 señoras se encuentra en el nivel amarillo de Ingresos superiores a la línea de pobreza, lo que quiere decir que están en un nivel medio, gracias al trabajo de ellas y las capacitaciones que han recibido.
Forma parte de este grupo la Sra. Agustina, quien con esfuerzo y sacrificio pudo montar su propia despensa, y a través de la cual ayuda a sus seres queridos y les da todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones. Agustina comenta que todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas del día, hasta muy tarde.
Hoy Agustina pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, lácteos, panificados, carne, bebidas y demás productos, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas, luchando día a día por un futuro mejor para su familia. Están todas muy agradecidas por la gran oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder crecer.
texts.en:
The group “Sagrado Corazón de Jesús” (Sacred Heart of Jesus) is in its fifth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members have taken the poverty elimination survey that indicated only one of the 19 women is at the “yellow” income level, which is above the poverty line. The rest have been able to achieve a medium level thanks to the work they have accomplished and the training they have received.

One member of this group is Sra. Agustina. Through effort and sacrifice, she was able to open her own food pantry. With the help of her loved ones, Agustina has been able to provide them everything they need to have a decent life without feeling deprived. She says that she begins every work day extremely early in the morning and continues deep into the afternoon.

Today Augustina is requesting a loan in order to invest in the purchase of vegetables, dairy products, baked goods, meat, beverages, and other products. This will enable her to continue her sales. She strives each day to provide a better future for her family.

All of the members are grateful for this wonderful opportunity they have received so that they can grow.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, dairy products, baked goods, meat, beverages, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is a 48-year-old married woman who has been blessed with four children and whose husband adds an additional income to cater to their family needs. Salima has been a food vendor, preparing doughnuts, cakes and fried potatoes for a period of six years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Salima is now servicing her third loan of KES 20,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this entire amount to buy doughnut flour, self raising flour and cooking fat to add to her stock, which is running out.

Salima plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy doughnut flour, self raising flour and cooking fat to add to her stock, which is running out.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina thanks all who supported her. Her business has grown. Here again she needs another loan to buy 8 sacks of charcoal because she is increasing her number of customers and needs to increase her amount of charcoal to meet their demands. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy eight sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an air-conditioner and sewing machine.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana: Es una señora luchadora, originaria de Waspam, tiene 51 años, casada con 1 hijo de 11 años que estudia su sexto grado de primaria. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda de tambo de madera, solicita financiamiento, para comprar materiales de construcción: madera, zinc, clavos, postes y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una vivienda que le brinde las condiciones adecuadas a su familia y apoyar en la educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Juliana is a determined woman who is originally from Waspam. She is 51 years old, married, and has an 11-year-old son who is in the sixth grade.

With the intent of improving her wooden stilt home, she is requesting a loan in order to buy construction materials such as wood, zinc, nails, and posts. She will also cover the cost of labor. Juliana’s dreams are to have a home that provides her family with adequate conditions and to support her son’s education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
This is Agripina. She is 66 years old and currently resides with her husband, Federico, in Araneta, Quezon City, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than five years, and she earns well from this. She and her husband have to work hard, but are determined to have a better income for their family.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To improve sales, Agripina would like to apply for a loan to purchase more grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. With the amount of 22,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos), she could already purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages.

She sincerely sends you her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance.

In the future, Agripina dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Francia

texts.en:
Francia is 44 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Francia has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a direct selling business of Cospachem products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and a general store. Delia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more Cospachem products to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college .

loans.use: to buy more Cospachem products to sell

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 50 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and she is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 4 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Leonora is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dina Esperanza

texts.es:
Dina de 42 años de edad, vive con su familia tiene dos hijos de 10 y 7 años de edad. Ella lucha por sacarlos adelante ya que su esposo viajo a los EE.UU; pero no le ayuda con los gastos, debido a eso Dina se dedica a la venta de ropa para obtener sus ingresos desde hace 4 años.
 		
El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar ropa para el negocio, ya que de ese modo puede sobrevivir, salir adelante con sus hijos y poder vivir mas o menos y que también tienen los gastos sus hijos en el estudio.

 Dina espera ya no salir  a  acarrear la ropa, si no tener un negocio en su casa , tenerla bien surtido con variedades y estilos de ropa diferente para un buen servicio del cliente y obtener mejores ingresos y ayudar a sus hijos a que saquen sus estudios aunque sea con sacrificios.
texts.en:
Dina is 42 years old and lives with her family. She has two children, ages 10 and 7. Dina strives to get ahead since her husband traveled to the United States and is not able to help with the expenses. Therefore, Dina must sell clothes in order to generate an income. She has been doing this for four years.

The loan she is requesting from CrediCampo will be used to buy clothes for her business. This will allow her to get by, press forward along with her children, and be able to more or less survive. She also has to pay for her children’s education expenses.

Dina hopes to no longer carry around clothes since she will have a business in her house. She will keep it well-stocked with a variety of clothes in different styles so that she can provide good service to her customers. As a result, she expects to generate more income so that she can help her children get an education despite the sacrifices she has made.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her current coffee crop and to plant new crops.

loans.name: Magaly Del Socorro

texts.es:
La dedicación y perseverancia de Magali hacen que el primer préstamo con MiCrédito y KIVA, haya sido bien aprovechado. Con alegría, esta joven de 33 años, cuenta lo agradecida que está de haber tenido el dinero para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, frijoles y otros, que le permitieron brindar mayor variedad a su pulpería de hace cuatro años. Además que le ha permitido darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia. Esta mujer casada, a cargo de sus dos hijos y comerciante, ha salido adelante luego de no haber tenido la oportunidad económica de ir a la universidad.
Los sueños de Magali no se detienen ahí, pues desea variar más su tienda, con la compra de cosméticos y otros artículos de belleza. Sin embargo, para esto necesita de la ayuda de un  préstamo para comprar los productos tales como: Arroz, Azucar, Frijoles, Aceite entre otros, necesarios que le permitirán crecer como empresaria y le dará la oportunidad de consagrar una buena herencia a sus hijos. Gracias al apoyo de su familia completa ha salido adelante, más el broche de oro del cual no deja de agradecer por creer en ella y su progreso. Por el momento no se siente alguien autosuficiente, pero sabe que está en proceso de lograrlo, ya que tiene muchas metas familiares.
texts.en:
Magali's dedication and perseverence made her first MiCrédito/Kiva loan a success.  This young, 33-year-old woman cheerfully expresses how grateful she is for receiving the money to buy products such as rice, sugar, beans and other items so she could offer a wider variety of products at the store she has been running for four years.  It also has allowed her to give her family a better lifestyle.  

Magali is married and has two children in her care.  She has been able to get ahead despite not having been able to get a university degree.

Her dreams do not stop here because she wants to offer other lines of products at her store, such as cosmetics and beauty products.  But for this she needs a loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, etc. to grow her business and build on the patrimony she will leave her children.  Thanks to the support of her family she has been able to prosper, for which she is ever grateful because of the trust in her.  For now she does not feel self-sufficient but knows that she is close to it and has many family goals to achieve.

loans.use: To buy products such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, etc.

loans.name: Yakubu Yahaya

texts.en: Yakubu Yahaya is a 46-year-old farmer from Burus.  As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu Yahaya is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yakubu Yahaya can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Yakubu Yahaya is ambitious and is aiming to reap a total of 200 bags on his 4.30 ha field.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, his said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Maryam, Musa,and Haruna. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Levenson

texts.es:
Levenson es un joven emprendedor, tiene 18 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Chincha junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Desde hace más de 6 meses trabaja como Chofer cerca al mercado principal de la zona. Le va muy bien porque es muy trabajador, responsable, honesto, dedicado a su labor y siempre se esfuerza porque quiere mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Levenson está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar repuestos para reparar su vehículo y de esta manera no tenga inconvenientes cuando trabaje. Con ello seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder: "Comprarse una moto".
texts.en:
Levenson is a young, 18-year-old entrepreneur who is single and lives in Chincha with his family.  He is a person who is determined to get ahead.  For six months he has been working as a driver at the main market in the area.  Things are going well for him because he is a hard worker, responsible, honest and dedicated to his work, always striving to improve his family's quality of life.

Levenson is grateful to Kiva lenders because their support will allow him to buy spare parts to repair his vehicle so he does not run into problems when working.  This way he can continue making every effort so in the future he can buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Karen Elizabeth

texts.es:
Keren, mantiene su negocio de venta de piñatas, artesanías y refrescos funcionando, opta por más capital para surtir nuevamente su inventario, puesto que la demanda de sus productos es mayor, comprara papelería, pegamento, alambre, azúcar, bolsas, gaseosas, entre otros materiales.
Con la inversión anterior tuvo a su disposición los materiales necesarios para elaborar sus productos, sus ganancias han incrementado un poco, logro cancelar con buen record su deuda y mejorar las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
Karen is maintaining her business of selling piñatas, handicrafts, and refreshments. She chose to request more capital so that she could restock with additional inventory since the demand for her products is higher. Karen will buy paper, glue, wire, and other materials, as well as sugar, bags, and sodas.

With her previous loan, Karen had the necessary materials at her disposal for making her products. Her profits increased a bit, so she was able to repay her debt with a good record and improve her family’s circumstances.

loans.use: to buy paper, glue, wire, and other materials, as well as sugar, bags, and sodas.

loans.name: Ahmed Danladi

texts.en: Ahmed is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Ahmed joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children. He is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Ahmed will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Ahmed can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to expand my farmland.” Ahmed is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his long term goal is to “ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
Ever  vive en la ciudad de Luque, en casa de sus padres, es el mayor de  tres hermanos. Actualmente tiene como meta terminar su carrera universitaria la cual es la de contaduría publica, poder superarse y obtener un  buen ingreso y ayudar a su familia, para lograr  tener su propio consultoría de auditoria.
El es una persona que se esta esforzando por poder ser alguien en la vida. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas y gastos de manutención de su universidad.
texts.en:
Ever lives in the city of Luque at his parents’ house. He is the oldest of three children. Ever currently has a goal of finishing his university degree in Public Accounting. This will enable him to excel and generate a good income so that he can help his family. He hopes to have his own auditing firm.

Ever is a person who strives to become someone in life. He is requesting this loan so that he can pay his fees and living expenses while at the university.

loans.use: to pay his university fees and living expenses.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Dauda joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Malkisadik, Emma, and  Istifanus. Dauda is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Dauda will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Dauda can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Dauda is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his long term goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Isiyaku Lover

texts.en: Isiyaku Lover is a farmer from Burus.  As a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Isiyaku can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Isiyaku is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, his said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Istifanus, Rejoice, and  Zainap. My overall goal is to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en: Mathew is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Mathew joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Isaac, Habakuk, and  Gloriya. Mathew is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Mathew will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Mathew can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Mathew is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Judith has been in this business for 11 years. Judith earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is married with three children. Jenelyn is 33 years old and lives in Manga, Tangub City. To earn a living, Jenelyn has a sari-sari store. She has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 6,000. Jenelyn has been a member of PMPC for one year.

In the future, Jenelyn hopes to have a better future someday with her three children and husband.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Liezel works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Liezel is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Liezel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream - to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: La Luz Group

texts.es:
En Acatlán, la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican al trabajo en campo. Es en este lugar donde se conformó el grupo "LA LUZ", conformado por 10 integrantes que se dedican a una actividad productiva para obtener ganancias y solventar los gastos de sus familias. Las integrantes del grupo son;  Juana De La Cruz-venta de artículos de merceria , Margarita-venta de plata,  Amelia-servicio  de fletera,  Leonarda –venta de comida y ropa, Elizabeth-venta de accesorios de oro laminado, Eliquia-venta de manualidades, Maria- venta de abarrotes, Amanda-venta de calzado por catalogo, Yescenia-venta de ropa y Alba- venta de cosméticos.

“Yo soy fiel a VisionFund” son las palabras de Alba quien se ha dedicado a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo desde hace ya 10 años, esta muy agradecida con Vision Fund por apoyarla con la oportunidad de obtener un préstamos. Comenta que ya está en su ciclo 21 y que ella ha estado desde que se formó el grupo. Con su préstamo pretende comprar más mercancía como rímel, sombras, labiales, delineadores, bases, cremas, exfoliantes, etc. 

Asimismo, con las ganancias que obtiene apoya a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, de esta manera han logrado darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus dos hijos a quienes quieren demasiado.
texts.en:
In Acatlán, most of the inhabitants work in the fields. It is here where the group "La Luz" took shape, made up of 10 members engaged in productive activities in order to obtain an income and pay their family expenses.

The group members are Juana De La Cruz - selling haberdashery items, Margarita - selling silver, Amelia - transport service, Leonarda - selling food and clothing, Elizabeth - selling gold-plated accessories, Eliquia - selling crafts, Maria - selling groceries, Amanda - selling shoes by catalogue, Yescenia - selling clothes and Alba - selling cosmetics.

"I am faithful to Vision Fund" are Alba's words. She has been selling cosmetics by catalogue for 10 years. She is very grateful to Vision Fund for supporting her with the opportunity to obtain a loan. She says she is already in loan cycle 21 and she has been in the group since it was formed. With her loan, she intends to buy more merchandise: mascara, eye-shadows, lipsticks, eye-liners, foundations, creams, exfoliants etc. 

With her income, she supports her husband with the household expenses. In this way, they have managed to give a better quality of life to their two children who they love very much.

loans.use: to buy mascara, eye-shadows, lipsticks, eye-liners, foundations, creams, exfoliants

Her previous loan used to pay for the vehicle has been successfully repaid. Kristelle Lira took a new loan to cover motorcycle maintenance. 

She hopes to expand her business in order to have a better future with the family.

loans.use: to cover motor maintenance.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
This is Leonora, 43, and a resident of Araneta, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married and has children. She is managing the household while operating the business. She works hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Leonora operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5 worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP50,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Leonora dreams of having more customers and hopes to give her children a good life and education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOFLANI, un des villages de BAGUINEDA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixieme  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz avec  RAMATOU, 2ème personne debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau  de TIELE, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women, who average 34 years of age with four children each; they all live in polygamous families in Koflani, one of the villages in Baguineda, Mali's second administrative region. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can carry out their farming activities successfully during the winter season. They are on their sixth seasonal loan with the institution.

Ramatou, who is standing second from the left in the photo, grows rice. With her loan she is planning to buy inputs and seeds and also pay for labor to maintain 0.5 hectares of land. Once harvested, the produce is sold in Tiele to a customer base made up of retailers and consumers.

She is expecting to make an average profit of 145,000FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help out her husband with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to pay for labor and the purchase of buy inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita works hard to support her family. Margarita is widowed, and has a knitting business in the Philippines.

Margarita has asked for a 11,000 Philippine Pesos loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Margarita has been in this business for ten years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her knitting business

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She operates a tailoring business, making both men's and women's suits. She also operates a café which earns her extra income. She sells at the market to neighbors and passersby. 

With the KES20,000 she wants to purchase cloth, sewing thread, and needles. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, sewing thread, and needles.

Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide, mil et le riz avec  YAYI, 1ère personne assise  de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de TIELE, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women, who average 43 years of age with three children each; they all live in polygamous families in Komo, one of the villages in Tiele in Mali's second administrative region. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can carry out their farming activities successfully during the winter season. They are on their sixth seasonal loan with the institution.

Yayi, who is sitting on the far left of the photo, grows groundnut, millet and rice. With her loan she is planning to buy inputs and seeds and also pay for labor to maintain two hectares of land. Once harvested, the produce is sold in Tiele to a customer base made up of retailers and consumers.

She is expecting to make an average profit of 195,000FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help out her husband with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to pay for labor and the purchase of inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  4 membres du groupe  BENKADI 3  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SANANKOROBOUGOU, un des villages de BAGUINEDA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixieme  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le riz avec  FATOUMATA, 2ème personne debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau de TIELE, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The four members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women, who average 31 years of age with three children each; they all live in polygamous families in Sanankorobougou, one of the villages in Baguineda in Mali's second administrative region. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can carry out their farming activities successfully during the winter season. They are on their sixth seasonal loan with the institution.

Fatoumata, who is standing second from the left in the photo, grows groundnut and rice. With her loan she is planning to buy inputs and seeds and also pay for labor to maintain a hectare of land. Once harvested, the produce is sold in Tiele to a customer base made up of retailers and consumers.

She is expecting to make an average profit of 95,000FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help out her husband with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to pay for labor and the purchase of inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing and fish selling business in the Philippines. Fe has been in this business for ten years, and it provides her a good income. 

Fe has received a loan in the past, which she successfully repaid. She has now asked for an additional loan to build her business further. She would like to borrow 20,000 Philippines Pesos through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing and fish selling business.

Fe has been keeping her business going through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu is a 46-year-old farmer from Rafin Tabo. As a Babban Gona member, Salamatu, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Salamatu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, salamatu is ambitious and is aiming to reap a total of 80 bags this season. When asked, Salamatu said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; Isiyaka, Adamu,  and  Suzana. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  7 membres du groupe  BENKADI 3  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOMO, un des villages de TIELE, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le riz avec   MAFING, 1ère personne  assise de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de TIELE, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 190.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women, who average 26 years of age with two children each; they all live in polygamous families in Komo, one of the villages in Tiele in Mali's second administrative region. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can carry out their farming activities successfully during the winter season. They are on their sixth seasonal loan with the institution.

Mafing, who is sitting on the far right of the photo, grows groundnut and rice. With her loan she is planning to buy inputs and seeds and also pay for labor to maintain two hectares of land. Once harvested, the produce is sold in Tiele to a customer base made up of retailers and consumers.

She is expecting to make an average profit of 190,000FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help out her husband with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to pay for labor and the purchase of inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn 1 Thống Nhất - Quảng Vinh Group

texts.en:
Ven is 55 years old, and married with three children. She has worked as a rice farmer for ten years. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. 

Ven is the leader of a seven-member loan group, the Nhóm 01 Thôn 1 Thống Nhất - Quảng Vinh solidarity group. She is applying for a loan to buy more tools and supplies for farming rice. This is Vẹn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main challenge that Vẹn faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her improved business profits resulting from her loan, Vẹn hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to buy more tools and supplies for farming rice

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Emmanuel, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Emmanuel is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community” expressed Emmanuel. With this loan, Emmanuel is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
KIVA LENDERS! Meet David, an ambitious, hardworking and go-getting man who is 46 years of age. David is the proud father of seven children, who he really loves and cherishes a lot. He has been working as a farmer for the past nine years. 

David hails from the Litein area of Kenya, an area that has wonderful weather patterns favoring crop and animal farming. Through farming he has gained great experience, and all the farming techniques are at his fingertips. This gives him an advantage compared to other farmers who are still very new in farming. Through mixed farming David has been able to provide for his family and pay tuition fees for his seven children, although he has been facing challenges because of inadequate funds.

David is very passionate about dairy farming, and has even given his cow a nickname “Teta”. He really enjoys taking care of the cows, and also he enjoys selling milk a lot. 

Unfortunately, David lacks a proper dairy building where he can comfortably milk his cows and where his cows can rest. This is why he is seeking a loan of 35,000 Kenya Shillings to build a dairy building. Through the revenues from the dairy building, David is sure he can take care of his family and provide a secure future for his children, because his milk production levels will have gone up. A proper dairy building means that his cows will have a good place to rest and will not be affected with bad weather conditions, hence he will incur fewer expenses having to treat the cows. This money saved will be used to provide a secure future for his family.

David is very enterprising, and through accumulated profits he wants to start a larger dairy business where he will be selling milk to wholesalers, retailers and also selling milk products such as cream and butter, yoghurt and milk powder.

loans.use: To build a dairy building

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis tiene 72 años de edad vive en el cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolivar estado civil soltero el vive solo.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla Rural Las Guardias que se dedica a la agricultura.
Luis se dedica a la agricultura y siembra de maíz y mora.
El utilizara el dinero del crédito para la compra de fertilizantes para sus siembras ahora con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar su propio terreno que sin la ayuda de el no lo podía  realizar.
El realiza las compras en las  ciudades de Las Guardias.
Su sueños y metas que tiene es tener su propio negoció, en el tiempo libre le gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Luis, 72, lives in the rural community of San Miguel in the Bolivar province.  He is single and lives alone. 

He is a member of the solidarity group "Las Guardias" who work in agriculture.  Luis works in this area and plants corn and blackberries.

He will use the money to buy fertilizer for his crops.  Also, with the help of the loan he will be able to buy his own land which he wouldn't be able to do otherwise.

He buys his products in the cities of Las Guardias.

His dreams and goals are to have his own business.  In his free time he likes to relax.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
Las 13 integrantes de este comité son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren lo mejor para sus seres queridos, es por ello que decidieron unirse y trabajar todas de manera unida.
La Sra. Mirian es la presidenta de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de pollos a las brasas, que vende en su casa, y con lo cual ayuda con los ingresos del día a día, comenta que ya tiene una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella las comidas que hace, y de esa forma es conocida en el barrio.
Ella quiere seguir trabajando en el pequeño emprendimiento que tiene, y es por eso que pide este préstamo, para la compra de pollos por cantidad, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con su trabajo, luchando por los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
The 13 members of this committee are all women who are the head of their households.  They want the best for their loved ones and for this reason, they have decided to work together.

Mirian is the president of this group.  She sells barbecued chicken from her house.  This allows her to help with the daily expenses.  She tells us that she already has a good group of customers who always buy the food she makes.  This means that she is well-known in the neighborhood.

She wants to carry on working in the small business that she has.  This is why she is asking for a loan.  She wants to buy chicken in bulk quantity, so she can continue to work and strive to earn an income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy chicken to cook and sell.

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 51 años de edad, es soltera y vive en San Juan de Lurigancho junto a su familia.
Es una persona que se esfuerza día a día para brindar a su familia un mejor futuro. Al ser madre soltera y no tener ningún tipo de apoyo ella tuvo que ver la manera de velar por sus hijos sola. Afortunadamente pudo salir adelante y hoy en día su familia se siente muy orgullosa de ella y muy agradecidos. Actualmente y desde hace más de 5 años se dedica a la venta de mercería en el Mercado principal de la zona donde vive. Le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajadora, emprendedora, siempre brindando una excelente atención a los clientes.
Maria está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá remodelar su vivienda como pintarrajear las paredes, arreglar el piso y el techo, de esta manera estará mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia porque no contraerán enfermedades en este invierno. Con ello seguirá luchando para más adelante poder cumplir uno de sus más grandes sueños: "Poder ver a sus hijos como exitosos profesionales".
texts.en:
Maria is a hard-working woman of 51 years' of age.  She is single and lives in San Juan de Lurigancho with her family.

She is a person who strives daily to provide her family with a better future. As she is a single mother, she doesn't receive any type of support.  For this reason, she decided to find a way to take care of her children on her own. Fortunately, she was able to start making a living and today her family are very proud of her and grateful.

For more than five years she has been selling sewing supplies on the main market in the area where she lives. It is going well because she is a responsible person who is hard-working and enterprising, offering an excellent service to her customers.

She is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their support, she can make improvements to her home, such as painting the walls and repairing the floor and roof.  In this way, she is improving her family's quality of life because they won't suffer from so many illnesses this winter. 

With this help she can continue to strive for one of her ultimate dreams: "to be able to see her children grow up to be successful working professionals".

loans.use: to improve her home by painting the walls and repairing the roof and floor.

loans.name: Miguel De Jesús

texts.es:
Miguel de 31 años de edad, estudió hasta 3° grado debido a la situación económica, se le era difícil continuar.  Está acompañado y su pareja le ayuda en el trabajo agrícola, tienen dos hijos de 9 y 7 años de edad y vive su padre con ellos.

 Miguel se dedica a la agricultura desde muy pequeño, oficio que aprendió con su padre, cuenta que por ser el  primero de 5 hermanos le tocó trabajar duro, pero hoy le agradece a su padre que le haya enseñado a trabajar, pues de ese oficio está sacando a su familia adelante. Comienza su día a las 4:30 a.m.  donde se levanta a preparar su equipo de trabajo, y se encamina para su trabajo donde tiene que caminar unos 25 minutos para llegar, luego trabaja 6 horas y regresa por la tarde y trabaja en hortalizas.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar una yunta de bueyes para trabajar. 


Sus sueños son que sus hijos se preparen en una profesión universitaria, que su hijo pequeño sea un futbolista profesional, construir una casa de ladrillo, pues la que tiene es de lamina y pagar el crédito para tener las puertas abiertas.
texts.en: Miguel is 31 years old and studied only up to the third form because his family was very poor, which made it difficult to stay in school. He is married, and his wife helps him with the farm. They have two children, aged 9 and 7, and Miguel's father lives with the family. Miguel started being a farmer at very tender age and learned the trade from his father. He explains that, since he was the eldest of five sons, it was his lot to work very hard, but he now thanks his father for teaching him everything, otherwise he could never have supported his family. Miguel starts working at 4.30 am. He prepares his tools, then walks 25 minutes to work, works for about six hours, and comes back in the afternoon to tend to his vegetable plot. He asks Credicampo for a loan in order to buy a yoke and a pair of oxen to till the land. He dreams of seeing his sons through university and hopes the youngest will become a professional football player. He would also like to buy a brick house, since their current house is made of metal sheets. He intends to repay his loan so as not be burdened by debt.

loans.use: to buy a yoke and a pair of oxen to till the land.

loans.name: Sinthya Verónica

texts.es:
Sinthya  de 25 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja como jornalero, tienen 2 hijos de 5 años y 3 meses de edad y nadie más vive con ellos.

 Sinthya dice que desde que tiene 8 años de edad, se ha dedicado al negocio;  fue su mamá, quién le inculcó que aprendiera a ganarse la vida, ella siempre le dijo que era bueno estudiar, pero que también era bueno aprender a trabajar, hoy con su pareja desde hace un año tienen una tienda, la inició con $100. 00 y cada vez le fue invirtiendo más.

Su día comienza a las 5:00 a.m. Pues sus clientes ha esa hora comienzan a llegar, y cierra su tienda a las 6:00 p.m. aunque a veces se siente cansada pero, su sueño es sacar a su familia adelante por eso se esfuerza cada día.

El crédito será invertido, en la compra de más productos de la canasta básica, como frijol, arroz, aceite, jabón y más.

Sus sueños son ver a sus hijos triunfar en una carrera universitaria, llegar a tener una tienda grande, construir su propia casa ( hoy vive en casa de su mamá ) y con la ganancia espera pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Sinthya, 25, studied until the end of high school.  She is in a relationship.  Her partner works as a laborer.  They have two children; one is five and the other is three months old.  They live on their own.

She has been working in business since she was eight.  Her mother instilled in her the need to earn a living.  She always taught her the importance of studying, but also of working.  Now, together with her partner, they have a store which they set up with $100. They have been investing little by little in it ever since.

She starts her day at 5:00 am because her customers start to arrive at that time.  She closes at 6:00 pm.  Although she sometimes feels tired, she works hard every day because her dream is to provide a good quality of life for her family.

The loan will be used to invest in basic grocery products such as frijoles, rice, oil, soap and more.

She dreams of seeing her children study a successful degree at university.  She would also like to have a bigger store, build her own house (at the moment she is living in her mother's house) and with the profits she will pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy frijoles, rice, oil, soap and more.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
Virgen del Rosario es un grupo bastante trabajador y con iniciativa, está en su octavo ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de las señoras están en un nivel rojo, por lo que deben esforzarse un poco más.
Justamente, una de ellas es la Sra. Gloria, una persona que quiere mejorar y salir adelante, cuenta que ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos entre sus conocidas y vecinas, y que de esa forma y poco a poco se está haciendo conocida y tiene mayor clientela.
Con su préstamo ella quiere comprar productos en mayor cantidad para abaratar los costos, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda, ya que podrá comprar cosméticos variados, y así tener una mayor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientas. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Virgen del Rosario is a hard-working group that shows initiative. It is in its eighth lending cycle of the women's committee programme. Group members replied to a survey to know where they are on the poverty scale: three of them are in the red, which means they need to make extra efforts. One of these three is Gloria, whose dream is to improve herself and get ahead in life. She sells cosmetics to her neighbours and acquaintances and is gradually expanding her circle of customers. She wants to buy products in bulk in order to drive down costs, which would also help her acquire a greater variety of cosmetics to offer her customers. She is grateful for this opportunity and knows it will help her tremendously.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les  9 membres du groupe  BENKADI  4  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOFLANI, un des villages de BAGUINEDA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le riz avec  MAH BEKAYE, 2ème  personne debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau  de TIELE, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The nine members of the Benkadi 4 Group are married women with an average age of 30 and an average of three children each. They all live within polygamous family frameworks in Koflani, one of the villages found in Baguinéda in Koulikoro Region, the second administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution so that they can see through their agricultural activities during the winter period. This is their sixth loan with Soro Yiriwaso. The group's main produce is peanuts and rice. The group's representative is Mah Bekaye, the woman standing second from the left in the back row in the photo. With this loan, she is planning on purchasing farming inputs and seeds, as well as paying for the labour costs to maintain one hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in Tiélé to a customer base made up of resellers and consumers. She is planning on making a profit of 95,000 FCFA with each harvest, which will allow her to pay off the loan and help her husband with their daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs, farming inputs and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a perimeter wall around his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install doors in her house and repair the walls.

loans.name: Nhóm 02-Kiều Đại 2-Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hà operates a food stall selling tofu and soy milk. Hà has been involved in this business for five years. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more beans to make tofu and soy milk to sell.

Hà is 50 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Hà is the group leader of the Nhóm 02-Kiều Đại 2-Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of eight members. 

This is Hà's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Hà faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hà hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more beans to make tofu and soy milk

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Emily works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pre-paid mobile load.  

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

Emily is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

Emily has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken and feed.

loans.name: Al-Asel Group

texts.en:
Al-Asel is a group which is comprised of  four women members who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB.

Mona is the leader of the group. She is a 37-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 15, and the youngest one is 2 years old. She has a diploma in the nursing. Now she works as a nurse in a hospital. Her husband is a worker and doesn't have a fixed income, and Mona shares him in the most of the expenses of the family. They love each other very much and live in a good relationship. Their house lacks many of food materials. 

For this reason, she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food materials for the needs of her children, and to make  delicious food for them. 

Mona looks forward to preparing her house with all kinds of foods materials in order to save a secure future for her children. She plans to open a saving account in AMB for her children.

loans.use: to purchase food materials for the needs of her children and to make a delicious food for them.

loans.name: Edinson De Jesus

texts.es:
Edinson, es un hombre carismático, activo y servicial. 
Ser padre de dos hijos, fue el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a sus hijos. 
Desde hace aproximadamente 22 años, viene dedicándose a la comercialización de mercancía variada para todo tipo de clientes, de muy buena calidad y a excelentes precios, lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el sector y lograr la trayectoria que tiene. 
La mayor ventaja que encuentra es que es un oficio que le permite conocer muchos lugares y personas, es algo que le gusta y le apasiona.
Esto lo impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer sus inventarios, pues comprará mercancía como jeans, blusas, accesorios para vestir, entre otros al por mayor, así podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes; esto le ayudará a mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. 
Edinson manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir haciendo lo que le apasiona, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en un gran distribuidor de mercancía y generar oportunidades de empleo, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Edinson is a charismatic, active and helpful man. He is the father of two children, so he works tirelessly day to day to earn a living whatever way he can which allows him to provide for them. 
  
Since about 22 years ago, he has been selling varied high-quality goods at good prices to all kinds of customers.  This has made him well-known in the sector and seen his business grow. 

The biggest advantage of his work is that it allows him to visit lots of different places and meet new people.  This is something he likes and is passionate about.

This has lead him to ask for a loan to strengthen his inventory.  He will invest in goods such as jeans, blouses, clothing accessories and other things at wholesalers.  This will help him satisfy customer demand and improve the income he generates.  

He tells us that his age does not stop him from doing what he enjoys.  For this reason, he is always setting himself new targets; one of them being to become a large distributor of goods and create employment opportunities for others.  This will help him improve the standard of living for his family, too.

loans.use: to buy goods to increase his stock.

loans.name: Benkadi  A Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI A  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOMO, un des villages de TIELE, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide, le mil et le riz avec MARIAM, 1ère personne debout  de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de TIELE, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

They all live within polygamous family frameworks in Komo, one of the villages found in Tiélé in Koulikoro Region, the second administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution so that they can see through their agricultural activities during the winter period. This is their sixth loan with Soro Yiriwaso. Mariam, the woman standing to the at the end of the back row to the left-hand side of the photo, grows peanuts, millet and rice. With this loan, she is planning on purchasing farming inputs and seeds, as well as paying for the labour costs to maintain two hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in Tiélé to a customer base made up of resellers and consumers. She is planning on making a profit of 195,000 FCFA with each harvest, which will allow her to pay off the loan and help her husband with their daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs, farming inputs and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy products.

loans.name: Grupo Leo Group

texts.es:
En un municipio de Oaxaca, zona auténticamente cañera, también posee una vista impactante ya que en ocasiones, desde la sierra o incluso desde la carretera se alcanza a ver el volcán más alto de México: el Pico de Orizaba a pesar de estar en otro estado.

En este municipio se formó recientemente un grupo el cual lleva por nombre “Grupo Leo” sus integrantes son:

Beatriz- Venta De Pollo, Leovigilda-Merceria, Yadira- Venta De Abarrotes, Guadalupe- Venta De Dulces, Josefina- Venta De Comida, Teresa- Venta De Comida, Florentina- Venta De Queso, Maria- Venta De Calzado Por Catalogo y Bonifacio- venta de plátanos.

Don Bonifacio quien ha dedicado ya 23 años a vender platanos asados, al principio los preparaba en casa y salía a vender, hoy sale con su carrito (muy similar a los carritos de los hot dogs) por las calles de distintas localidades, donde muchas personas le compran pues los platanos son asados al momento. El carrito lleva los leños prendidos solo es cuestión de colocar los platanos. Al principio, la actividad era un poco difícil para don Boni, como es conocido, pero ahora ha realizado las adecuaciones pertinentes al carrito de manera que le cuesta menos trabajo empujarlo y llevarlo por las calles. "Con el paso de los años he conocido  muchos lugares a donde he ido a vender". Con las ganancias obtenidas y con su préstamo don Boni compra mercancía (platanos, crema, queso). "La leña la busco yo mismo de la misma manera le doy mantenimiento a mi carrito". Él agradece a VisionFund por brindarle una oportunidad para seguir prosperando en el negocio.
texts.en:
In the town of Oaxaca, a sugar cane area, you can enjoy some breath-taking scenery.  From some parts of the road, you can see the mountain range and the highest volcano in Mexico, called the Pico de Orizaba.  

In this area, the credit group "Grupo Leo" was recently formed.  The members are:

Beatriz, who sells chickens; Leovigilda, who sells sewing supplies; Guadalupe, who sells candy; Josefina, who sells food; Teresa, who sells food; Florentina, who sells cheese; Maria, who sells footwear from catalogues; and Bonifacio, who sells bananas.

Bonifacio has been selling fried bananas for 23 years.  When he started, he prepared them at home and then sold them on the streets.  Nowadays he takes a cart out with him (one that is similar to hot dog carts) on the streets in the local areas and he prepares the food on the spot. The cart already has a cooker, so it is just a case of putting the bananas on the grill. 

At the beginning, it was difficult, but "Don Boni", as he is known, made some adjustments to his cart so it is now easier to push through the streets. As time has gone by, he has visited many places where he has sold his products. 

With the income he generates and with the loan, he will buy supplies (bananas, cream, cheese). He gets his firewood himself and looks after his cart on his own. He is grateful to "VisionFund" for being able to continue to prosper in his business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, milk, cream and cheese.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn 2 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyến works in agriculture, raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Tuyến is 39 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives with her two dependents in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Tuyến is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 thôn 2 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of three members. This is Tuyến's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

The main hardship that Tuyến faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tuyến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Umi

texts.en:
Umi is a 42-year-old married woman who supports a family of five children. Her husband adds an additional income to cater for their daily needs. Umi has been a juice and snacks vendor saleswoman for 10 years, earning an income of KES. 10,000 at the end of every month.

Umi is now servicing her third loan of KES. 15,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this entire amount to purchase fruits: mangoes, apples, watermelons, oranges, passion fruit, pineapple, bananas and avocados to add to her stock, which seems to be running out.

Umi plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children, and hopes to become a successful businesswoman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy mangoes, pineapple, and other fruit to make fresh juices

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es:
Santos es un hombre de 66 años de edad, no estudio, está acompañado desde hace 40 años. Su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y le colabora al esposo en los trabajos agrícolas. Tuvieron 4 hijos de los cuales 3 tienen hogares aparte y solo uno está con ellos, quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar. 

Santos se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, se ha dedicado a estas dos actividades desde hace 40 años el trabajo lo aprendió solo, ya que él no tuvo papá para que le enseñara la labor y decide dedicarse a esta labor  porque no encontró otra forma de ayudar a su familia. El lugar de trabajo está cerca de su casa. En el trabajo se involucra la esposa de él, quien le ha colaborado desde que están juntos.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar dos terneros. Para utilizar el residuo de la cosecha de maíz y frijol y así ponerlo a trabajar atreves de la alimentación de estos bovinos que en el corto plazo le servirán.  

Los sueños de él son seguir trabajando para su familia y seguir sacándolos adelante. Para su familia espera que ellos logren sus objetivos trabajando y luchando por ellos el préstamo le ayudara a tener un comienzo, por el cual más adelante tendrá un ingreso aprovechando los insumos que él mismo produce a través del cultivo agrícola.
texts.en: Santos is 66 years old, never went to school, and has been married for 40 years. His wife is a domestic worker and also helps with the farm. They have four children, three of which live away now. The fourth one lives with them and takes care of the household. Santos is a farmer and also rears cattle. He learned the ropes by himself and has been in this line of work for 40 years. He is an orphan, so there was no one to teach him his trade. He picked his profession as the only means he saw of providing for his family. He works close to his house. His wife helps with the farm and has been doing so since the beginning. He asks for a loan to buy two calves. His plan is to use discards from the crops (broad beans and sweetcorn) to feed the calves and put them to work. He dreams of continuing to support his family and improving their standard of living. He hopes, for the sake of his family, that his hard work and his efforts will pay off. He sees the loan as the seed of a new source of income that he would develop thanks to his own resources from the farm.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

With this loan, she is planning on purchasing farming inputs and seeds, as well as paying for the labour costs to maintain one hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in Tiélé to a customer base made up of resellers and consumers. She is planning on making a profit of 95,000 FCFA with each harvest, which will allow her to pay off the loan and help her husband with their daily living expenses.
