After the harvest, the produce will be sold in Ouélessébougou to a customer base made up of resellers and consumers. She is planning on making a profit of 95,000 FCFA with each harvest, which will allow her to pay off the loan and help her husband with their daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs, farming inputs and seeds

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José de 36 años de edad, no estudio, está acompañado su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen en común 4 hijos los cuales todos son menores de edad y están estudiando educación básica,  en casa de él viven 6 personas.

José sea dedicado a la agricultura desde hace 18 años. Lo aprendió desde que estaba muy pequeño,  ya que su padre le enseño pues ellos han sido una familia que desde siempre se han dedicado a esta actividad, además de la agricultura el cliente se dedica al trabajo de jornal. Quien lo busca para trabajar  él asiste y es una fuente de ingreso más que tiene.

El lugar de trabajo está a dos cuadras de su casa, para llegar camina, lo que más se dificulta al cliente es llevar los insumos que necesita para cultivar, por lo que paga carro particular para hacerlo llegar. El horario de trabajo es de 6 horas al día aproximadamente.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar abonos, semilla y pagar el alquiler del terreno en donde cultiva. El préstamo vendrá a mejorar su producción agrícola,  porque podrá cultivar a tiempo y tendrá los  insumos necesarios para hacerlo.


Los sueños para su  negocio, son seguir trabajando fuerte para seguir sacando adelante a su familia. Para su familia sueña que sus hijos logren estudiar algo.
texts.en:
José is 36 years old. He didn't go to school. He is married and his wife is a housewife. They have 4 children together, all of them minors who are in elementary school. Six people live in their home. 

José has worked in agriculture since he was 18 years old.  He learned about it since he was very young, because his father taught him. They have always been a family that has worked at this activity. In addition to the agriculture, he works as a day laborer for a person who hires him for help. This is another source of income.

His workplace is two blocks from his house. He gets there on foot. His biggest difficulty is transporting the materials he needs for cultivation and he pays a private driver to do this. His work schedule is approximately 6 hours a day. 

The loan he is asking CREDICAMPO for is to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for rent on the land he cultivates. The loan will improve his agricultural production because he will be able to plant on time and he will have the materials he needs to do it. 

His dreams for his business are to keep working hard to get his family ahead. For his family, his dream is for his children to get an education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds as well as to pay for renting the land he cultivates.

loans.name: La Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad de Oaxaca en la parte más retirada de la comunidad se ha formado un grupo llamado “La Virgen De Guadalupe” las integrantes decidieron ponerle ese nombre debido a la gran devoción que tienen. Las integrantes tienen distintas actividades económicas para ayudar a su familia:

Eugenia- Venta de Borregos, Laura- Servicio De Carga, Petra-Venta De Baterías Para La Cocina, Cristina- Venta De Colchas Y Sábanas, Alejandra- Venta De Ropa, Diana Laura- Venta De Ropa, Merced-Venta De Cosméticos, María De Lourdes- Venta de maíz y tortillas hechas a mano.

Eugenia se ha dedicado desde hace ya 12 años a la crianza y venta de borregos, vivir en una localidad donde se pueden criar borregos sin tenerlos encerrados es algo favorable pues cuando los lleva a pastar, los animales realmente pueden disfrutar del lugar, el aire y la libertad. "Y yo me distraigo al observar la naturaleza y disfruto día a día el salir a pastorear los borregos". Esta vez Eugenia quiere invertir en la compra de borregas para poder tener más crías y más ganancias. Las utilidades de sus ventas las ha invertido en los gastos del hogar, las cuotas escolares y gastos personales.

"Gracias a VisionFund México por hacer posible nuestros sueños" comenta Eugenia muy entusiasmada.
texts.en:
In a community in Oaxaca in the most remote part of the community a group called “La Virgen De Guadalupe” has formed. The members decided to give it that name due to their great devotion. The members have different economic activities to help their families.

Eugenia- selling sheep, Laura- cargo service, Petra-selling kitchen batteries, Cristina- selling blankets and sheets, Alejandra-selling clothes, Diana Laura- selling clothes, Merced-selling cosmetics, María De Lourdes-selling corn and handmade tortillas. 

Since she was 12, Eugenia has raised and sold sheep. Living in a place where she can raise sheep without having them penned in is favorable because when she takes them to graze, the animals really enjoy the place, the air, and freedom. "And I like looking at nature and enjoying going out day to day to graze the sheep." This time, wants to invest in buying sheep to be able to have more lambs and more earnings. The profits from her sales are invested in the household expenses, school fees and personal expenses.

"Thanks to VisionFund México for making our dreams possible" Eugenia says, very enthusiastically.

loans.use: to buy sheep to produce lambs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an LCD television.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena es soltera, vive en la ciudad de San Ignacio, está en el cuarto año de la carrera de ciencias contables, aspira con terminar su carrera y ser una profesional exitosa, poder brindar sus servicios a quienes lo necesiten.
Sueña con ser una profesional independiente que tenga su propio local.
Pide este préstamo para pagar sus cuotas de universidad y así seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Lorena is single and lives in the city of San Ignacio. She is in the fourth year of her degree program in Accounting Sciences. Lorena aspires to finish her degree and become a successful professional so that she can provide her services to those who need them. She also dreams of becoming an independent professional who has her own office.

Lorena is requesting this loan so that she can pay her university fees. This will allow her to continue her studies just as before.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn Trung 01 Group

texts.en:
Mrs Sử operates a food stall where she sells fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Sử is 49 years old and married with nine children. Sử is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 thôn Trung 01 solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

Sử lives in a rural town in the Quang Xuong district, which is in the Thanh Hoa province.

In 2007, Sử joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Sử has successfully repaid eight loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Sử has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Sử faces in her business is a lack of capital.

In the future, Sử hopes for her business to do well, to travel and take a vacation in the country, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mary Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. She earns additional income from farming rice.  Mary Grace is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her vegetable-vending business.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is very thankful for the support she received from the previous loan, which helped her to boost her business of selling books. She is now requesting another loan of KES 30,000 to buy another set of new books for sale. Sophia thanks Yehu and Kiva as she can now support her family well.

loans.use: to buy another set of new books to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Djekafo Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  2 membres du groupe  DJEKAFO III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BANAMBANI, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le riz  avec  SITAN, 2ème  personne debout  de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau  de OUELESSEBOUGOU, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The two members of Djekafo III Group are married women with an average age of 42 and four children.  They both live in polygamous families in Banambani, one of the villages in Ouelessebougou, the second largest administrative region in Mali.  They work with the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the organization. Sitan, the person standing at the left the photo, grows crops of groundnuts and rice.  With her loan, she plans to buy inputs and seeds and to pay for the labor costs required to maintain one hectare of land. After the harvest, the output will be sold at Ouelessebougou to a clientele of resellers and consumers.  She plans to earn an average profit of 95,000 FCFA per season.  This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs, inputs, and seeds.

loans.name: Danaya I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DANAYA I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à MANA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide, le riz et le mil avec   ELIZABETHE, 3ème personne  debout de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Danaya I group are married women with an average age of 41 years and an average of 5 children each. They all live in polygamous families in Mana, one of the villages of Ouelessebougou, the 2nd administrative region of Mali.

The women have partnered with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to better manage their farming businesses during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the organization.

Elizabethe, the third person pictured standing from right to left in the photo, grows ground nuts, rice, and millet. With her loan, she plans on purchasing supplies, seeds, and paying for the labor costs to maintain 1 hectare. She sells her crops at the market after the harvest, to a customer base made up of resellers and consumers.

Elizabethe plans to earn an average income of 195,000 francs CFA per crop. This will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs, supplies, and seeds

loans.name: Nhóm 05 Thôn Trung 01 -Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Bưởi operates a food stall selling fish. Bưởi has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Bưởi faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Bưởi is 55 years old and she is married and has four children. Bưởi is the group leader of the Nhóm 05 Thôn trung 01 -Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

In 2007, Bưởi  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Bưởi has successfully repaid eight loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Bưởi hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain a successful business and for her business to do well,

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: Medy Rose

texts.en:
Medy Rose is 22 years old and a single woman. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Medy Rose has a food vending business in the Philippines and she has been in this business for two years.

Medy Rose requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer operates a restaurant. Here again she is requesting a loan of  KES 25,000. She wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour and sugar. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support of the previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Sakthi Shg - Solamadevi Group

texts.en:
Dhanalakshmi is leader of the Sakthi Self-Help Group, which is managed by local NGO People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India. 

Dhanalakshmi hails from Solamadevi village. She lives in her own house with her children and husband, Karunanithi. Her husband is a small, marginal farmer who works on daily wages.
 
Dhanalakshmi wants to purchase a smokeless stove because it uses less wood and hardly emits any smoke. This means less carbon dioxide and it  saves time and labour. The traditional stove emits a lot of smoke, and it leads to air pollution, deforestation etc.

The other members of the group are requesting a loan to purchase smokeless stoves to have a healthier life.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Nhóm 07-Phố 7-Quảng Thắng Group

texts.en:
Sự works in agriculture, raising poultry. Sự has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Sự faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Sự is 31 years old and she is married and has two children.

Sự is the group leader of the Nhóm 07-Phố 7-Quảng Thắn solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

This is the first loan for Sự with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Sự hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thái Hòa, Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Thêu works in agriculture, raising pigs. Thêu has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in future.

Thêu is 40 years old and she is married and has two children. Thêu is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 Thái Hòa, Hưng Lộc solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In 2013, Thêu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thêu has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thêu hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Nhóm 7 Thôn 2 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Thủy works in agriculture raising poultry and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is 45 years old and she is married with two children. Thủy lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Thủy is the group leader of the Nhóm 7 Thôn 2 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of three members. In 2013, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profits, Thủy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn 08 Quảng Thái Group

texts.en:
Lan is 31 years old and she is married with two children. She works in agriculture, raising poultry, and has been involved in this business for nine years. Lan is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. 

Lan is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 Thôn 08 Quảng Thái solidarity group, which consists of three members. This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital.

With her business profits, Lan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 10 Thôn Bắc 07 - Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Phương is 41 years old and she is married with two children. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Phương is applying for a loan to purchase fish to resell. The main hardship that she faces in her business is a lack of capital.

Phương is the group leader of the Nhóm 10 Thôn Bắc 07 - Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of three members. In 2012, Phương  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid eight loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profits, Phương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn 2 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Hiền works in agriculture, raising poultry. Hiền has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hiền faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Hiền is 40 years old and she is married and has three children. Hiền is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 thôn 2 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members. Hiền lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is the first loan for Hiền with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Nhóm 08 Thôn 10 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Hiền works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Hiền has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. 

Hiền is 36 years old, and she is married with three children. Hiền is the group leader of the Nhóm 08 Thôn 10 Quảng Lưu solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

This is Hiền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta operates a retail store that sells a variety of food and home-use products. Aside from this, she also raises pigs and sells them in town to earn more income. 

Her previous loan used for this business was successfully repaid. 

She plants bananas and variety of vegetables in her backyard, knowing this gives produce in return. She took a new loan recently to buy fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Wenifreda

texts.en:
As a  parent of five children, Wenifreda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.  

Wenifreda is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

Wenifreda has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Criselda has been in this business for 19 years now.

Criselda requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Cherlita

texts.en:
Cherlita is 49 years old and has five children. Cherlita is married, and two children of her children are currently in school.

Cherlita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Cherlita requested a 10,000 PHP (Phiippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Cherlita has been raising pigs for 21 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cherlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization. She joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her  children: Yahaya, Musa, and Audi. Rahila is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty.

For the first time, Rahila will have access to quality inputs, such as fertilizer and seeds. Without this loan, she would be subjected to buying these products on the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Rahila can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14, and earn up to $2,000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.

When asked how she plans to spend the income she will make this year as a Babban Gona member, Rahila said, “I plan to use the money to expand my farmland.” Rahila is not thinking about this year alone; she said that her long-term goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving her goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs, such as fertilizer and seeds, in order to double her income and yield.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
BADENYA est un groupe de l’association KOTOGNONTALA de (BAMANAKING), OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles la vente de restaurant à l’image de FATOU qui est la deuxième personne debout de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Ouelessebougou dans la  préfecture de KATI (Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités de restaurant : poissons et  de atiéké. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième  prêt solidaire. 
FATOU, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à  OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de restaurant. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité importante de poissons et atiéké.  Elle s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à  OUELESSEBOUGOU en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité vente de restauration.
texts.en: Badenya is a group from the Kotognontala association in Bamanaking, Ouelessebougou. It gathers women who know each other from family and neighborhood connections.  They have an average age of 43. They are married with an average of five children. They conduct different businesses including the restaurant run by Fatou, the second person from right to left in the photo.  They live in large traditional families in Ouelessebougou, in the prefecture of Kati, in the region of Koulikoro, in the republic of Mali.  They have run small businesses for several years and their restaurant that serves fish and atiéké (a side dish made from cassava) is very popular. In order to better serve growing customer demand, the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program.  They are on their second loan. Fatou, who is president of the group and very well-known in Ouelessebougou, excels at restaurant operation.  She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of fish and atiéké.  She buys supplies in Ouelessebougou and on-site from wholesellers and resells her products in Ouelessebougou, for cash and credit, to a mixed clientele.  She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA, a sum that will enable her to repay the loan and to reinvest in her restaurant business.

loans.use: to operate a restaurant.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn Bắc 07 - Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Chanh is 52 years old and she is married with two children. She operates a food stall selling fish and she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Chanh is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell. The main hardship that she faces in her business is a lack of capital.

Chanh is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 Thôn Bắc 07 - Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of six members. In 2007, Chanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid eight loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Chanh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Thôn 2 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Đương works in agriculture, raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Đương faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Đương is 49 years old and she is married and has four children. Đương is the group leader of the Nhóm 03 thôn 2 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members. Đương lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is the first loan for Đương with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Đương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn 09 Quảng Thái Group

texts.en:
Yến operates a food stall/restaurant, selling fish. Yến has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is applying for a loan to purchase fish to resell. 

Yến is 37 years old, and she is married with three children. Yến is the group leader of the  Nhóm 02 Thôn 09 Quảng Thái solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

This is Yến's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Yến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Wendell

texts.en: Wendell is studying at the university because he wants to become a successful engineer in the future. He joined GDMPC and has taken a new loan to pay his tuition fee for the first semester. Wendell is hopeful that he will succeed in achieving his dreams and he is determined to work seriously in his studies. He is thankful to GDMPC for creating this product that is a big help to students who deserve to become what they want to be in the future.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena has a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit-vending business in the area to raise her profits.

She comes to you again, requesting another loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings. She wants to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw

loans.name: Rosejane

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Rosejane works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Rosejane is borrowing 7,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Itagüí y se dedica a la preparación alimentos como empanadas, tortas de carne, buñuelos y pasteles.
Estos alimentos los venden principalmente en la plaza de mercado en su carrito de comidas.
Es una mujer muy tenaz y trabajadora, con un gran corazón y unos deseos inmensos de progresar.
Blanca desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de una rampa que le permita transportar su carro de una manera más fácil, adicionalmente desea comprar una sombrilla para instalarla en su carrito de comidas.
Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca is an unassuming and hard-working woman who has dedicated a big part of her life to looking after her children. She lives in the town of Itagui and works preparing food such as turnovers, meat pies, sweet fritters and pastries. She sells this food in the market square, from a food trolley.
Blanca is tenacious and industrious, with a big heart and a tremendous desire to get ahead in life. She wants to increase her food sales and work more comfortably. That is why she is asking for a loan to purchase a ramp to transport her trolley more easily. In addition, she wants to buy an umbrella to set it up in her food trolley. This loan will allow her to push her business forward and obtain the necessary income to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy a ramp and an umbrella.

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka is a 37-year-old divorced woman. She lives with her school-age son in Tskneti. 

Maka works as a saleslady and gets a small monthly salary, which is not enough to cover everyday costs. 

Maka married early and wasn’t able to get education and so she has no university degree. She has a great desire to be involved in a trading business. Maka couldn’t request a loan from financial institutions until the Start Up program began, which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. 

She requested a loan of 600 USD to begin trading with clothing and bed-clothing. She plans to go to Turkey and purchase the products at wholesale prices and then resell them at higher prices. She has already chosen a place where she will resell clothes. This will give her a chance to earn more income and she will provide a better future for her son.

loans.use: to purchase clothes at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi  Luz Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario integrado por  tres socias laboriosas y coordinado por la señora Milagro de 39 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijos quienes han sido su motivación para su superación, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa nueva en su comunidad, y solicita el crédito para la compra de  mercadería como es jean para damas, jean para caballeros, talladores, camisetas, licras, bóxer, short, etc. Los créditos anteriores le han ayudado en su superación personal, además que ha logrado la mejora en su vivienda. Las otras socias son las señoras Marta de 49 años de edad, comerciante de frutas y verduras en el mercado de la municipalidad, y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de aguacate y tamarindo, y Angélica de 22 años de edad propietaria de una min pulpería en su domicilio y solicita el crédito para la compra de productos varios como es aceite, arroz, golosinas, pan, café, tomate, etc., de manera que podrá diversificar los productos ofrecidos
texts.en:
The solidarity group is formed by three hard working members and is coordinated by Milagro, who is 39 years old, married and with three children who have been her motivation to get ahead. Milagro works selling new clothes in her community and she is asking for a loan to purchase merchandise such as jeans for men and women, tank tops, t-shirts, stretch pants, boxer shorts, etc.
Her previous loans have helped with her personal growth and she has made improvements to her home.
The other group members are Marta, 49, who sells fruits and vegetables in the local market and is asking for a loan to purchase crops of avocado and tamarind, and Angelica, 22, who owns a grocery store in her home and is asking for a loan to purchase products such as oil, rice, candy, bread, coffee, tomato, etc, in order to diversify her supply.

loans.use: to purchase jeans for men and women, tank tops, t-shirts, stretch pants, boxer shorts, etc.

loans.name: Donyor

texts.en: Donyor lives in a rural area. He is married and brings up three non-adult children. He is a responsible father. Donyor has been busy with an agriculture business more than 10 years. He has a dehkan farm (an individual or family farm). Donyor grows potatoes and crops. His wife helps him to grow agriculture products. He also feeds cattle. Donyor is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy mineral fertilizers for his land for the second sowing season. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers for his land for the second sowing season

loans.name: Nhóm 06 Thôn Bắc 07-Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phượng operates a food stall, selling fish. Phượng has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Phượng faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Phượng is 30 years old, and she is married with two children. Phượng is the group leader of the Nhóm 06 Thôn Bắc 07-Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

This is Phượng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Phượng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Thôn Bắc 07 - Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên operates a food stall, selling fish. Liên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Liên is 40 years old, and she is married with three children. Liên is the group leader of the Nhóm 03 Thôn Bắc 07 - Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In 2010, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid eight loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inputs and to pay for labor

loans.name: Diona

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Diona works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and fishing. Diona is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Diona has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Estrellas De Llanquichapi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS DE LLANQUICHAPI” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margarita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan esta en relación con la pesca.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Margarita es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pescado; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres desde niña, ya que apoyaba en el negocio familiar, con el pasar del tiempo decide independizar su negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para alimento en tiempo de sequía (compra de red) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el seguro de vida que ofrece la institución.
texts.en: The A.C. “ESTRELLAS DE LLANQUICHAPI” will start the second loan cycle at Pro Mujer as part of the Focal Center of Achacachi. It is composed by eight members and is directed by a board of directors where Margarita is the president. The businesses of the members of this communal association are related to fishing. The loan they will get will benefit small women microentrepeneurs, where Margarita is a member. She states that it is the first time she forms part of Pro Mujer. She joined after being invited by a promoter of the institution who went to visit her at home. Currently she has a business selling fish. She says that she learned this business from her parents since she was a child because she helped in the family business. Over the course of time she decided to be independent in her business. The loan she is getting now is for food during drought time (to buy fishing net) that she will purchase from the women sellers in the city of La Paz, and later she will implement it in her work space. This way of work allows her to produce resources to support her family because she lives in common law marriage and has three children. When she is asked why she lives Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the life insurance offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy fishing net

loans.name: Isiya

texts.en: Isiya is a 40-year-old farmer from Rafin-Tabo.  As a Babban Gona member, Isiya , is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Isiya can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Isiya is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Isiya said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; Istifanus, Hosiya,  and  Elisha, and in 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Surajo

texts.en: Surajo is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Surajo joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Yusuf, Sefillashi, and  Salisu. Surajo is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Surajo will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Surajo can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Surajo is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Yahuza

texts.en: Yahuza is a 35-year-old farmer from Rafin-Tabo.  As a Babban Gona member, Yahuza , is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yahuza can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Yahuza is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Yahuza said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; Yosiya, Efremu,  and  Magret, and in 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
SIGUIDIA est un groupe de l’association DANAYA de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans. Mariées avec en  moyenne un enfant, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de BINTOU qui est la première personne assise de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à BAMANANKING  dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali).  
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : poivres, tomates, choux et oignons.   
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
BINTOU, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité importante de condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon et choux).  Elle s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU, KELEYA et TENKELE auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en: Siguidia is a group in the Danaya association in Ouelessebougou.  It consists of women who know each other from family and neighborhood connections.  They have an average age of 26.  They are married with an average of one child.  They conduct various businesses including the sale of condiments by Bintou, who is the person sitting on the left of the photo.  They live in large traditional families in Bamananking in the prefecture of Kati, in the region of Koulikoro, in the republic of Mali.  They have been running small businesses for several years and are very sought-after in their condiment business: bell peppers, tomatoes, cabbage, onions.  In order to satisfy growing customer demand, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program.  They are on their first group loan.  Bintou, who is president of the group and very well-known in Ouelessebougou, excels in condiment sales.  She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of different condements (bell peppers, tomatoes, onions, cabbage). She buys her supplies in Ouelessebougou, Keleya, and Tenkele from wholesellers and resells the food in Ouelessebougou, for cash and credit, to a clientele of men and women.  She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, a sum that will enable her to repay her loan and to reinvest in her business of reselling condiments.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Pedro Ángel

texts.es:
Pedro de 62 años de edad, es un hombre con firmes principios religiosos, ya que siempre asiste a la iglesia para participar de la misa dominical, él manifiesta que esta muy comprometido en este tipo de relación con lo espiritual, pero también con la educación de sus hijos que aun están pequeños, porque a su edad tiene dos hijas bastante jóvenes las cuales junto a su esposa  ayuda en las labores de su casa y los familiares y la educación de sus hijas, ya que como familia se llevan muy bien y el como agricultor esta realizando una labor para la manutención de su familia, los hijos mayores ya se casaron; pero tanto ellos como él se apoyan mutuamente ya que este es el principio moral que él les enseño. 


Pedro trabaja la tierra desde que tenia 10 años con su padre que le enseño el oficio de agricultor, muchas de las cosas que hoy son herencia de su padre pues él les inculco firmes principios morales y espirituales.

 La agricultura es su principal fuente de ingresos, ademas de las remesas que sus hijos le envían,  él es un hombre que trabaja la tierra a la manera antigua de sol a sol, por ello a el le abunda mucho el trabajo, él siembra granos básicos tales como frijol y maíz para la venta y su consumo. Por lo tanto, él esta aprovechando la tierra que es herencia de su padre para trabajar duro. 


El préstamo se empleara para la compra de insumos para la temporada agrícola de postrera ya que el necesita abonos y agroquímicos  y así obtener una buena producción de granos básicos; Con ello podrá sustentar las necesidades del año que esta por venir en lo que se refiere a alimentación.


 Pedro a futuro desea mejorar las condiciones de su familia y una mejora en la producción de granos básicos. No obstante, es factible decir que él tiene muchos planes para el futuro pero los principales son estos que ya mencionamos.
texts.en:
Pedro, 62, is a man with strong religious principles; he always goes to church to attend Sunday Mass. He says that he is very committed to his relationship with the spiritual, but he is also committed to the education of his children who are still young. At his age he has two young daughters and, along with his wife, he helps with the household chores and the education of their daughters. As a family, they get along very well. He also works as a farmer to support his family. His older children are already married, but they are all mutually supportive, as this is the moral principle that he has taught them. 
Pedro has been working the land since he was 10 with his father, who taught him how to farm and taught him many other things; he instilled in Pedro strong moral and spiritual principles. 
Agriculture is his main source of income, other than the remittances that his children send him. He is a man who works the land in the old-fashioned way, from sunrise to sunset, so his yields are plentiful. He grows staple grains such as beans and corn for sale and consumption. He works hard to take advantage of the land that he inherited from his father. 
He will use the loan to purchase supplies for the second-harvest season; he needs fertilizers and agrochemicals to get a good grain harvest. This will support the coming year’s food needs. 
In the future, Pedro wants to improve his family’s situation and his grain production. In fact, he has many plans for the future, but these are the main ones.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for the second-harvest season, since he needs fertilizers and agrochemicals to get a good harvest of staple grains.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Hajara joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Mercy, Blessing and Yokabet. Hajara is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Hajara will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, she would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Hajara can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Hajara said “I plan to use the money I make this year to expand my farmland”. Hajara is not thinking about just this year; she said, In 5 years, she wants to “ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.”

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed, and to build a pigpen

loans.name: Cristobal Vitervo

texts.es:
Cristobal tiene 58 años de edad vive en el canton Montalvo Provincia de los Rios, su estado civil es soltero vive con sus hijos de 26-24-22 años.
Es entegrante de la ventanilla rural las Guardias que se dedica a la agricultura. Se dedica a la construccion, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la construccion sus compras las realiza en las ciudades de Montalvo. Su sueño es tener su propio negocio y comprarse un carro. En su tiempo libre le gusta estar en la casa descansando.
texts.en: Cristóbal is 58 and lives in the area of Montalvo, in the province of Los Ríos. He is a single dad and lives with his three children, aged 26, 24, and 22. He belongs to communal rural bank Las Guardias, whose members are farmers. He works in construction and will use the loan to buy construction supplies in the cities of Montalvo. His dream is to have his own business and buy a car. In his free time, he likes to relax at home.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Yahaya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Alhamdu, Salvation  and  Joshua. Yahaya is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Yahaya will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would  be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Yahaya can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Yahaya said “I plan to use the money I make this year to expand my farmland”. Yahaya is not thinking about just this year; he said, “in 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Matha

texts.en:
Matha is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Matha joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her  children, Amos, Isiya, and  Isuhu. Matha is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Matha will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, she would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Matha can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  

When asked how she plans to spend the income she will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, she said, “I plan to use the money to expand my farmland.” Matha is not thinking about this year alone; she expressed that her longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. 

With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Astrid Ivette

texts.es: Astrid es una joven estudiante de la carrera de Obstetricia y Enfermería   en una Universidad Particular. Nos cuenta que desde muy niña le gustaba mucho las ramas de salud. Ella estudia 7 horas diarias desde hacer 2 años y le faltan 3 para terminar su carrera y su mayor objetivó es terminar de estudiar y su sueño es trabajar de obstetra en un hospital o clínica reconocida en el País. Solicito el préstamo para continuar pagando sus estudios de la universidad y no tener problemas de pagos. Agradece mucho a los inversionistas de KIVA por la ayuda y siente una gran satisfacción porque ahora podrá pagar sus estudios. Envía muchos saludos y dice que está segura que la seguirán apoyando y ayudando no solo a ella si no también a  mucha gente que lo necesita.
texts.en:
Astrid is a young Obstetrics and Nursing student at a private university. She says that she has been attracted to the health field a lot since she was very young. She has studied 7 hours daily for the past two years and has 3 years to go to graduate. Her main objective is to complete her studies. Her dream is to work as an obstetrician in a re-known hospital or clinic in her country.

She is requesting a loan to continue to pay for her studies at the university so she doesn't have problems with paying. She is grateful to the lenders at Kiva for the help and feels great satisfaction as she can now pay for her studies. She sends her greetings and says that she is sure that you will continue to assist and aid not only her but many other people who need help.

loans.use: to pay university expenses.

loans.name: Nhóm 13 Thôn Hòa 02 -Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Hằng operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is applying for a loan to purchase fish to resell. 

Hằng is 33 years old and she is married with three children. Hằng  is the group leader of the solidarity group called Nhóm 13 Thôn Hòa 02 - Quảng Nham, which consists of three members. 

In 2012, Hằng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hằng has successfully repaid eight loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hằng has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Hằng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hằng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Saturnina Mercedes

texts.es:
Saturnina es una mujer de 62 años de edad casada sin hijos y su negocio es una tienda de comestibles de primea necesidad.
Ella es una persona alegre muy trabajadora, su negocio lo realiza en el mercado de su barrio y lleva con esta actividad más de 26 años.
Saturnina es de tez morena cabello largo trenzado de color negro, su vestimenta es tradicional (manta y pollera), ella necesita abastecer su negocio con; maíz, frijoles, arroz, café, aceite, pan, azúcar, arroz, manteca, galletas, bebidas, etc., su deseo para el futuro es tener una tienda grande surtida y reconocida por todos los clientes del barrio. Ella sueña con tener su casa propia y caliente en el barrio donde vive.
Es por esos motivos que Saturnina solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos de primera necesidad y algún día cumplir su sueño.
texts.en: Saturnina is 62, married, and has no children. She sells basic food items at her grocery store. She is cheerful and hard-working. She has been selling her merchandise in the neighbourhood for over 26 years. Saturnina is dark-skinned, sports long, black tresses, and favours traditional clothes (a plaid and skirt combination). She needs to replenish her store's stock and want to buy sweetcorn, broad beans, rice, coffee, vegetable oil, bread, sugar, butter, crackers, drinks, and other such items. Her dream is to have a big, well-stocked store and become a reference in the neighbourhood. She longs to have a house of her own with proper heating in her neighbourhood. Saturnina asks for this loan in order to buy merchandise to sell with the hope of, one day, making her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Marinel

texts.en:
Marinel is from Aliaga, Nueva Ecija. Her family’s source of income is farming. It is a seasonal business, which is why sometimes their income is not enough. It is difficult for her parents to sustain them, especially now that she is studying in college. She is studying to attain a B.S. Business Administration at the College of the Immaculate Conception. 

Marinel wants to finish college to help her parents and be able to repay all their hardships. To make this possible, she wants to take a loan of PHP 70,000 from the Kiva lenders to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Deoniamae

texts.en:
Deoniamae wants to improve her living situation in the future. She studied at the university and was determined to finish her studies to gain a better education that could help her find a job in the future. She had her previous loan, which she used for her school expenses like books and other supplies.
 
To pay for her school tuition for the first semester this current year, she took a new loan.

She is thankful enough to GDMPC for being a part of her journey.

loans.use: to pay for her school tuition for the first semester this current year

loans.name: Mojahed I

texts.en:
Mojahed is 45 years old and a father of three children, living with them in his own house in Sana'a, Yemen. Mojahed immigrated to Saudi Arabia many years ago to accumulate money and send for his children at home. He couldn't afford the immigration and decided to come back home in order to live with his family again.
 
Selling food and soft drinks was Mojahed's primary source of income for one year. This father's hard work and efforts paid off because his small business enabled him to open his own shop in the city of Sana'a. His effort and determination have enabled him to meet his customers' needs. 

Mojahed has plans for the future. He is applying for a loan of 200,000 Yemen Rials (YER) from AMB to invest in his shop so that he will be able to offer his customers the same goods that are available in Supermarkets. In this way, he will improve his business and his home.

Mojahed looks forward to expanding his business through purchasing all of goods and items for his shop to meet all the demands of the customers.

loans.use: to invest in his shop so that he will be able to offer his customers the same goods that are available in Supermarkets.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 45-year-old farmer from Kwankwani.  As a Babban Gona member, Hassan is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Hassan can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Hassan is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Hassan is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Friday,  and  Yakubu. Hassan’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to make more money for myself and my family”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Johel Ernesto

texts.es:
Johel de 38 años de edad, es una persona que estudio hasta 9° grado y luego estudio un curso para sastre pantalonero,  está soltero no tiene hijos vive con sus padres y un hermano,  la familia la conformada de cinco personas; pero solo dependen dos de él que son los ansíanos sus padres.

Johel le está apostando a la crianza de cerdos, ya saco dos camadas de cerdos para 
la carne; este negocio lo aprendía de un amigo que también tiene crianza y lo invito a que le acompañara, incluso hasta para ir a comprar; es así que esta trabajando en la producción, antes se dedicaba a la siembra de granos básicos, pero hoy está muy crítico sembrar los inviernos son disparejos, manifiesta él.  Aunque con los cerdos es más el trabajo pero es más rentable.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar cerdos para la crianza y engorde. Planea que en el futuro ya no los comprara, sino que él producirá las crías, con ello tendrá posibilidades de tener mejores ganancias y por ende una mejor calidad de vida.

Su sueño en el futuro, es hacer una granja de cerdos producir para abastecer a los cucheros que engordan en la zona, por hoy están comprando lejos a unos 70 kilómetros para ir a comprar.
texts.en:
Johel, 38, is a person who has a 9th grade education and later studied to be a tailor.  He is single and has no children.  He lives with his parents and a brother.  This family has 5 members, but only his two elderly parents are dependent upon him.

Johel is raising pigs.  He already gets 2 litters of pigs to sell for the meat.  He learned this business from a friend who also raises pigs, and invited him to go with him to make his purchases.  This is how he came to raise pigs.  Prior to this, he used to cultivate staple grains.  He states that now farming is in a very critical state because the winters have been uneven, and so although raising pigs is more work, it is more profitable.

Johel is requesting a loan from CREDICAMPO to buy pigs to breed and fatten.  In the future, he plans to avoid buying pigs because he will produce the piglets himself.  This will give him the opportunity to increase his earnings and thereby have a better quality of life.

For the future, Johel dreams of having a pig farm to supply the individuals who are raising and fattening pigs in the area, as today they are buying the piglets from afar, traveling 70 kilometers to make their purchases.

loans.use: to buy pigs to breed and fatten

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Thoon1 Thống Nhất- Quảng Vinh Group

texts.en:
Biên works in agriculture, farming poultry. She has been involved in this business for six years. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. 

Biên is 30 years old; she is married with three children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with three dependents

This is Biên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the Nhóm 03 Thoon1 Thống Nhất- Quảng Vinh solidarity group. 

The main hardships that Biên faces in her business are natural disasters and droughts.

With her business profit, Biên  hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain  a successful business, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Flor De Kantuta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR KANTUTA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nieves es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: reciclaje, punto de llamadas, venta de leche, servicio de transporte, venta de accesorios de celular, venta de ferretería, venta de comida.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nieves es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  reciclaje de chatarra; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace años al observar los que este material es desechado y puede ser reutilizado posteriormente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de chatarra) que adquirirá de las personas recolectoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a las empresas recolectoras. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en: Communal bank 'Flor Kantuta' is on its second lending cycle with Pro Mujer as part of Cascada focus centre. It is comprised of eight members, with Nieves as president. The members have several businesses such as recycling, call shop, milk sales, transportation services, mobile phone accessories sales, ironmonger, food sales. The loan will thus benefit small entrepreneurs, among them Nieves. The latter says that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago, invited by a spokesperson for the institution who came to her house. She owns a scrap metal recycling shop, which she started years ago upon noticing that many items made of metal that end up discarded can be collected and sold on. She asks for a loan to increase her working capital by buying scrap metal from the people who collect it in the city of El Alto. She will then sell it to companies. Nieves derives from this business an income that enables her to support her family, since she is married and has six children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she mentions health services provided by the institution.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is 31 years old. She lives with her parents in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. Her father works as a driver, and this is the only source of income for the family. 

Natia decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $300. With the received credit she will purchase used clothes and will open a shop. 

Natia is a very hardworking woman, and has a great desire to be involved in her own business. She will help her family with money in the future, and they will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to open a used clothes shop

loans.name: Singi

texts.en:
Singi is a 36-year-old married man who has been blessed with two children. His wife adds additional income to support the welfare of the family.  Singi has been a baker, preparing cakes and doughnuts for eight years, earning an income of KES.15,000 at the end of every month.

Singi is servicing his third loan of KES.30,000 with VisionFund Kenya, and intends to use this entire amount to buy self-raising and doughnut flour to add to his stock, which is running out.

Singi plans to use the anticipated income to educate his children and purchase his own land to build a permanent house for his family.  He hopes to improve the living standard of his family and become a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional self-raising and doughnut flour for baking.

loans.name: Flor Elvia

texts.es:
Flor es una campesina humilde y trabajadora de 56 años de edad, que desde pequeña aprendió todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres.
Actualmente posee un cultivo de caña de azúcar, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el mercado del pueblo donde reside, esto le genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia.
Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes), esto le permitirá seguir cuidado de sus cultivos y mejorar la productividad de la próxima cosecha, lo que beneficiará los ingresos que percibe por cada venta.
Flor manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir luchando para generar una estabilidad económica y brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Flor is a hardworking and unassuming farmer.  She is 56 years old, and she learned to work the fields as a child, thanks to the teachings of her parents.

At this time, Flor is cultivating sugar cane.  Her crops are harvested and sold in the market in the town where she lives.  This generates enough income to support her household and cover her family's basic needs.

Flor was motivated to request this loan because she wants to invest in agricultural supplies at wholesale (organic and chemical fertilizers and pesticides).  This will enable her to continue with her farming and will increase the productivity of her next harvest, which will increase the earnings she gets from each sale.  

Flor states that her main wish is to continue to strive to generate financial stability and provide her family with better living conditions and improve their welfare.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Danaya Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DANAYA III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à MANA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide, le mil et le gombo avec  TENIN, 2ème  personne  assise de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of Danaya III Group are married women who average 34 years of age and 5 children each. They all live in polygamous families in Mana, a village in Ouelessebougou, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their seventh farming loan from the MFI.
 
They grow peanuts, millet, and okra, just like Tenin, the second woman from the right in sitting row in the photograph. With her loan, she intends to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay plowing cost to maintain two hectares.

After the harvest, the production is sold at the market, to a clientele comprising resellers and consumers. Tenin intends to turn an average profit of XOF 195'000 per planting.

This profit will enable her to repay the loan, and also help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay plowing cost

loans.name: Machac Sartawi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MACHAC SARTAWI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción de leche, producción de queso, tienda de barrio, tejido  de gorras, venta de queso.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de productos lácteos; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicia hace varios años, aprendiendo la elaboración del producto de sus padres, cuando se casó decide implementar este negocio como fuente de recursos económicos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para alimento en tiempo de sequía (compra de forraje por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de su comunidad y posteriormente lo dará a su ganado para su alimentación. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el seguro de vida que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “MACHAC SARTAWI” communal bank is starting their first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi branch. It is composed of eight members led by a board of directors with Virginia as President. The members' businesses are varied amongst them are: the production of milk, producing cheese, a neighborhood store, knitting hats, and selling cheese.

The loan will benefit all of these micro-entrepreneurs of which Virginia is one. She says that she joined Pro Mujer for the first time when a promoter of the institute came to visit her at her house. Today she has a business selling dairy products. She says she started the business several years ago. She learned how to make the products from her parents and when she got married she decided to start her business as a source of economic resources.

The loan that she is getting now is for food in the dry season (buying wholesale fodder) that she will purchase at the sellers in her community and later give to her cattle for food. Working in this way allows her to provide resources to support her family as she is married and has five children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the life insurance that the institute offers.

loans.use: to buy fodder wholesale.

loans.name: Danaya Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DANAYA II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à MANA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide, le riz et le gombo avec  FATOUMATA, 1ère personne  assise de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of Danaya II Group are married women who average 34 years of age and 5 children each. They all live in polygamous families in Mana, a village in Ouelessebougou, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their seventh farming loan from the MFI.
 
They grow peanuts, rice, and okra, just like Fatoumata, the woman sitting on the right in the photograph. With her loan, she intends to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay plowing cost to maintain one hectare.

After the harvest, the production is sold at the market, to a clientele comprising resellers and consumers. Fatoumata intends to turn an average profit of XOF 95'000 per planting.

This profit will enable her to repay the loan, and also help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay plowing cost

loans.name: Danaya Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DANAYA IV  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à MANA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.

La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide, le mil et le riz avec  ELIZABETHE, 1ère  personne  assise de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare.

Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
