The ten members of Danaya IV Group are married women who average 34 years of age and 5 children each. They all live in polygamous families in Mana, a village in Ouelessebougou, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their seventh farming loan from the MFI.
 
They grow peanuts, millet, and rice, just like Elizabethe, the woman sitting on the right in the photograph. With her loan, she intends to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay plowing cost to maintain one hectare.

After the harvest, the production is sold at the market, to a clientele comprising resellers and consumers. Elizabethe intends to turn an average profit of XOF 95'000 per planting.

This profit will enable her to repay the loan, and also help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay plowing cost

loans.name: Danaya V Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DANAYA V  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à MANA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le mil avec  GNINEBA, 2ème  personne  assise de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of Danaya V Group are married women who average 34 years of age and 5 children each. They all live in polygamous families in Mana, a village in Ouelessebougou, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their seventh farming loan from the MFI.
 
They grow peanuts and millet, just like Gnineba, the second woman from the right in the sitting row in the photograph. With her loan, she intends to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay plowing cost to maintain 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the production is sold at the market, to a clientele comprising resellers and consumers. Gnineba intends to turn an average profit of XOF 45'000 per planting.

This profit will enable her to repay the loan, and also help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay plowing cost

loans.name: Nhóm 05 Thôn Hòa 02- Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tâm operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell. Chiêng  has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Chiêng  is 50 years old and she is married with five children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the Nhóm 05 Thôn Hòa 02- Quảng Nham solidarity group. 

In 2007, Chiêng  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Chiêng  has successfully repaid eight loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Chiêng  faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Chiêng  hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora  María de  40  años de edad  es  casada cuenta con una pulpería donde vende lo que es refrescos y todo lo que es producto de la canasta básica, tiene 12 años de contar con su negocio con el cual ha obtenido buenas ganancias.
Doña María es conocida por ser una mujer luchadora,  vive en una aldea de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, solicita el préstamo para compra de leche, huevos, aceite, café, agua, arroz, frijoles, refrescos, etc.  Y obtener la mercadería necesaria para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y con el apoyo de este préstamo también espera mejorar sus ingresos y lograr salir adelante con su familia.
Doña María uno de sus sueños es hacer  más grande su negocio y tener un negocio de venta de ropa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio 2014
texts.en: María is 40 years old and married. She own a grocery shop where she sells drinks and basic food. She has had this shop for 12 years and is happy with the income she derives from it. María is known for never giving up in the face of hardship. She lives in a village in San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. The loan will be used to buy milk, eggs, cooking oil, coffee, water, rice, broad beans, drinks, etc. She needs this merchandise to meet customer demand and hopes to increase her income and improve her family's standard of living. Her dream is to have a bigger shop and to start a clothes shop. San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2014

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Thôn Hòa 02 - Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tâm operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Tâm is 50 years old, and she is married with five children. Tâm is the group leader of the solidarity group Nhóm 03 Thôn Hòa 02 - Quảng Nham, which consists of four members. 

In 2009, Tâm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tâm has successfully repaid eight loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Tâm has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tâm faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tâm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en: Ma. Teresa is 43 years old, married and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a carpenter and she  manages their farm for a living. In order to buy seedlings and fertilizer, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit where she joined three years ago. Ma. Teresa's photo was taken with her motorcycle used for their family transportation where her income goes. She hopes to gain more harvest in order to send her children to school and able to provide the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Selfa

texts.en:
Selfa operates an open air food business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Petrona

texts.en:
Petrona is 52 years old and a married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Petrona has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Petrona has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Petrona would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Haruna joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Clement, Goodness, and Humility. Haruna is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty.

For the first time, Haruna will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Haruna can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14,  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  

When asked, Haruna said, “I plan to use the money I make this year to expand my farmland.” Haruna is not thinking about just this. In 5 years, he wants to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double his income and yield

loans.name: Fanny Patricia

texts.es:
Fanny es una microempresaria dedicada y trabajadora, su campo de acción es la reparación de calzado, prestando el servicio todos los días.
Todo comenzó hace ya varios años cuando trabajaba con su padre quien fue zapatero toda su vida a partir de la practica y de la observación aprendió el oficio; hoy en día, a sus 58 años de edad, ya tiene su propio taller en el que genera 1 empleo directo; de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de insumos para su trabajo como0 cuero, hilos resistentes, suelas, pega, entre otros. 
De esta forma podrá cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes y entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna, con el fin aumentar la producción y adquirir nuevos contratos, que permitan darle continuidad a su microempresa.
Fanny sueña con seguir fortaleciendo su taller y tener cada día mayor nivel de producción para generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de su familia como la de las personas que influyen diariamente en su labor.
texts.en: Fanny is a small entrepreneur who is very hard-working and dedicated to her business. She is a cobbler and works every day. She learned the trade by observing her father, who was a cobbler all his life, and practicing relentlessly. Now, she is 58 years old and has her own workshop with one employee. She derives from her business income enough to help her husband with household expenses. She asks for a loan to buy materials for her trade, such as leather, strong thread, soles, and glue. She will thus be able to fulfil her customers' orders on time. Her goal is to increase production and attract new customers in order to keep her business alive. Fanny dreams of strengthening her business and increasing her production in order to be able to create more jobs and improve her family's standard of living, as well as the living conditions of people who have a daily influence on her work.

loans.use: to buy materials for her trade.

loans.name: Aira

texts.en: Aira is from Quezon, Nueva Ecija.  Their family’s source of income is farming. What they earn is sometimes not enough, therefore she wants to access a loan of PHP 70,000 to be used to pay her tuition fee. Aira is taking a BS in Business Administration at the College of the Immaculate Conception. She wants to finish college to achieve her dreams and help her family.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 27 years old and has one child. She is married and her child is currently in school.

Michelle is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Michelle requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Michelle has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Michelle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 36 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Jessica works very hard to provide for them.

Jessica runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, coffee, sugar, cereals and detergent soap to sell.

Jessica has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items including those listed above and more.
 
In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, coffee, sugar, cereals, detergent soap and others to sell

loans.name: Alh. Nasuru

texts.en:
Alh. Nasuru is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Alh. Nasuru joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children. He is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty.

For the first time, Alh. Nasuru will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Alh. Nasuru can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14, and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  

When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Alh. Nasuru is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his long-term goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double his income and yield.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en: Noor is a 19-year-old university student majoring in Statistics. She lives with her family consisting of five members in Irbid, Jordan. Her aim is to get her Bachelor's so that she will find a good job to start supporting her family financially because they are currently facing financial problems. But she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is a 35-year-old farmer from Danju. As a Babban Gona member, Abubakar is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Abubakar can earn up to $2,000 per hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags per hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Abubakar is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. 

When asked, Abubakar said, “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland. In five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Abubakar is on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seeds in order to double his income and yield

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is a female Ugandan aged 30, married to Charles, with three children aged 12, 10, and 1 year old. Two of her children attend school and she has one dependent. She and her husband are responsible for paying school fees for their children.

She has a retail shop in Kagadi town which is her main business and source of livelihood. It has been operational for three years. She has approached Ugafode for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX in order to restock her shop. This will help her to increase her sales and profit to meet her family needs.

Her major challenge is competition from other business people with similar businesses.

loans.use: To buy  sugar, soap, corn flour, rice and other retail  shop items

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 31 years old, married and blessed with three children. To have an additional source of income, she was engages in buying and reselling Splash products within the local community. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she needs to increase her income to sustain the necessities of her family and finance the education of her children. With this regard, she aims to strengthen her business to generate sufficient income. Due to capital insufficiency, she would like to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders through ASKI in the amount of PHP 18,000 to buy additional stock of Splash products to resell. Through this financial assistance, she believes that she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of Splash products to resell

location.town: Brgy. Bintawan Norte, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: El señor Nicolás, vive y trabaja en Colomi, económicamente es independiente, trabajador y responsable; se dedica a la agricultura y siembra papa, haba, oca  y papaliza como sus principales productos en terreno propio con una extensión de 2 hectáreas, produce con rotación de cultivos, tiene una experiencia de 25 años en el sector agrícola, además cuenta con cabezas de ganado 2 de engorde, 2 lecheras y 3 terneros. El señor requiere un crédito para la compra de 1 camión de abono orgánico(gallinaza) y 9 cargas de semilla de papa para la siembra, ya que quiere proveerse de estos insumos  agrícolas porque se acerca la época de siembra y con la compra de estos insumos agrícolas incrementará su producción  y tendrá mayores ventas que mejorarán su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Nicolás lives and works in Colomi. He is economically independent, hard-working and responsible. He works in agriculture growing potatoes, beans, oca and ullucus as his principal crops on his own land with an extension of 2 hectares. He grows his crop by rotation and has 25 years of experience in agriculture. he also has 2 steers, 2 milk cows and 3 calves. 

Nicolás needs a loan to buy one truck load of organic chicken manure and 9 loads of potato seeds to grow. He wants to get these products as the growing season is approaching and buying these products will increase his production. Which will give him more sales and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy organic chicken manure and potato seeds.

loans.name: Harusi

texts.en: Harusi appreciates the support of the previous loan. She works hard to ensure all is well with her family. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to buy hardwood timber for use in her business.

loans.use: to buy hardwood timber for her business

loans.name: Nuruila

texts.ru: Нуруйла, 54 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Нуруйлы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2007 году, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Нуруйлы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 4 кобылы и 30 овец, а также есть земельный надел размером 2,25 ГА, на котором она ежегодно выращивает ячмень и сено.   В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нуруйла обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец с дальнейшим откормом и перепродажей. Доходы от кредита Нуруйла планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на постройку дома для сына.
texts.en: Nuruila is 54 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. Nuruila has a secondary education and, to provide the primary source of income for her family, is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started this business in 2007 with a 10,000 som (KGS) purchase of livestock. Thanks to Nuruila's hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows, 4 mares and 30 sheep, and also 2.25 hectares of land, where she grows barley and hay. In order to further develop her business, Nuruila requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy sheep for subsequent fattening up and resale. Nuruila plans to invest the earnings from her business into further increasing the domestic livestock quantities and saving money to build a house for her son.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
Мухаббат живет в Дж.Расуловском районе города Худжанд. Она вежливая, обходительная и умелая продавщица. Ей 53 года. Ее семья состоит из шестерых человек. Все ее дети взрослые и самостоятельные. 
В 2005 году Мухаббат в своем районе открыла продуктовый магазин собственным рабочим капиталом и ее магазин работает уже 9 лет. За эти годы она приобрела постоянных клиентов. Муж и дети также помогают Мухаббат продвигать бизнес. Так как приближается большой праздник Священного месяца Рамазан, люди покупают много продуктов, чтобы накрыть большой стол. В связи с этим Мухаббат хочет увеличить ассортимент и количество продуктов в своем магазине. Таким образом она сможет увеличить бюджет семьи и поэтому этот кредит ей очень важен.
texts.en:
Muhabbat lives in the city of Khujand in the J.Rasulo district. She is a polite, respectful and skilled salesperson. She is 53 years old. Her family consists of six people. All of her children are grown and independent.

Muhabbat opened a food market in her district in 2005 with her own working capital, and her store has been in business for 9 years now. She obtained regular customers over these years. Her husband and children help Muhabbat to run the business. Because a big holiday of the Holy Month of Ramadan is approaching, people are buying more products to provide a big spread. Due to this, Muhabbat wants to expand her selection and increase the inventory of products in her store. This is how she would be able to increase the family's budget, and this is why this loan is very important to her.

loans.use: to expand her selection and increase the inventory of products in her store

loans.name: Ghelyn Mae

texts.en:
Ghelyn Mae is 22 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Ghelyn Mae has a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. 

Ghelyn Mae requested a loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients for her food vending. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en:
Bayan is 19 years old and single. She is a university student majoring in Marketing; she is in her second semester of her second year. Her father is  retired. 

Bayan is planning to be a provider for her family and to depend on herself after she gets her Bachelor's degree. She requested a loan, which she will use to pay for her upcoming semester fees to help her reach her goal.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara is a farmer from Maidawa.  As a Babban Gona member, Hajara is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Hajara can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Hajara is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. 

When asked, Hajara said, “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Victor and Nagarta, and in five years, I want to make more money for myself and my family.” With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double her income and yield

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim remembers the extreme poverty that his family faced  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now,  Ibrahim, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Ibrahim  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season. 

 “In five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community,” expressed Ibrahim. With this loan, Ibrahim is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double his income and yield.

loans.name: Partovbi

texts.ru: Партовби замужняя женщина в возрасте 56 лет. Она имеет троих детей. Сыновьям 32 и 30 лет, дочке 18 лет. Партовби дома занимается купле продажей скотин. Этой деятельность она научилась у мужа, он ранее тоже занимался скотоводством. Партовби знает все тонкости свой работы и хорошо умеет обращаться со скотами. Партовби считает, что пора расширять бизнес и принести в семейный бюджет значительный источник дохода и с такими намерениями обратилась за кредитом. На деньги от кредита она купит пару голов скота и увеличит поголовья скотин.
texts.en: Partovbi is a married, 56-year-old woman. She has three children. Her sons are 32 and 30 years old, and daughter is 18 years old. Partovbi is involved in reselling livestock at home. She learned this business from her husband, who was involved in animal husbandry before. Partovbi knows all of the nuances of her work and treats livestock well. Partovbi thinks that it is time to expand her business and bring a significant source of income into the family's budget, and is requesting this loan with these intentions. She will use the loan amount to buy a couple of heads of livestock and increase her livestock headcount.

loans.use: to buy a couple of heads of livestock and increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 19 years old, from Quezon, Nueva Ecija. She is taking up BS Business Administration at the College of the Immaculate Conception. She chose this field because she believes that there are a lot of opportunities in this field and with that she will be able to help her family. 

To do this, Rosalinda wants to avail herself of a loan of PHP 70,000 from the Kiva lenders, which she will use to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: José Reynaldo

texts.es:
José de 40 años de edad,  vive con su familia, ya que de sus 4 hijos  dos de ellos se acompañaron. 

José se a dedicado desde muy pequeño a la albañilería y la agricultura ya que debe responder por su familia con el pan de cada día, a José le gusta trabajar mucho es un hombre responsables y humilde que le gusta ser leal tanto en su trabajo como en todos los quehaceres que ejerce día con día.

Trabaja la agricultura y la albañilería desde muy joven ya que fue una herencia que le dejaban sus padres. Además de la agricultura y la albañilería él compra verduras para revender y sacar un poco de ganancias, ya que así su esposa le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar verduras para vender y poder sacar algo de ganancia y que su esposa pueda obtener uno ingresos.

José  planea cancelar su crédito y sacar otro mas grande para  comprar bastante mercadería y poderla distribuir en toda la comunidad y poder tener mejores ingresos; ya que piensa mejorar su vida económicamente para salir adelante, cada día que pasa se esfuerza por hacer las cosas mejor y ser una persona triunfadora en el futuro ya que tiene los hijos que tiene que prepararlos para que puedan salir adelante  y el día de mañana ser también unos triunfadores.
texts.en:
Jose is 40 years old.  He lives with his family as does his 4 children, 2 of whom accompany him.

Since he was very small Jose has dedicated himself to bricklaying and agriculture so that he can provide food  for his family every day.  Jose likes to work a lot and is a humble and responsible man.  He enjoys being loyal both to his work and to all he does, each and every day. 

He's worked in agriculture and bricklaying every day, as did his parents.  In addition to agriculture and bricklaying he buys vegetables to re-sell in order to make a small profit.  In this way his wife helps with the household bills.

The loan he is requesting is to buy vegetables to sell to make a profit so that his wife can have an income.  

Jose plans to pay off  his loan and take another larger loan to buy a substantial amount of merchandise to sell throughout the community and have even greater income.  In this way he plans to improve his life economically and get ahead.  Each day that passes he tries harder to improve things in order to be a successful person in the future because he also has his children he must prepare so that they can get ahead and also be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell for profit so his wife can have an income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Djiguisseme I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJIGUISSEME I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à NIANGUILA, un des villages de NIANGADINA 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est le riz avec  GNAMANKOLO, 1ère personne  assise de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of Djiguisseme I Group are married women who average 40 years of age and 3 children each. They all live in polygamous families in Nianguila, a village in Niangadina, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their fourth farming loan from the MFI.

They grow rice, just like Gnamankolo, the woman sitting on the right in the photograph. With her loan, she intends to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay plowing cost to maintain 0.25 hectare.

After the harvest, the production is sold at the market, to a clientele comprising resellers and consumers. Gnamankolo intends to turn an average profit of XOF 25'000 per planting.

This profit will enable her to repay the loan, and also help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay plowing

loans.name: Djiguisseme Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJIGUISSEME III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à NIANGUILA, un des villages de NIANGADINA 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide et le mil avec  FANTA, 1ère personne  assise de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of Djiguisseme III Group are married women who average 37 years of age and 3 children each. They all live in polygamous families in Nianguila, a village in Niangadina, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their fourth farming loan from the MFI.

They grow peanuts and millet, just like Fanta, the woman sitting on the right in the photograph. With her loan, she intends to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay plowing cost to maintain 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the production is sold at the market, to a clientele comprising resellers and consumers. Fanta intends to turn an average profit of XOF 45'000 per planting.

This profit will enable her to repay the loan, and also help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay plowing cost

loans.name: Djiguisseme V Group

texts.fr:
Les  06 membres du groupe  DJIGUISSEME V  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à NIANGUILA, un des villages de NIANGADINA 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide et le mil avec  SANABADIAN, 1ère personne  assise de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of Djiguisseme V Group are married women who average 29 years of age and 4 children each. They all live in polygamous families in Nianguila, a village in Niangadina, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their fourth farming loan from the MFI.

They grow peanuts and millet, just like Sanabadian, the woman sitting on the right in the photograph. With her loan, she intends to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay plowing cost to maintain 1 hectare.

After the harvest, the production is sold at the market, to a clientele comprising resellers and consumers. Sanabadian intends to turn an average profit of XOF 95'000 per planting.

This profit will enable her to repay the loan, and also help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay plowing cost

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 44 years old, married to John, and they are blessed with six children aged between 22 years and nine years. She has been in rental houses and farming for the last 19 years and earns an income of 22,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 
She has applied for her first loan of 20,000 KES from ‘VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this loan amount to renovate the houses by painting.                                                                                           

The profit she earns will be used to provide for the family's basic needs and pay school fees for her children. She hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to renovate the houses by painting.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  SABOUGNOUMA II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DRAKORO-DOUMBA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide, le mil et le gombo avec   NANTENE, 1ère personne  assise de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of Sabougnouma II Group are married women who average 33 years of age and 4 children each. They all live in polygamous families in Drakoro-Doumba, a village in Ouelessebougou, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their sixth farming loan from the MFI.

They grow peanuts, millet, and okra, just like Nantene, the woman sitting on the right in the photograph. With her loan, she intends to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay plowing cost to maintain 2 hectares.

After the harvest, the production is sold at the market, to a clientele comprising resellers and consumers. Nantene intends to turn an average profit of XOF 195'000 per planting.

This profit will enable her to repay the loan, and also help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay plowing cost

loans.name: Lourdesita

texts.en: Lourdesita is not only earning with her charcoal retailing business but also by operating their own farm. She has grown coconuts for many years as their main source of income. Her previous loan used for buying more stock of charcoal to sell was successfully repaid. To improve their farm, she took a new loan to cover  farm fertilization costs. She hopes to improve her farm to have multiplied income to be used in the future.

loans.use: to cover  farm fertilization costs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to hire laborers for weeding, pruning, harvesting, and transporting the crops.

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José de 37 años de edad, es una persona muy conocida y respetada en la comunidad por su educación y alta voluntad de servicio a los demás es una persona con buenos principios morales y espirituales, él se creció con sus padres y sus abuelos quienes se encargaron de corregirlo y guiarlo por el buen camino de los buenos valores que son los que hoy en día lo han llevado a salir adelante y a ser una persona de bien y de éxito.

José curso sus estudios de educación básica en la escuela de la comunidad, él estudiaba todos los días por la tarde,  ya que por las mañanas se dedicaba ayudar en los quehaceres agrícolas de su padre y su abuelo ya que era su principal fuente de ingresos económicos y lo que le ayudaba a dar el sustento diario de su familia y de esa forma podían satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su hogar, con el paso del tiempo José adquirió conocimiento y experiencia  en el manejo de los cultivos de granos básicos y fue de así que se fue independizando y fue cuando conoció a su esposa con quien decidió formar su hogar y concretar su vida  y hoy en día son padres de 3 hijos de los que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela  de su comunidad.

José se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería actividad que fue heredada por su padre y su abuelo, y tiene una experiencia de 25 años ya que trabaja desde que era un niño, acompañaba a su padre por la mañana a cultivar la tierra utilizando una cuma, un calabazo con agua y un par de caytes siendo estos sus implemento de trabajo. 

El dinero será utilizado para comprar madera, teja para reparar el techo de su casa. De esta manera dará una mejor protección a sus hijos y a toda su familia, ya que es un derecho fundamental para la vida en tener una vivienda digna, algo que les proteja del  frio, el calor, la lluvia y el sol.

Las proyecciones que él tiene para su futuro son las de tener su cada terminada y con todas las condiciones para el descanso y protección de su familia, y ayudar en todo lo necesario para que sus hijos puedan ser unos profesionales,  ya que manifiesta que uno de ellos quiere ser ingeniero en sistemas informáticos  y todo esto lo lograra con la buena inversión de sus ganancias y la inversión de un crédito nuevo.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old. He is a very well known and respected member of his community because of his education and willingness to serve others. He has high moral and spiritual standards. He grew up with his parents and grandparents, who were the ones to correct him and guide him down the right path. The good values that he learned at home are what have helped him get ahead today and become a good and successful person.

José got his basic education in the local school. He would study every day in the evening, since in the mornings he would help his father and grandfather with their farm work, which was their main source of financial income and helped provide for the family and cover the basic needs of their household. In time José acquired knowledge and experience in growing basic grains and that is how he started working on his own. When he met his wife, they decided to start a family and a life together and today they have three children, who are going to the local school.

José works farming and raising livestock, which he learned from his father and grandfather. He has 25 years of experience because he has been working ever since he was a child when he would go out to the fields in the mornings alongside his father with sickle, a watering can, and a pair of sandals, which made up his working gear.

He will use the money to buy wood and shingles to repair the roof of his house. This will allow him to give his children and his whole family more protection, since it is a basic right in life to have decent housing, a place to be protected from the cold, the heat, the rain, and the sun.

The goals he has set for his future are to finish his house and have it ready with everything his family needs in order to rest and be protected. He also wants to help his children become professionals as much as he can, since he says one of them wants to become a computer science engineer. He will achieve all of this by investing his earnings wisely and investing a new loan.

loans.use: to buy wood and shingles to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Progressive Farmers Group

texts.en:
John is a member of the Progressive Farmers. He turns 62 this year and is happily married with four children aged 32, 28, 23 and 18. His youngest child is still attending school. John lives with his family in the Ajumako District in the Central Region of Ghana. 

John has been retired for several years and is currently drawing a pension from the state. However, he chooses to re-invest his pension into his farms so that he can provide for his family. He currently grows oranges on a 4-acre citrus farm, and his farm is his main source of income. He is the chairman of the local farmers' association and is well-respected by his community for his diligence and foresight. He plans to procure a processing plant for the farmers in his association so that their value-added crops can be sold to the local companies for a higher price.  

It is clear that John is enterprising and hardworking. However, he still finds farming challenging because of the high financial costs of maintenance. In particular, he has to hire many labourers to weed, prune and harvest the crops. He also has to purchase important agricultural inputs such as fertiliser and insect traps. Without such inputs, the crops are susceptible to being attacked by fruit flies and will not grow well. A loan will allow him to purchase these essential inputs and help increase his yield significantly, and his profits would far exceed the capital he needs to invest in his farms now. The loan will also help pay the school fees for his youngest child. John thanks all micro-lenders for their generous assistance.

loans.use: to hire labourers to work on the farm, as well as to purchase farming inputs such as fertiliser and insect traps.

loans.name: 11 De Abril Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “11 DE ABRIL” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de cotillones, venta de zapatillas, venta de cosméticos, tejido de chalecos, venta de comida, venta de medicina natural.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió en un instituto técnico y con un préstamo obtenido en Pro Mujer de otra ciudad inicio su pequeño taller, cuando se cambió de residencia decide seguir trabajando con su mismo negocio y con nuestra financiadora. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta que la capacitación y el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank 11 de Abril is starting its first cycle with Pro Mujer, through the regional hub of Collpani. The group comprises eight members and is run by a board of directors, of which María is the President. The businesses run by the members of this communal bank are diverse, including a party favors store, selling slippers, selling cosmetics, weaving vests, selling food, and selling natural medicine.

The loan they are requesting will benefit the small micro-entrepreneurs in María's group. She says this is her first time joining Pro Mujer, and that she did so through a consultant from the organization who visited her at home and invited her. She currently runs a sewing shop and says she learned the business at a technical institute with a loan granted by Pro Mujer in a different city. She started her small shop and when she moved she decided to continue working in the same business and with our financing.
 
She will use the loan she is now requesting to increase capital by purchasing wholesale fabric, which she will buy from the sellers in the city of El Alto. She will later sell her finished products to the customers who order from her. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is single and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she enjoys the trainings and the health area offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fabric.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 19 years old and is from Alfonso Lista, Ifugao. He is studying to attain a B.S. Business Administration - Microfinance degree at the College of the Immaculate Conception. 

Romeo is struggling financially, especially when it comes to his tuition fees and his daily allowance, which he needs to pay for lot of photocopies needed for his studies. Because of this, he wants to take a loan of PHP 70,000 from Kiva lenders to help sustain his schooling.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Sabougnouma Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  SABOUGNOUMA III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DRAKORO-DOUMBA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide, le mil et le riz avec   FATOUMATA, 1ère personne  assise de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of Sabougnouma III Group are married women who average 27 years of age and 2 children each. They all live in polygamous families in Drakoro-Doumba, a village in Ouelessebougou, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their sixth farming loan from the MFI.

They grow peanuts, millet, and rice, just like Fatoumata, the woman sitting on the left in the photograph. With her loan, she intends to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay plowing cost to maintain 2 hectares.

After the harvest, the production is sold at the market, to a clientele comprising resellers and consumers. Fatoumata intends to turn an average profit of XOF 195'000 per planting.

This profit will enable her to repay the loan, and also help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay plowing cost

loans.name: Sabougnouma Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  SABOUGNOUMA IV  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DRAKORO-DOUMBA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est le riz, le mil et le gombo avec   DJENEBA BOURAMA, 1ère personne  assise de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of Sabougnouma IV Group are married women who average 35 years of age and 5 children each. They all live in polygamous families in Drakoro-Doumba, a village in Ouelessebougou, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their sixth farming loan from the MFI.

They grow rice, millet, and okra, just like Djeneba Bourama, the woman sitting on the right in the photograph. With her loan, she intends to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay plowing cost to maintain 2 hectares.

After the harvest, the production is sold at the market, to a clientele comprising resellers and consumers. Djeneba Bourama, intends to turn an average profit of XOF 195'000 per planting.

This profit will enable her to repay the loan, and also help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay plowing cost

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in maintaining her coffee plantation which includes fertilization, cleaning and paying labor

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ninfa is 44 years old and one of her children is currently in school.

Ninfa has a selling herbal products business in the Philippines. Ninfa requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more herbal products to sell to her customers.

Ninfa has been in this business for one year. Ninfa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more herbal products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to update machinery for vehicle repair.

loans.name: Inti Sol Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “INTI SOL” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: taller de ambulante, venta de papas fritas, venta de comida, venta de golosinas, venta de lana.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su hermana que era cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años implementándolo con un pequeño capital que formo de otro negocio. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de máquina de coser) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Inti Sol” communal bank is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional center.  The group is comprised of nine members and managed by a board of directors where Maria is president.  The members of the association are engaged in various businesses including traveling seamstress, as well as selling French Fries, meals, candy, and wool.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small businesses where Maria is a member.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, and joined at the invitation of her sister who was a client of the institution.  Currently, she has a sewing shop, and says that she  started this business several years ago, establishing it with a little capital that she gained from another business.

The loan she is requesting now is to increase capital (to purchase a sewing machine), which she will purchase from the sellers in el Alto.  Later, she will set it up in her sales space.  This form of work will permit her to generate income to support her family since she is married and has two children.
When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she liked the health benefits offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to hire laborers for weeding, pruning and harvesting his crops.

loans.name: Odai

texts.en:
Odai is a 24-year-old single university student living with his parents in Irbid, Jordan. He is majoring in business administration, and he is in his fourth year. He also works in the evening at a clothing store. 

Odai is planning to get his bachelor's degree so that he will find a better job in his study field. Now he is seeking a loan that will help him pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalinda is 45 years old and two of her children are in school.

Rosalinda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Daniel Ibrahim

texts.en:
Daniel Ibrahim is a Babban Gona farmer from Maidawa. Daniel Ibrahim expressed that he is driven by one goal: "to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.” It is the desire to fulfill this ambition that led Daniel Ibrahim to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. 

Like all Babban Gona members, Daniel Ibrahim can earn up to $2,000 per hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Daniel Ibrahim, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 45 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Daniel Ibrahim will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season he said, “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland." With this loan, Daniel Ibrahim will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double his maize yield and income

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Venta de mercancia como colonias, ropa, calzado y perfumería es uno de los negocios que posee Carmen en el muniicpio donde habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en edades de 2 y 11 años. Este fue su segundo egocio, porque inicialmente vendia minutos a celulares e inició con un paln corporativo al que fue agregando una fotocopiadora servicios de internet y recargas, actividad con la que hoy tambien cuenta para generar ingresos. Su punto de venta es un pequeño local donde vende a crédito y de contado desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, Sus principales clientes son los vecinos del barrio y tiene como meta mejorara su negocio y abrir otro punto de ventas  y a futuro ampliar su apartamento de segundo piso. Su mayor desafio es salirle al paso a la competencia y obtener el suficiente capital para poder incrmentar sus ventas y sus ingresos. Carmen está alicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará ropa, calzado, colonias, perfumeria etc. Con esta inversión su clientela tendrá  mejores opciones de compra y con ello impactará la imagen de su negocio, lo cual se constituye en el éxito de su negocio.
texts.en: Carmen lives with her spouse and two children ages 2 and 11. She owns a business in her neighborhood selling items such as colognes, perfumes, clothing, shoes and others. This is her second business. Initially, she started selling pay-per-use cell phones, which she expanded by adding photocopy and internet services. This is now additional income for her. She has a small store where she sells in cash and credit from 7am to 7pm. Her main customers are also her neighbors. Her goal is to improve her business and open a second location in the future, so she can expand into a second floor in her apartment. Her biggest challenge is to win over the competition and make enough money to increase sales and revenue. Carmen is requesting for this loan from Kiva, through Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy clothes, shoes, cologne, perfume etc. With this investment her customers will have better options and which, in time, will have an impact in her business and her success.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, cologne, perfume etc. for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough meat for cooking soup to sell.

loans.name: Erika Johana

texts.es:
Erika es una joven de 24 años de edad muy emprendedora, trabajadora y simpática. 
Encontró en la venta de mercancía como ropa para todo tipo de personas la manera para generar buenos ingresos y poder tener otra vez la ilusión de retomar sus sueños de estudiar y ejercer un cargo administrativo en alguna importante empresa, por eso quiere a toda costa aumentar sus ventas y poder tener una clientela fija ofertando sus productos o incluso empleando una persona que le apoye en su trabajo. 
Por esta razón solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía variada como ropa en diferentes estilos que le permita atraer una mayor cantidad de clientes y mejorar sus ventas.
Sus ingresos planea destinarlos en su negocio y en sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Erika is a 24-year-old young woman who is very enterprising, hardworking, and nice. In selling all kinds of clothing she found a way to generate a good income and restart her hopes of going back to school and filling an administrative position in some important company. That is the reason why above all else she wants to increase her sales and build a solid customer base by offering her products or even hiring someone to help her with her work.

She is requesting this loan to buy assorted merchandise, such as different styles of clothing. This will allow her to attract more customers and improve her sales. She plans to invest her income in her business and in getting a higher education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to hire laborers to work on the farm and purchase farming inputs such as fertilizer and insect traps.

loans.name: Tendai

texts.en: Tendai is a 20-year-old businesswoman from the Muzarabani District of Zimbabwe. She is a dedicated woman who campaigns for the economic independence for all young women in her community. As a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide, Tendai facilitates life skills at the local secondary school. As an entrepreneur, Tendai sells grocery items because she found that there was a market in her area for such an endeavor. The Kiva loan will enable Tendai to expand her business. She will buy sugar, cooking oil, soap, stationery, candles, flour, milk, juice, salt, and cornmeal in bulk. Tendai hopes to build her own shop in her community in the near future so that she can improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil, soap, stationery, candles, flour, milk, juice, salt, and cornmeal in bulk.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar es de la ciudad de Itá, vive con sus padres y hermanos, y comenta que está estudiando la carrera de enfermería.
Comenta que siempre quiso poder ayudar a las demás personas y es por ello que le gusta su carrera. También quiere poder sentirse útil y ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo ya que tiene cuotas que quiere cubrir, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Oscar is from the city of Itá and lives with his parents and siblings. He says that he is studying for a degree in Nursing.

Oscar says that he has always wanted to help other people, which is why he likes his degree program. He also wants to feel useful and become someone in life.

Oscar is requesting this loan so that he can cover his fees, which will enable him to continue his studies. He appreciates the opportunity he has received.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Rael, a 56-year-old mother who is very hardworking, honest and always takes care of her family. Rael is a mother of 3 children who is always jovial and you can always notice that in her face and this makes her family very happy. Rael has been doing farming for the past 6 years and through farming she has managed to provide for her family. Litein area of Kenya is where Rael hails from and this place is very fertile with good climatic conditions that favor crop and animal farming.

Litein area is one of the places that was blessed with good soils, climate and rainfall patterns and all these factors are very rare to find in one place, which is why Rael, being an enterprising person, decided to start planting tomatoes and vegetables. That is why she is seeking a loan of KES 45,000 to start planting tomatoes and vegetables). Rael has a keen eye and has noticed that all the factors in this area favor tomatoes and vegetable farming, that is good climate, roads, markets and the immense knowledge that she has on farming, and all these combined will give him an advantage when she starts farming.

Because of available markets Rael will reap more profits and also proximity to the road will ensure products are always fresh hence fetching a high price in the market. Rael's dream is not only to supply the local market but also to supply in international markets. Rael believes that the extra income she will get will allow permanent changes in her life and increase her business.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and vegetables seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods: salt, gallon of oil, cassava, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en: Jovita is married and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with her family. To earn a living, she has been selling snacks for many years. With her earnings, she has been able to support her children's schooling. Jovita has requested a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy raw ingredients to prepare more snacks to sell. She wants to build a retail store in her village in order to make her products more accessible. Her goal for the future is to improve the general living situation of her entire family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Judith, 32 years of age, very hardworking, honest and humble. She hails from the Litein area of Kenya, an area that has good weather patterns and one of the best places to buy land so that you can start farming both small scale and large scale. Judith is a mother of three adorable kids that always make her day bright when she sees them, or as she often refers to them, “her stars.” Because of lack of proper employment, Judith ventured into farming six years ago, and she has never regretted it because of the profits that she has been making. Through profits from dairy farming, crop farming and personal business, Judith has been able to earn a decent income and always put a plate of food on the table for her family. Although she has been making profits, Judith still faces challenges in comfortably supporting her family and has a plan to start a horticulture business. The Litein area has some of the best conditions that favor horticulture farming: a good market, soil, climate and good transport system in her area. Because of the above reasons, she is seeking a loan of KES 50,000 to start horticulture farming. Through good soil and climate, she will be able to sell fruits, vegetables and potatoes to the nearby markets, and this means increased profit levels. Transporting the products to the market will never be a hurdle because of the good transport system, and hence products will always reach the market while they are still fresh, hence more income.
Judith's plan is to be able to increase the market for her horticulture business and not only sell in the local market but also sell internationally. Through increased markets, she will be able to provide a secure future for her children and a good education for them.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy enough goods that is (rice, salt, red oil, union etc)

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es: María es una mujer trabajadora de 36 años de edad, soltera, tiene dos hijos, ambos estudian en la escuela comunitaria, quienes vive en el departamento de Suchitepéquez. Su actividad principal  es a la venta de lociones para hombres y mujeres, su mercado meta son las personas quienes viven en las colonias y sectores de su comunidad, y ahora es conocida por la venta de sus productos, inicio con el negocio hace cuatro años, además en sus tiempos libres se dedica al cuidado de niños de sus vecinos, con el propósito de obtener sus ingresos y contribuir al sostenimiento de su familia. Está solicitando un préstamo de Q 10,000.00 para la compra de materiales de construcción y poder remodelar su vivienda. Ella va a pagar por este prestamo con los ingresos de su empresa de la venta de lociones.  La meta que tiene es contar con una vivienda digna, además quiere ver graduados a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a working woman of 36 years old.  She is single, has two sons, both studying in the community school  and lives in Suchitepéquez department.

Her main activity is the sale of lotions for men and women.  Her target market is people who live in outskirts and sectors of the community. She is now known for selling her products, beginning with the business four years ago.  In her free time, she is devoted to caring for her neighbor's children.

In order help support her family, she is requesting a loan of Q 10,000.00 for the purchase of construction materials and to remodel her home. She will be paying off this loan with her profits from her lotion business. The goal she has is to have a decent home and she also wants to see their children graduate.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials to remodel her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cassava for making GB to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: by buying more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough fish, salt, red oil, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough food to sell, such as rice, salt, red oil, onions, etc.

loans.name: Moreblessing

texts.en: Moreblessing is a 20-year-old businesswoman from the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She was encouraged by other members of Cama (Camfed's alumnae organization) to venture into business, and now she has keeping broiler chickens in batches of 50 birds every six weeks for four months. Moreblessing also volunteers in her community by doing household chores for the elderly. With the Kiva loan, Moreblessing intends to purchases more chicks and   boost her sales and profits. With additional profits, she hopes to expand her business, create jobs for members of her community, and also provide for her siblings.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Saliwe

texts.en:
Saliwe is a 29-year-old businesswoman. She is married and has three children. She lives in the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. Saliwe has been successfully buying and selling clothes and shoes, for over a year and a half. She sells stockings, shoes, shirts, skirts, shorts, pants, bags, t-shirts, track suits, and dresses. When she is not working in the flea market, Saliwe serves every week as a volunteer Learner Guide in her community’s school.

With the requested Kiva loan, Saliwe intends to make bulk clothing purchases, which will reduce her costs and boost her sales and profits. She is looking forward to improving her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Annastancia

texts.en: Annastancia is an 18-year-old businesswoman who sells clothes for children and adults, belts, and bags. She is not yet married, and she lives in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully running her business at the flea market for two months now. Annastancia volunteers with other Cama members by assisting needy orphans in her community with food and household chores. She intends to use the loan to increase her stock by purchasing more clothes, belts, and bags so she can increase her profit levels. She intends to use the additional profits to pay school fees for her siblings.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, belts and bags to sell.

loans.name: Magaji

texts.en:
Magaji remembers not being able to feed his family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now Magaji, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2,000 per hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags per hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Magaji is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  

“In five years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty,” expressed Magaji. With this loan, Magaji is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seeds in order to double his income and yield.

loans.name: Yulduzkhon

texts.ru: Юлдузхон молодая и жизнерадостная женщина. Она родилась в 1989 году. Юлдузхон замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 не совершеннолетних детей. Она 3 года назад начала свой бизнес купле продажей мужской одежды на местном рынке. Она постепенно год за годом развевает свой бизнес и расширяет ассортимент товара. Юлдузхон является основной кормилицей семьи, так как ее муж фермер и имеет маленький доход. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США для покупки мужской одежды для нового сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Yulduzkhon is a young and happy woman. She was born in 1989. Yulduzkhon is married and raising two underage children. She started her business of reselling men's clothing at a local market 3 years ago. She has been gradually growing her business year after year and expanding the merchandise selection. Yulduzkhon is the sole provider for her family because her husband is a farmer and has a small income. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 US dollars to buy men's clothing for the new season. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy men's clothing for the new season

loans.name: Mamagul

texts.ru: Мамагул родилась в 1977 году. Она живет одна, так как она разведена и не имеет детей. Мамагул имеет медицинское образование. Она работает медсестрой. Мамагул работает в больнице более 7 лет. Она работает качественно и старается лечить больных своевременно. Она уже несколько лет хочет отремонтировать свой дом, так как ее дом в плохом состоянии. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 8000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, краски и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mamagul was born in 1977. She lives alone because she is divorced and does not have children. Mamagul has a medical education. She works as a nurse. Mamagul has been working at a hospital for over 7 years. She performs her work well and tries to provide timely care for patients. She has been wanting to repair her house because her house is in a bad condition. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 80 000 somoni to buy construction materials, such as cement, wood, paint, etc. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement, wood, paint, etc., to repair her house

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 38 years old, married to a farmer and blessed with one child. She has been managing a vegetable vending business in their village for almost a year and a half and earns a net income of PHP 250 daily. 

Due to insufficient funding, she would like to take a loan amounting to PHP 11,000 to purchase string beans, eggplant, sweet potatoes and tomatoes to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow productively so that she can earn more income on this business venture.

loans.use: To purchase string beans, eggplant, sweet potatoes and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Luz America

texts.es:
Luz tiene 58 años de edad vive en el Canton San Miguel Provincia de Bolivar su estado civil es casada vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos.
Es integrante de la Ventanilla Rural Las Guardias que se dedica a la agricultura.

Se dedica a la agricultura y siembra de maíz papas y mora.   
El dinero del  crédito utilizara para sembrar y comprar de insumos para poder sembrar realiza sus compras en la ciudad de las Guardias. Su sueño es incrementar el negocio, en el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión y salir de paseo.
texts.en:
Luz is 58 years old and lives in the canton of San Miguel, in Bolivar Province. She is married and lives with her husband and their six children. She belongs to the communal bank Las Guardias, whose members are all farmers.

She works as a farmer growing corn, potatoes, and blackberries. She will use the money from this loan to buy farm supplies in order to plant her crops. She makes her purchases in the city of Las Guardias. Her dream is to increase her business. She enjoys watching television and going out for walks in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural  supplies which will help grow and maintain her coffee plants

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 35, married and the mother of four children aged 7, 4, 2 and 1. She is both a community development officer and a farmer who grows crops such as maize and beans to help generate income to support her family. She has approached Ugafode for a loan to help her hire workers to harvest her maize crop. Despite the challenges of bad weather and price fluctuations, she promises to pay the loan back after her harvest is in. Her dream is to acquire a tractor to use on her farm.

loans.use: to hire workers to help on her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more grocery products

loans.name: Beritha

texts.en:
Beritha is a 22-year-old married woman who lives in the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully buying and selling clothes for over 10 months. She sells jackets, shirts, skirts, and dresses. When she is not working in her flea market, Beritha serves as a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school leading sessions on life and study skills.  

With the Kiva loan, Beritha intends to make bulk purchases of jackets, shirts, skirts, and dresses to reduce costs and increase sales. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and provide for her family’s basic needs. Beritha aims to further her education, as well.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mitchelle

texts.en:
Mitchelle is a 19-year-old married woman with one child. She lives in the Mt Darwin District of Zimbabwe. As a Camfed Learner Guide, she volunteers to teach life and study skills to students in her community.  

Mitchelle also sells clothes, shoes, bags, and other accessories at a nearby flea market. Her business began in 2012 when she married her husband and wished to help increase the family’s income. The Kiva loan will improve the business and allow her to eventually open her own shop.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, shoes, bags, and other accessories for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to hire laborers to work on the farm and purchase farming inputs such as fertilizer and insect traps.

loans.name: Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HORMIGUITAS” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Encarnación es la Presidenta.
