Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de construcción, compra y venta de ganado, venta de papa y chuño (papa deshidratada), venta de comida, tejido de mantas, compra y venta de ganado, taller de tejido de awuayo, tejido de mantas.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Encarnación es integrante, ella indica hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de tejido de awayos; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicia hace varios años, aprendiendo la elaboración de su amiga a quien ayudo varios años, con un pequeño capital da inicio a un negocio independiente donde trabaja toda su familia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para alimento en tiempo de sequía (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el seguro de vida que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The 'Hormiguitas' group will start their fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the regional hub of Achacachi. The group is made up of eight members and is led by a board of executives of which Encarnacion is the president. The group's members run a variety of businesses, some of which are: a construction service, purchase and resale of cattle, sales of potatoes and chuño (dehydrated potato), food, woven  blankets and a workshop of woven coawuayo.
 
This loan will benefit the small business holders, one of whom is Encarnacion. She says that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago after being invited by a promoter of the instution who visited her at home. She currently runs a woven awayos workshop. It is worth noting that this is a business she started many years ago after learning the technique from a friend who spent years helping her. With a bit of start up capital she began an independent business where her whole family now works. 
 
The loan that she is currently taking out is for food in times of drought (wool in bulk) which she will obtain from the bulk sellers in the city of El Alto. After the fabric is woven she will sell them from her work space. This line of work allows her to generate an income to support her family as she lives with her partner and two children. 

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, Encarnacion replied that she liked the life insurance that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool in bulk

loans.name: Asal

texts.ru: Асалу 49 лет. Она замужем. Муж, как и многие мужчины республики, находиться за приделами страны, на заработках. У Асал есть единственный сын. Ему 9 лет. Для Асал ее сын самое главное и важное в жизни. Ради него она живет и работает. Сын учиться в местной средней школе. Асал с сыном живут на районе Шахритус. Там же она работает. Асал на рынке продает запчасти автомобилей. Данной деятельностью она занята уже 7 лет свой жизни. Помог начать бизнес ее муж. Она за все благодарна своему мужу за все. Асал давно занимается этой деятельностью, и намерена далее развивать бизнес в этом направлении. Она просит кредит, чтобы расширить ассортимент продаваемого товара. Она привезет новые товары на перепродажу.
texts.en: Asal is 49 years old and married. She lives in Shahrituz region. Like many other Tajik men, her husband is a migrant worker. Her only son is 9 years old and he is the most important thing in her life. She lives and works only for him. Her son is attending the local high school, while Asal sells auto-parts at the local market. She has been earning a living like this for seven years. Her husband helped starting the business and she is grateful to him for everything. Asal wants to expand her business and is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory. She will use the money to import more auto-parts for her store.

loans.use: to expand business and import new goods for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to hire workers and buy supplies for a farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant potatoes

loans.name: Hoshim

texts.ru: Хошим мужчина в возрасте 51 года. Хошим житель сельской местности. Опыт работы в сфере животноводства  у Хошима большой. Хошим с детства помогал отцу выращивать, пасти и продавать скот. В детстве отец  подарил ему несколько ягнят, чтобы Хошим сам почувствовал ответственность за свой скот. Сейчас разведение и откорм скота это основной доход Хошима. Так как он живет в сельской местности,  то по сезону работает на полях наемным рабочим. Жена Хошима так же работает на поле по сезону и в свободное время помогает мужу ухаживать за скотом. Хошим покупает и откармливает скот и потом перепродает его подороже. На вырученные деньги он покупает опять же скот и откармливает для дальнейшей продажи. Так как сейчас не сезон, у Хошима  возникли проблемы с финансами и поэтому он обратился за поддержкой к ООО МДО «Арванд». На полученный кредит Хошим планирует купить корм и скот пока он дешевый. Хошим заранее благодарен «Арванд»  за поддержку малоимущих слоев населения.
texts.en: Hoshim is a 51-year-old man. Hoshim is a resident of a rural village. He has a lot of work experience in the field of livestock breeding. From childhood, Hoshim has helped his father raise, graze and sell cattle. When Hoshim was a child, his father gave him several lambs so that Hoshim felt a sense of responsibility for his livestock. Now raising and fattening up cattle are Hoshim's primary source of income. Since he lives in the countryside, he works seasonally as a hired field hand. Hoshim's wife also works seasonally in the fields and helps her husband look after the cattle in her spare time. Hoshim buys and fattens up cattle and then resells them at a higher price. With the earned funds, he buys cattle again and fattens them up for future sale. As it is currently not the season to work in the fields, Hoshim has come into some financial troubles, which is why he turned to MDO "Arvand," LLC. With the received loan, Hoshim plans to buy feed and cattle while they are still cheap. Hoshim thanks "Arvand" in advance for supporting the poorest segment of society.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio es un hombre de 35 años de edad casado, tiene seis hijos y se dedica a la producción de queso.
Él es una persona tranquila de carácter humilde y conservador con muchas ganas de salir adelante, su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad de Cullucachi distante a tres horas en auto de la ciudad capital, su rutina comienza muy temprano por la mañana arreando el ganado vacuno hacia los pastizales para que sean alimentados.
Porfirio es de tez morena cabello negro corto y ojos negros, sus manos son gruesas y duras, su producción de queso ocupa casi todo su tiempo, también colaboran sus hijos que se encargan del comercio y transporte.
Las necesidades de su negocio están relacionadas con la cantidad de leche que logra obtener, él necesita incrementar la producción de leche para producir más y mejor queso. Su sueño es dejarles a sus hijos un negocio estable para que ellos continúen con esa labor.
Es por esos motivos que Porfirio solicita un préstamo para la compra de vacas y dar un paso más para cumplir el sueño de su vida.
texts.en: Porfirio is 35 years old. He is married, with six children and he work in the production of cheese. He is a humble, private and quiet person, eager to get ahead. His business is located in the community of Cullucachi a three hour drive from the capital city. His routine begins early in the morning herding cattle for pastures to be fed. Porfirio is dark-skinned, he has short black hair and black eyes, his hands are thick and hard. Cheese production takes most of his time, and his children also help him, by being in charge of trade and transportation. The challenges of his business are related to the amount of milk he can produce. He needs to increase milk production to obtain more and better cheese. His dream is to leave his children a stable business for them to continue with this work. For this reason, Porfirio is asking for a loan to purchase more cows and take a step to fulfill the dream of his life.

loans.use: to purchase more cows and take a step to fulfill the dream of his life.

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.ru: Зарифа молодая замужняя женщина в возрасте 23 лет, детей еще не имеет. Зарифа живет с мужем и его семьей в селе района Спитамен. Еще в юности Зарифа училась у родителей животноводству. 6 лет назад она самостоятельно начала свой животноводческий бизнес. Она у себя при дворе дома разводит и крупнорогатый и мелкорогатый скот. Эта деятельность приносит ей и доход и удовольствие. Сейчас в ее хозяйстве имеется всего пару овец и один бычок, поэтому она хочет увеличить их поголовье. Зарифа из-за нехватки финансов обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить маленького бычка и пару овец. Благодаря кредиту она сможет расширить бизнес.
texts.en: Zarifa is a 23 years old woman, without kids. She lives with her husband and his family in a village in Spitamen region. Since childhood Zarifa has learned to raise livestock from her parents. Six years ago she started her own independent livestock business. She uses her backyard to raise both cattle and sheep. This work brings her both good profits and a lot of enjoyment. Currently Zarifa has a few sheep and a calf, so she wants to expand her herd. As she has insufficient personal savings, Zarifa has turned to us for a loan which she will use to buy another calf and a few more sheep. The loan will help her expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a young calf and a few sheep for business expansion

loans.name: Momagul

texts.ru: Женщину за фотографии зовут Момагул. Ей 69 лет. Она пенсионерка. Она замужем, муж тоже пенсионер. Момагул с мужем имеют четырех детей. Момагул и ее муж не работают и живут на пособиях. Они очень давно вместе и очень сильно любят друг друга. Момагул с мужем не могут себе многого позволить, но Момагул очень давно хотела купить новую мебель для дома, и муж ее поддержал в выборе. Чтобы приобрести желаемую мебель ей не хватает достаточной суммы денег. И она решила обратиться за кредитом, чтобы совершить задуманное. Она очень надеется на Вашу отзывчивость. Поддержите Момагул.
texts.en: Momagul is 69 years old, she and her husband are retired. They have been together for a long time and love each other dearly. Momagul and her husband have four adult kids. As the two live off pension money, they cannot afford much, but Momagul really wanted to buy new furniture for their house. Her husband supports her. Momagul's savings are not enough to cover the furniture purchase, so she has applied for a loan from KIVA. She hopes for your support. Please help Momagul!

loans.use: to buy furniture

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
La  señora Reina es una persona  emprendedora,  honesta, responsable  y seria, vive con sus 2 hijos en una comunidad  al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y  venta  de  ropa  y cuajada lo cual  hace desde hace más de 4 años.
Doña Reina vende su producto en su casa de habitación y lugares cercanos su actividad  forma la mayor parte de sus ingresos y el préstamo lo necesita  para  la compra de fardos de ropa mixta como pantalones, camisas, short, blusas, calzonetas, faldas, etc. 
Doña Reina espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más mercancía que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir así  las necesidades de los mismos, y con esto mejorar la situación  económica de su familia. 
Doña  Reina  espera que  a un corto plazo   su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en  el  más conocido de su colonia y seguir  apoyando a su familia.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Julio  del   2014
texts.en:
Reina is an enterprising person, honest, responsible and serious.  She lives with her two children in a community in southern Honduras.  Her business for more than four years has been buying and selling clothing and  cuajada (cheese).   Reina sells her products in the house where she lies and nearby places.  This work provides most of her income, and she needs the loan to buy bundles of mixed clothing such as pants, shirts, shorts, blouses, footwear, skirts, etc.  

Reina hopes that sales will increase when she has more merchandise to offer her customers, and she can fulfill their needs and thus improve the financial situation of her family.  She hopes that in the near future her business will keep growing to be the best-known in her residential area and continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, shorts, blouses, footwear, skirts, etc., for resale

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is  32 years old, hardworking, and married.  His wife also works, and they now have four children. For the last three years, Stephen has earned a living by operating a motorcycle transport business. He makes KES. 10,000 every month, and is requesting his third loan, for KES. 30,000, from VisionFund Kenya. He intends to use the loan to add to his personal savings so he can buy another motorcycle to use in his transport business. He plans to use the additional income he expects to earn educate his children, build a rental house, and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy an additional motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more thread and new embroidery tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to hire laborers to work on the farms and purchase farming inputs such as fertilizer and insect traps

loans.name: Murtala

texts.en: Murtala remembers not being able to pay school fees during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Murtala, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Murtala  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  He expressed the following: "In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family." With this loan, Murtala is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: to access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seeds in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Khasiyat

texts.ru: Эту 49-летнюю женщину зовут Хасият. Она разведена и живет с дочерью в районе Шахритус. Ее дочь замужем и имеет двоих детей. Для Хасият в этой жизни опорой являются ее дочь и внуки. Она их очень любит и трудится ради них. Хасият 5 лет назад начала свой маленький бизнес. Она на местном рынке района занимает место, где каждый день торгует там овощами и фруктами. Дочь и зять помогают ей в торговле. Так как сейчас сезон арбуза и дыни, Хасият хочет привезти больше товара, но для этой цели у нее нет достаточных денежных средств. Она просит кредит, чтобы оптом привезти большую партию арбуза, дыни и овощей, и таким образом увеличить свой единственный источник дохода.
texts.en: This 49 year old woman is Khasiyat. She is divorced and lives with her daughter in Shahrituz region. Her daughter is married and has two kids. Her daughter and grandkids are everything for Khasiyat. She loves them and works to help them live better lives. Khasiyat has had her small business for 5 years. She has a spot at the local market where she sells vegetables and fruit every day. Her daughter and son-in-law help her as well. As watermelons and cantaloupes are in season now, Khasiyat wants to purchase a large batch of fruit, but her savings are insufficient to finance such a purchase. That is why she is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase the produce wholesale and so expand her only source of income.

loans.use: to purchase watermelons, cantaloupes and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Shodigul

texts.en:
Shodigul is 42 years old, hardworking, and dedicated to her own business. She is married and has four children. She is a farmer and has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last six years. She chose this business because it is profitable and her fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes are made of vegetables.

Shodigul sells her crops in the local market.  Her husband actively helps her to raise the crops.

As these products are in high demand, Shodigul wants to expand her business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demands. For this purpose she applied for 5,000 TJS. She will buy seeds and fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: As a way of generating income, Susan has been selling fruit, vegetables and snack foods to people in her community. Her goal is to help her husband generate income. She is 50 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are still in school. Despite hardships, she wants her children to earn degrees so that they will become professionals. Due to the high cost of schooling, Susan aims to improve her business in order to earn a larger income. Because she does not have adequate capital, she is requesting a loan for PHP15,000 to buy more vegetables, fruits, rice and coconuts to resell. She believes that this financial assistance will help her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, fruits, rice and coconuts to resell

location.town: Brgy. Bintawan Norte, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Shahr Ramadhan Group

texts.en:
Shahr Ramadhan is a group which is comprised of four members, women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB.

Kheria is the leader of the group. She is a 32-year-old married woman with four children. Her eldest child is 11 years old and the youngest one is 1 year old. She studied until an elementary education. Now, she is an employee as a guard with a security company. Her husband is a worker and doesn't have a fixed income. Kheria shares with him in most of the expenses of the family. From her salary, she assisted her husband in purchasing a piece of land and built their one house where they now live. Their house lacks of many food materials. As a result, Kheria applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food materials to provide all of the needs of her children and to make delicious food for them. 

Kheria looks forward to improving the living standards of her family. She plans to open a saving account through AMB.

loans.use: to purchase food materials to provide all of the needs of her children and to make delicious food for them

loans.name: Johna

texts.en: Johna is married and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with her family. She owns and operates a banana farm to make a living. Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC to buy organic fertilizer in order to improve her farm. She planned to cultivate her entire vacant lot to use it for farm expansion.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Edith Xiomara

texts.es:
La señora Edith es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a sus hijos y su esposo en una comunidad en la zona sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas el cual es muy conocido en su comunidad lo que hace que la demanda de su producto sea mucha. 
Doña Edith necesita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y cal para seguir elaborando sus tortillas y contar con este ingreso el cual es muy importante para su hogar, espera que gracias a esta inversión en su negocio pueda contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando el mismo y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.
Doña Edith espera que los ingresos que obtenga le permitan salir adelante con su familia y que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia y sus  hijos continúen con  sus estudios y tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Julio  2014
texts.en:
Edith is a hardworking and responsible person. She lives with her children and husband in a community in the south of Honduras. She sells and makes tortillas, which are well known in her community which has huge demand for her products. 
Edith needs a loan to buy corn, firewood and lime to further develop her tortillas as having this income is very important for her home, and hopes that through this investment in her business she can have the necessary supplies to continue doing the same work and thus meet her customer's demands. 
Edith expects that her revenue will allow her family to get ahead and to keep her business growing and becoming the best known in the community, so she can continue supporting her family and her children, so they can go to school and have better opportunities in life. Choluteca, Honduras - July 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and line for her business

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru: Санавбар очень трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1980 году. Санавбар ответственная мать 3 детей. Она всегда старается, чтобы ее дети получили хорошее образование. Она 5 лет назад начала свой бизнес купле продажей парфюмерия. Ее муж работает сторожем на местном рынке. Его зарплата маленькая и поэтому Санавбар была вынуждена начать бизнес и улучшить условию проживания. Санавбар торгует на местном рынке. Благодаря упорному труду она имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Санавбар запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки парфюмерия для расширения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sanavbar is a hard working woman. She was born in 1980 and is a responsible mother of three kids. She is always trying to make sure her children will receive a good education. Five years ago Sanavbar started selling perfume at the local market. Her husband works as a security guard at the local market. His salary is small and so Sanavbar was forced to start supporting her family with her business. Due to her hard work she now has regular clients. Currently, Sanavbar is requesting a loan of 10,000 somoni to purchase perfume and so expand her business and increase her working capital. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy perfumes for expanding her working capital

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en: Sokly is 20 years old and a student at a university. She lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Due to a lack of financial support, she would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees. This loan will help her graduate. In the future, she is going to find a good job with a reasonable salary to help her family.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Antonio es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a sus hijos y esposa. Su negocio es el servicio de molino desde hace 6 años.
Don Antonio esto lo hace en su casa de habitación y debido a que es un lugar muy céntrico tiene muchos clientes. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas para brindarle el mantenimiento necesario a su molino. 
Don Antonio con el préstamo espera que su negocio funcione de la mejor manera y así aumentar sus ingresos y gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, también espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio ya sea comprando otro molino y con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia en cualquier problema económico que surja y de esta forma darse una mejor calidad de vida
.

Choluteca, Honduras – Julio  del  2014
texts.en:
Antonio is a very hard-working and responsible person who lives in a community in Southern Honduras with his wife and children. He has had a business providing milling servicing for 6 years. He carries this out at home and, since his house is quite central, he has a lot of clients. He needs the loan to buy tools to provide the necessary maintenance for his mill.

Antonio hopes his business will function in the best possible way and and he can thus increase his income. Thanks to this, he will be able to improve the quality of life for his family. He also hopes in the short term to grow his business by buying another mill and to continue supporting his family in this way to counter any economical problem that might arise. In this way, he will be able to give them a better quality of life.
Choluteca, Honduras – July, 2014

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his mill.

loans.name: Fatheya

texts.en: Fatheya was born in 1964. She is a married woman living with her husband and five sons and daughters in Salt, Jordan. Her husband is a driver and his income isn't enough to support his family. Fatheya has been helping her husband in providing their children with a better life for four years by running her own project, sewing clothes and doing embroidery. Now she is seeking to raise her profits to improve their living conditions by buying a new sewing machine, as the one she is currently using has become old and needs a lot of repairs. She also wants to bring in more fabric and threads. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Edis Margarita

texts.es:
Edis de 63 años de edad, su grado escolar es de 1° año de primaria pues sus padres no le dieron la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, a los 17 años se caso pero 25 años después quedo sola su esposo murió,  desde ahí a luchado por mantener siempre unida la familia a pesar de que ninguno de sus hijos vive con ella; pero si tiene el apoyo de dos de ellos los otros tienen mayores dificultades.

Edis posee una tienda que tiene desde hace unos 15 años, la idea fue de sus hijos cuando determinaron que ella ya no podía trabajar como antes lo hacía. Se mantiene ocupada, que es algo que a ella le gusta, la tienda la abre a las cinco de la mañana y las cierra a las 7 de la noche todos los días. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar productos lácteos, como lo es queso, crema, y todo lo que es consumible comprar por mayor, para obtener mejores precios. Es así, que quiere mejorar la tienda para servirles de mejor manera a sus clientes y entonces se sentirá satisfecha.  

El sueño de Edis, es mantener la tienda y ampliarla poco a poco, pues ella cree que todavía tiene fuerzas para sostener y atender los clientes.
texts.en:
Edis is 63. She only finished up to 1st grade because her parents did not give her the chance to go to school. She was married at 17, but after 25 years, her husband passed away. Since then, she's been fighting to keep the family together even though none of her children live with her any longer. She has the support of two of them, but the rest are going through tougher times.
Edis has owned a store for more than 15 years. Her children gave her the idea, once their recognized she couldn't continue working like she used to. She keeps herself busy. She opens at 5am and closes at 7pm every day.
She is asking for a loan from CREDICAMPO to buy wholesale dairy products, such as cheese, cream, and all other consumables, to get the best prices. 
She wants to improve the store to better serve her customers and then feel satisfied. Edis's dream is to keep the shop and slowly make expansions, as she believes she still has the strength to hold on and deal with her customers.

loans.use: para comprar productos lácteos, como lo es queso, crema, y todo lo que es consumible comprar por mayor, para obtener mejores precios.

loans.name: Khor

texts.en:
Khor, 38, lives with her husband and two children in a small village of Prey Veng province. So far, she has been working in agribusinesses, growing rice and selling the product to the local dealers and customers in the market of her community. The average income that she can generate is USD 4 a day.
Khor is applying for a loan to buy solar energy systems to supply energy to her household. With the support of this loan, she hopes that she can improve her life through the convenience of using many electrical devices such as TV, lights, fans, and DVD player. She would like to thank all the lenders for their financial support of poor people like her.

loans.use: to buy solar energy systems

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 50-year-old female Ugandan. She is divorced with five children aged 30, 28, 25 and 22. She has been paying school fees for them since they separated from the husband in 1997.

Mary is a farmer who has grown maize and cassava for the last 30 years. She does this in order to meet the family demands.

She has applied for a loan of 750,000 UGX to pay tuition for her children in a tertiary institution. She cannot afford this cost all at once, but can afford small installments after selling her agricultural products.

Mary faces a challenge of seasonality of the business and limited capital. She is hardworking and resilient.

loans.use: to pay tuition

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a 50-year-old farmer from R/Tabo.  As a Babban Gona member, Joshua is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Joshua can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Joshua is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, his said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Musa, Hassan and  Usaini. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Mombasa Group

texts.en:
Amon is a father of five children, three sons and two daughters. Three are grown up and the rest are still in school. He is married and is in his late forties.

He has been managing his family by using income from his genge (grocery) business. Amon has been in this business for three years now and is able to earn a fair monthly profit. He sells fruits and vegetables, but he desires to sell more and other related items to become a genge-duka.  Amon works at his business from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily.

He is requesting a second loan through Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan that he repaid to buy fruits and vegetables. He earned extra income which he used to cover home and school expenses. 

Amon dreams to change his business to a genge-duka selling fruits, vegetables, sodas, water, rice, beans, maize, baking flour, and sugar. He believes that by doing so, his family income will grow and to some extent improve living conditions. He will use this loan to buy a new stock of soft drinks, sodas, water, juices, fruits, and vegetables to resell. 

Amon and four other members form the Mobasa Group. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new stock of soft drinks, sodas, water, juices, fruits, and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. He has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. His major challenge is stiff competition from other retail operators.

Harrison is requesting this loan to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 31-year-old, hardworking man. He is married to Maureen, who adds additional income to supporting the family's well-being, and they are taking care of one child. Daniel has been operating an electronics repair shop for six years, earning an income of 10,000 KES at the end of every month.  

Daniel is servicing his third loan of 22,500 KES and intends to use the entire amount to acquire a big and spacious shop in order to replace his current shop, which is small and cannot accommodate more electronics.

Daniel plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his child and hopes to build a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: to acquire a big spacious shop to accommodate more electronics

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 42-year-old, married man with three children. His eldest child is 11 years old and his youngest child is 3 years old. He lives with his family in Taiz city, Yemen. He has a university Education. He is the sole breadwinner of his family. The family lacks many food materials inside the house. This negatively affects the living standards of the family. Khaled wants to provide all of the necessary needs of the family. As a result, Khaled applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food materials to provide all the needs of his children inside the house. 

Khaled looks forward to opening a large grocery and providing it with all goods and items. He plans to start his own project that will help him improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase food materials to provide all of the needs of his children inside the house

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a 40-year-old farmer from Bamiyayi.  As a Babban Gona member, he is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist. 

Like all Babban Gona members, Musa can earn up to $2000 per hectare this season from growing maize. This is more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags per hectare, double the national average of 14. 

However, Musa is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season. When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to educate my children Kamal, Safiya,and Aisha. My overall goal is to make more money for myself and my family.” 

With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: to purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 48-year-old, energetic lady. She is married and has 6 children.  She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has requested for a loan amount of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more reels of thread in different colors, packs of laces, zippers, and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue, so she may be able to generate more income. She is hopeful that with her hard work, she will be able to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more reels of thread in different colors, packs of laces, zippers, and buttons

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more pigeons to sell

loans.name: Reema

texts.en: Reema was born in 1983. She is a separated lady living in Wihdat, Jordan. After she got separated, four years ago she decided to support herself financially by selling children's and women's clothes. As she is now receiving more requests from her customers, she is seeking a loan to purchase a new collection of clothes to respond to their requests and to benefit from the upcoming Fitter Eid that will raise her sales.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of clothes to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam was born in 1976. She is a married woman living with her husband and four sons and daughters in Wihdat, Jordan. She has been supporting her husband financially by selling clothes for one year. Now she is seeking to purchase a larger collection of clothes after she built a good customer base so that she will raise her profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to assist in purchasing a professional steaming iron, materials, stock, equipment, table, and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en: Sophorn is 44 years old, a farmer, and a married woman with two children. Both of her children are garment workers. Her husband is a house builder. They live in Takeo Province, Cambodia. All of them can earn approximately $17 per day. Now she would like to apply for a loan to buy wood to wall off her kitchen. This loan will help her have a nicer kitchen. In the future, she is going to keep her rice farm going and fill the soil around her house.

loans.use: to buy wood to wall off her kitchen

loans.name: Esier

texts.en:
Esier is married and provides motorcycle transportation services to earn a living. 

He has run this business for many years, and he is able to support his family. 

Recently, Esier borrowed a loan to repair the existing motorcycle used for his transportation services. 

He hopes to gain more income in order to buy a sidecar for his motorcycle.

loans.use: to repair an existing motorcycle used for his transportation services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric material for sewing men's trousers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra, a 50-year-old married mother of five, has been operating a paint-brush manufacturing business for the past eight years. Manufacturing a variety of paint brushes in different shapes and sizes, she sells them in the market, using the income to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family. One of her sons assists her in the business. 

In her ninth loan cycle with an excellent repayment history, Bushra has now requested a new loan for 55000 PKR to buy raw materials such as wood, metal bands, spacer plugs and filaments. She is positive that over time her business will prosper and she will be able to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as wood, metal bands, spacer plugs and filaments.

loans.name: Manzooran

texts.en: Manzooran is a 44-year-old, married woman who is running a business of cattle sales and purchases. She has 1 buffalo and 4 cows for milking. She sells milk to the people living in nearby areas. Manzooran also makes butter with this milk which generates extra revenue. She is married and has 5 children. In her 6th loan cycle, she has requested for a loan amount of 50,000 PKR. With this loan, she intends to buy another buffalo and some feed. She is sure that the increase in production capacity will help her generate more revenue. She wants to use this revenue towards the well-being of her family members.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo and some feed

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel operates his own motorcycle to earn a living and has had this business for ten years. He earns well from this to provide for his family. He also has a farm, the family's main source of income. 

He successfully repaid his previous loan used for buying tires. Improving his farm is easier with his access to GDMPC micro-finance. He took a new loan to purchase fertilizer for this cropping season. 

 In the future, Joel hopes to have another motorcycle to increase earnings for his family's needs and for the education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna helps her husband operate their own motor-transportation-based business to make a living.  Aside from farming, they run this business to earn daily income. She earns well from this and she has successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC used for buying tires.

She took a new loan recently to cover the costs of repair and maintenance. She also plans to improve their own farm to have a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to cover the costs of repair and maintenance

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice farming business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farming business.

Meriam has been in this business for 39 years. Meriam earns additional income from raising pigs and buying and selling vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Meriam has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Baironesah

texts.en:
Baironesah works hard to support her family. Baironesah is married and has a buy-and-sell, ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Baironesah requested a 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell.

Baironesah has been in this business for 14 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Baironesah would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez is a 40-year-old woman. She is a very dedicated mother of 6 children. For 10 years, Kaneez has been running a business of making and selling woolen products such as hand-made sweaters, caps, etc. She has been supporting her family with the help of income from this business. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR. She wants to purchase wool yarns in various colors as well as yarn needles with the loan amount. She dreams of giving her children the best education and health facilities that she can afford.

loans.use: to purchase wool yarns in various colors as well as yarn needles

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta, a 52-year-old married mother of six, has been farming rice in the Philippines for 10 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Julieta is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim remembers feeling depressed during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now Ibrahim, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Ibrahim is ambitious and is aiming to reap 60 bags per hectare this season. “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family,” expressed Ibrahim. With this loan, Ibrahim is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double his yield and income.

loans.name: Layuri Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAYURI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hilda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papa, tejido de mantas, tejido de  mantas, compra y venta de ganado, venta de papa y chuño (papa deshidratada).
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hilda es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio compra y venta de chuño y papa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, ya que conocía este negocio de sus padres quienes trabajaban con los mismos productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa y chuño por mayor) que adquirirá de las productoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente lo comercializara en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es divorciada y tiene tres hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The A.C. “LAYURI” will begin the first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of Centro Focal de Patacamaya. It is made up of 8 members and is led by a board of directors where Hilda is president. The businesses of the communal association's members are varied and among them are knitting blankets, buying and selling livestock, and selling potatoes and chuño (dehydrated potatoes).

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesses where Hilda is a member. She says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer, joining through the invitation of an institution's promoter who came to visit her house. Right now, she has a business buying and selling chuño and potatoes. She says that she learned this business several years ago from her parents who also worked with these same products. 
 
The loan that she will take out is to increase capital (buying wholesale potatoes and chuño) that she will acquire from wholesale producers in her community, and afterwards she will sell them in her sales space. This form of work will allow her to generate resources to support her family because she is divorced and has three children. When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she like the training that the institute offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale potatoes and chuño.

loans.name: Raafat

texts.en:
Raafat is a 53-year-old married moher of five, who has been working in her own bakery since 2000. She is a hard worker, well known in her region with her special baked bread, Manakish, and pastries.

Raafat has been a Al Majmoua borrower for five cycles. Her previous loans were invested in developing her business and her family's living. Her previously settled loan was invested in supporting her son in paying some of his wedding expenses.
 
Today, her acquired loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with more quantities of flour, thyme, cheese and oil necessary for increasing her production with less cost.

She is working hard so that in the future she can develop her bakery more by increasing her production and maybe recruiting someone to help her increase her production.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with more quantities of flour, thyme, cheese and oil which are necessary for increasing her production with less cost.

loans.name: Nujubad

texts.en: Nujubad was born in 1962. She is a kind and hardworking woman. Nujubad is widowed. She is a careful mother of 2 children. Her children are adults. Nujubad’s husband died 10 years ago because he was ill. She has grown her children alone. She has been busy with processing apricots for more than 15 years. Nujubad has an apricot garden. She collects apricots, processes them and sells in a local market. Her son helps her with managing the business. She needs financial support for developing her business. Nujubad is asking for a loan of 6,500 TJS to buy apricots and process them. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy apricots and to process them.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more kinds of disks for her store

loans.name: Phanice

texts.en:
Phanice is a 41-year-old woman, married to Francis, who adds income to support their family. They have been blessed with two children. Phanice has been operating a grocery shop for a period of fifteen years, earning an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month.

Phanice is now servicing her third loan of KES 30,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this entire amount to buy cabbages, tomatoes, onions, kale and potatoes to increase her stock, which is running out.

Phanice plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children.  She hopes to become a successful businesswoman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy cabbages, tomatoes, onions, kale and potatoes

loans.name: Felbone

texts.en: Felbone has been cultivating his farm for many years. He grows rice and sells it in town to make a living. His income goes to daily expenditures and it is not enough to finance farm fertilization and other expenses. Because of that, he took a new loan from GDMPC to purchase seeds and fertilizer. He joined GDMPC recently and he gains access to micro-finance services. He hopes that with this capital, he will be able to gain more returns for the family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sarma

texts.en:
Sarma is 56 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Sarma has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates an open air food business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Tukoragane Nyabakande Group

texts.en:
Protazia lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is a 42-year-old married father of five children ranging in age from eight to 20 years, three of whom attend school. 

Protazia owns a general merchandise shop selling sugar, salt and soap among other items, and makes extra income through farming. He entered business to increase his household income. 

Protazia is a member of Tukoragane Nyabakande, whose members guarantee each other's loans. He will use use his loan portion to buy sugar, salt and soap for resale. Protazia's main hope for the future is to build a commercial house.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and soap to resell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Myrna works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Myrna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Meena

texts.en: Meena is a 51-year-old lady. She is married and has 5 children. She began the business of buying bangles at wholesale rates and then selling them in her local area many years ago. Her business is well established now and she is able to provide for her family’s daily expenditures. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She has now requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR. With this loan, she wants to purchase a greater variety of bangles in various colors and styles from the wholesale market. She wants to improve her family’s living standards with her income.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of bangles in various colors and styles.

loans.name: Munaza

texts.en: Munaza is a 24-year-old single woman. She has been running a business of a beauty parlor for 1 year. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Slowly, her customer base is expanding and her income is rising. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of products for the parlor. For this reason, she has requested a loan amount of 30,000 PKR to buy makeup items, hair care products, hair styling products, skin products etc. in large quantities. With the help of the loan, she will be able to expand her parlor business and will meet her household expenditures with the income generated.

loans.use: to buy makeup items, hair care products, hair styling products, skin products etc. in large quantities.

loans.name: Ayuba Sale

texts.en: Ayuba Sale is a 35-year-old farmer from G/Dauda. As a Babban Gona member, Ayuba Sale, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Ayuba Sale can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Ayuba Sale is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Ayuba Sale said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; charity, justice,  and  jonah,, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is married and has been blessed with children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past the 6 months, he has operated a vegetable kiosk business, selling green vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes. He sells primarily to local neighbors. Samuel dreams of expanding and establishing a shop in the future.

With the KES 45,000, he wants to purchase sacks of cabbages, onions, potatoes and tomatoes. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cabbages, onions, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Abla

texts.en:
Abla is a 30-year-old married mother of two who has been selling home products since 2005. Abla supports her husband in making their living and providing their small family with a happy life. Her husband is a Poclain excavator driver with a low income. 

She is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special, newly released home products that will increase her selling and develop her family's living.

This is Abla's eighth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. Through her previous loans, she developed her business and living in a well-managed way.

Abla hopes to keep on developing her business and to keep on making her children's small dreams come true.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special, newly released home products

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio es una persona honesta, responsable y trabajadora, también muy alegre y emprendedora que le gusta los desafíos para superarse cada día mas.
Su aspiración es ser un ganadero reconocido  y muy importante, es por ello que como primer paso para lograr su meta estudia la carrera de administración agropecuaria que le abrirá el camino.
Pide este préstamo, ya que de esa manera podrá seguir con sus estudios, y de esa forma luchará por sus metas.
texts.en:
Emilio is an honest, responsible, and hardworking individual. He is also enterprising and cheerful. Emilio enjoys challenges so that he can get better each day.

His aspiration is to become a well-known and important rancher. The first step toward achieving his goal is to study for a degree in Agricultural Management, which will open doors.

Emilio is requesting this loan so that he can continue his studies as he strives to reach his goals.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 31 years old and a single mother of two children aged 14 and 12. She has been selling shoes and assorted cosmetics for the last four years and earns a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 
She has applied for her first loan of 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this loan to buy more shoes and cosmetics and also to buy materials for building a bigger structure for her business.                                                                                           

The profit she earns will be used to provide for the family's basic needs and pay school fees for her children. She hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to build a bigger premises for the business and add more shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Zeynep

texts.en:
Zeynep has been married for 10 years and has two daughters. She runs a variety store, selling a wide range of products, from clothing to dowry items. In addition, Zeynep buys handmade items made by housewives in her circle and sells them in the store. In this way, she is helping other women earn income. As she likes to say, “My father was a seller in the market and so I was born a salesperson.” Zeynep embarked on her variety-store business with a sudden decision. When a relative of hers said he was going to sublet his shop, Zeynep stepped in and sublet the store. She expanded the range of merchandise, gathering handmade items from the women in her circle and selling them in the store. It’s now a place that attracts many customers looking for pieces for their dowry. The business has helped her develop herself and expand her circle, and she learns something from each and every person.  With the loan from Maya, Zeynep is going to buy merchandise. She’ll be able to expand her offerings in time for the Eid holiday season. With the profit she makes, she wants to buy herself a car.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Zeynep hanım on yıllık  evli iki kız annesi.Tuhafiye dükkanı işletiyor.Dükkanın da giyimden çeyizlik malzemelere kadar bir çok ürün yelpazesi var.Zeynep hanım aynı zaman da çevresinde bulunan ev kadınlarının elde yaptıkları el işlerini de alıp satıyor.Bu kadınlarasa kazanç elde etmelerine yardımcı oluyor.Kendi deyimi ile babası pazarcı olduğundan doğuştan beri esnafım diyor.Tuhafiye işletme işine de bir an da karar veriyor.Bir akrabası şuan işlettiği dükkanı devredeceğini söylediğinde Zeynep hanım talip oluyor ve dükkanı devir alıyor.ürün çeşidini arttırıyor.Çevresinde ki kadınlardan el işlerini toplayıp dükkan da satmaya başlıyor.Bugün çeyiz üzerine aranılan bir çok müşterisi olan bir yer haline getiriyor.Bu işin kendisini geliştirdiğini,çevresini genişlettiğini ve her bir insandan çok şey öğrendiğini belirtiyor.Aldığı kredi ile dükkanına mal alacak.Bayramdan önce çeşidini arttıracak.Kazancı ile kendine araba almak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Bophal's Group

texts.en: A farmer residing in the Bovel district of Battambang province, Bophal is 29 years old and married. She is blessed with two kids; one is in school and one is too young for schooling. She fulfills the basic needs of her family via rice and maize farming and her paid job. In addition to her business loan, she also requests this loan for personal consumption by forming the same group. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy school materials for her son and to buy household appliances for her family. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy school materials for her son and household appliances for her family

loans.name: Bitrus Lado

texts.en: Bitrus Lado is a 46-year-old farmer from G/Dauda. As a Babban Gona member, Bitrus Lado, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Bitrus Lado can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Bitrus Lado is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Bitrus Lado said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Mathew, Saminu,  and  Tina, and in 5 years, I want to ensure they are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed, in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo de 59 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar,  vivía lejos de donde estaba la escuela. Su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, en su casa solo trabaja un hijo y los otros 4 ya están con sus familias aparte.  

El negocio que tiene Reynaldo es la agricultura, es algo que ha trabajado por mucho tiempo, fue su padre quien lo dedico a trabajar, y es su única fuente de ingresos ya que en la zona no existe otra vía por la que se puede ganar dinero y la ciudad está a unos quince kilómetros y un camino en difíciles condiciones. 

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas y pesticidas para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de ajonjolí. El terreno no es propio, pero tampoco paga alquiler se lo da para trabajar una institución del estado que se denomina Instituto Salvadoreño de transferencias de tierra.

El sueño de Reynaldo es trabajar que Dios lo bendiga,  que lo mantenga siempre con salud y seguir trabajando junto a su hijo y tal vez hacerse de una vaca de la ganancia de los cultivos para su mejor alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is 59 years old and never had the opportunity to study. He lived too far from where the school was located. His wife dedicates herself to domestic tasks. At his house, only one son works while the remaining four live apart with their own families.

Agriculture is Reynaldo's business. This is something that he has worked at for a long time. His father taught him to do farm work, and it is his only source of income. In the zone there is no other way he can earn money, and the city is some 15 kilometers away on a road in difficult condition.

The loan he is requesting through CREDICAMPO is to purchase manure, fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides to cultivate 14,000 square meters of sesame. The terrain belongs to him and he does not have to pay rent. A state institution, the Instituto Salvadoreno de Tansferencias de Tierra, gave it to him to work.

Reynaldo's dream is to work so long as God blesses him with good health, and to continue working with his son and, perhaps, to obtain a cow with some of his earnings to feed his family better.

loans.use: buy manure, fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides to cultivate 14,000 square meters of sesame.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and feed 400 egg-laying hens

loans.name: Isabel Lizbeth

texts.es:
Isabel es una joven emprendedora, tiene 21 años de edad y vive en Santiago junto a su cónyuge.
Tiene una pequeña hija quien es su mayor motivación en la vida y por quien lucha día a día para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
Desde hace casi un año se dedica a la venta de huevos y pollo en un pequeño ambiente que acondicionó para que fuera su puesto. Le va muy bien porque es una persona trabajadora, luchadora, responsable y porque siempre se preocupa por brindar alimentos de calidad y es muy amable con los clientes.
Isabel está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá acondicionar su local y mejorarlo para brindar una mejor atención, comprará mesas para poder trabajar mejor, cuchillos, y todos los materiales e insumos para poder prosperar en su negocio. De esta manera obtendrá mayores ingresos con los que podrá apoyar a su familia y seguir trabajando para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija.
texts.en:
Isabel, 21, is a young entrepreneur who lives in Santiago with her husband.  She has a young daughter who is her biggest motivation in life and for whom she strives every day to improve their quality of life.

She has sold eggs and chickens for a year in a small space she fixed up as her own stall.  It's going very well for her because she's a hardworking, persevering, and responsible person who is very friendly with the customers, and because she's always concerned about offering quality food.

Isabel's grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their support she'll be able to fix up and improve her space to offer better service; buy tables to be able to work better; and buy knives and all the supplies and ingredients for her business to prosper.  That way she'll earn more income with which to support her family and keep on working to improve her daughter's quality of life.

loans.use: to improve her space

loans.name: Eloysa Juana

texts.es:
Eloysa es una mujer de 41 años de edad soltera, madre de seis hijos y se dedica a la venta de comida.
Ella es una persona alegre muy social, siempre trata de complacer a sus clientes que la visitan constantemente para saborear sus deliciosos platos de comida, su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad de ‘Janco Amaya’ distante a tres horas de viaje en auto de la ciudad capital.
Eloysa es de tez morena, cabello negro trenzado, estatura mediana y su forma de vestir es tradicional (manta y pollera), su negocio comienza muy temprano por la mañana con la preparación de comida para media mañana, más tarde al medio día se dedica a la venta de almuerzo para descansar un par de horas por la tarde y dedicarse a preparar la cena, esa es su rutina de lunes a domingo. Ella tiene la necesidad de realizar compras por mayor de; papa arroz, fideo, harina, chuño, yuca, etc., para obtener mejores beneficios económicos y poder pagar los gastos de sus seis hijos, su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Es por esos motivos que Eloysa solicita un préstamo para la compra de comestibles por mayor para su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Eloysa is a forty-one year old single woman, mother of six children and makes a living selling food.  She is a happy person and very social.  She always tries to please her clients, who visit her constantly to savor her delicious food.  She conducts her business in the Janco Amaya community, a three-hour car ride away from the capital city.  

Eloysa has dark skin, black braided hair, is of medium height, and uses traditional dress (poncho and skirt).  Her work begins very early in the morning with the preparation of food so that it is ready by mid-morning.  Later, at noon, she works selling lunch, then rests a couple of hours in the afternoon, and prepares dinner.  That is her routine Monday to Sunday.

She needs to purchase wholesale the following: potatoes, rice, noodles, flour, potato starch, yuca, etc., in order to obtain better economic benefit and to pay the expenses of her six children.  Her dream is to improve the quality of life of her family.  For these reasons, Eloysa requests a loan to buy groceries wholesale for her business and to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries wholesale for her business and to improve the quality of life for her family

loans.name: Rubango Tweyimukye Group

texts.en: Laurence is married with 6 children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He runs a motorcycle garage, selling spare parts. He is also in agriculture, growing maize, beans, and soya beans, a business where he obtains additional income. He faces the challenge of transportation to sell his produce in the market. His vision is to meet his family's needs. He is therefore requesting a loan to buy motorcycle spare parts for sale.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts for sale

loans.name: Ana Irma

texts.es:
Ana de 51 años de edad, solo estudio 1° año de educación Básica, el motivo fue que tenía que ayudar a su mamá a chinear a sus otros hermanitos que estaban pequeños, ya que ella era la primera de su familia, hoy en día está acompañada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, de sus hijos solo una está en la escuela los demás ya están acompañados.

Ana posee un negocio de venta de verduras, las verduras ella las produce y las comercializa lo que es elotes, chiles, tomates, y pepinos. Lo aprendió de unas capacitaciones que ha recibido de parte de una institución del gobierno, antes lo que hacía era ayudar a su esposo a la producción de granos básicos. Los cultivos 
son en la misma comunidad, por lo que llegan en unos diez minutos hasta el terreno. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar un sistema de riego para cultivar en el verano cuando no hay lluvias, ella almacena agua en unas captaciones que le servirá unos varios meses y con ello estará satisfaciendo la necesidad de cultivar en verano; pero lo podrá lograr si hay financiamiento de lo contrario no puede. 

El sueño de Ana es tener un sistema que le permita sembrar hortalizas en verano, y que sus hijos también pongan su empeño por las verduras de calidad sin químicos, sueña siempre comer algo que no tiene químicos, pero lo va a lograr si es apoyado porque lo que ahorita su deficiencia es el dinero.
texts.en: Ana is 51 years old and only attended one year of elementary school, the reason being that she was the eldest child and had to help her mother raise her young siblings. Today she's in a relationship and her husband works in agriculture. Only one of her kids is still attending school and the rest already have spouses. Ana owns a vegetable business, and the vegetables she grows and sells are corn, peppers, tomatoes, and cucumbers. She learned it through training that she received from a government institution. Previously she was helping her husband produce staple foods. The farming is done in the same community, so they only take ten minutes to get to the land. The loan she's requesting is to buy an irrigation system when it's not raining, and she stores enough water in catchments to last several months and thus satisfy the need to farm in the summer. She can do this with financing, otherwise it wouldn't be possible. Ana's dream is to have a system that would allow her to plant vegetables in the summer, and that her kids also put their effort into growing quality, chemical-free vegetables. She dreams of always having chemical-free vegetables to eat but she'll only manage it with support because right now she lacks the money.

loans.use: To buy an irrigation system to grow in the summer when it doesn't rain, she stores water for several months in some catchment systems.

loans.name: Isiyaku Maidawa

texts.en: Isiyaku Maidawa is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Isiyaku Maidawa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for hischildren: Iliya, Isuhu,  and  Isiya,. Isiyaku Maidawa is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Isiyaku Maidawa will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would  be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Isiyaku Maidawa can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Isiyaku Maidawa said “I plan to use the money I make this year to build a better home." Isiyaku Maidawa is not thinking about just this year; he said, in 5 years, he  wants to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Kafunda Small Christian Community Group

texts.en: Julius is a 36-year-old married man with four children. He has been buying and selling coffee for many years. He started with capital savings from his group and has now accumulated working capital. Julius obtains additional capital from farming. His challenges include price fluctuation and pests and his vision is to set up a coffee store that supplies the large-scale coffee traders in Kyenjojo District in the western region of Uganda. He is a member of Kafunda Small Christian Community group where each member guarantees the others. Julius needs the loan to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Enma Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Enma es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es el destace y venta de carne de cerdo desde hace 5 años.
Doña Enma su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de cerdos para aumentar la producción de su negocio y de esta manera seguir realizando su trabajo el cual le ayuda mucho porque las ganancias son de mucha utilidad en el hogar.
Doña Enma con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten de forma y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes,  gracias a esto espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. 
Doña Enma espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia en cualquier problema económico que se presente.


Choluteca, Honduras – julio del  2014
texts.en:
Enma is a very hard-working and responsible person who lives in a community in southern Honduras with her family. Her business has been the butchering and sale of pork for 5 years. Enma has her business in her home in the municipality where she lives. She needs the loan to purchase pigs to increase her business' production and that way continue the job that has been very helpful because the profits are very useful for her household. With the loan, Enma hopes that sales increase enough to satisfy customer demand and she hopes that would improve her family's quality of life with higher household income. In the short term Enma hopes to grow her business and that way keep helping her family with any type of financial problem that arises.

Choluteca, Honduras-July 2014

loans.use: To purchase pigs for her business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her variety store, thus generating more income that she used in her everyday expenses. She has had this business for three years now and it continues to grow. She works hard to provide for her everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Yolanda dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to live longer. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and businesses every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Sani

texts.en: Sani is a 50 year old farmer from Ba'awa. As a Babban Gona member, Sani is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Sani can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Sani is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Sani said “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family, in 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Sani is on his way to achieving this dream

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Maria Carlita

texts.es: Maria es una señora casada, tiene 4 hijos  de 14, 21,24 y 27 años de edad de los cuales 3 están estudiando, ella juntamente con su esposo se dedican 20 años a la crianza de animales menores, comenta Maria que  tuvo que irse con su familia a  vivir a un lugar de  de un clima abrigado ya que su esposo tiene  una enfermedad que le hace mal el frio, Maria dice que esto no le impide seguir trabajando, el crédito necesita para comprar chanchos y de este negocio aspira mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos de educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with four children, ages 14, 21, 24 and 27, three of whom are in school.  She, together with her husband, has made a living the past twenty years raising small livestock.  

Maria comments that she and her family had to go live in a place with a warm climate since her husband has an illness whereby the cold makes him sick.  Maria says that this does not stop him from working.  

She needs the loan to buy pigs and from this business she aspires to improve her income to cover the expenses of education of her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Violetas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VIOLETAS” iniciará el vigésimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Martha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, comerciante de plásticos, taller de costura, costura de deportivos, artesanías.
