El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Martha es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su vecina que era cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía en matas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años mejorando la técnica del tejido implementando el bordado. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen podemos observar a una persona mas que acompaña al grupo ella es hermana de una de las clientes y esta vestida con una chompa roja.
texts.en:
The community organization "Violetas" will begin its 29th cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana Regional Center, and it consists of eight members and is led by a board of directors in which Martha is the president. The businesses that the members of the community organization work in are varied and include: knitting blankets, selling plastic, a sewing shop, sewing tennis shoes, and crafts.

The loan she's taking is to increase working capital (purchase of wool wholesale) she'll acquire from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and she'll subsequently sell what she produces. This line of work allows her to generate income to support her family since she's married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the health services offered by the institution.

In the picture an additional person can be seen with the group. She's the sister of one of the customers and is wearing a red sweatshirt.

loans.use: To buy wool wholesale.

loans.name: René

texts.es:
René de 44 años de edad, es una persona que estudio 2° año de educación básica,  es el primero de siete hermanos, su familia se creció muy rápido y el tubo que dejar la escuela para trabajar.

Esta  acompañado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen una hija la cual todavía no va a la escuela,  por lo que su familia se conforma por tres y uno más que está por nacer.

René trabaja en la agricultura desde que tenía unos diez años de edad, su padre fue 
quien le enseño a trabajar, en aquel tiempo era la única manera de que en el futuro podía comer, es por eso que ahora tiene que trabajar solo en la tierra, no tiene otra fuente de ingreso, el lugar donde trabaja es en la misma comunidad a unos 20 minutos de su casa,  trabaja cinco horas diarias.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar seis sacos de abono para la segunda fertilización de 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, el abono lo compra en la ciudad a unos 12 kilómetros de la comunidad y lo compara el día domingo que es el único día que existe transporte una vez a la semana, de esa manera se sentirá satisfecho. 

El sueño de René, es que sus hijos estudien quiere darles una oportunidad, la que él no tubo y espera que desde ahora irse preparando es una misión ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en: Rene is 44 years old, and went to school as far as the second grade. He is the first of seven siblings, and because his family grew very quickly he had to leave school in order to work.  He lives with his spouse, who is a stay-at-home parent.  They have a daughter who is not yet in school, so they are a family of three with another one on the way.  Rene has worked in agriculture since he was ten years old, having learned this work from his father.  At that time, it was the only means available to him to be able to feed himself in the future.  He now has to work alone in the field, and has no other source of income.  The place where he works is in the same community, 20 minutes from his house.  He works for five hours every day. The loan that he is requesting through CREDICAMPO is to  buy six bags of manure for the second fertilization of 14,000 square meters of corn.  He will buy the manure in the city, which is 12 kilometers from his community, on a Sunday, because this is the only day of the week that there is transportation available.  He will then feel satisfied.  Rene's dream is that his children will be able to go to school.  He wants to give them the opportunity that he did not have.  His mission from this day forward is to see his children become professionals.

loans.use: to  buy six bags of manure for the second fertilization of 14,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Mai-Unguwa

texts.en: Mai-Unguwa is a 48-year-old farmer.  As a Babban Gona member, Mai-Unguwa, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Mai-Unguwa can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Mai-Unguwa is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Mai-Unguwa said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Haladu, Sagiru, and Awalu, and in 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es: Estela reside  en una ciudad donde la mayoría de mujeres se dedica a la crianza de animales, Estela se dedica a la crianza de chanchos desde que era una adolecente, y dice que es de este negocio que puede ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y del estudio de sus 4 hijas, Estela agradece a Fodemi por el apoyo que le viene dando por medio de los créditos, en esta ocasión con el dinero del crédito va a comprar chanchos con la esperanza de seguir adelante y tener el dinero necesario para que sus hijas sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Estela lives in a city where the majority of women make a living raising animals.  Estela has made a living rising pigs since she was an adolescent and says that it is from this business that she is able to help her husband with household expenses and school expenses for her four daughters. 

Estela is grateful to Fodemi for the support that they give her in the form of loans.  On this occasion with the money from the loan she is going to buy pigs in the hope of moving forward and having the money necessary to that her daughters may continue studying.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Safiratu

texts.en: Safiratu is a 35 year old farmer from Yan Gwari. As a Babban Gona member, Safiratu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Safiratu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Safiratu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Safiratu said “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family, in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” With this loan, Safiratu is on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Carlin

texts.es:
Carlin es un joven emprendedor, tiene 20 años de edad y vive en Chincha junto a su cónyuge.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Desde hace varios años trabaja como Operario de Construcción y le va muy bien ya que es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, honesta y siempre se esfuerza por hacer un excelente trabajo.
Carlin está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar un ropero y un juego de comedor para poder poco a poco mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y puedan sentirse a gusto viviendo en su hogar. Con esto él seguirá esforzándose para sacar adelante a su familia y brindarles un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Carlin is an enterprising young man.  He is 20 years old, and lives in Chincha with his partner.  He is a person with a great desire to get ahead.  He has worked for several years as a construction worker, and this is going very well for him because he a very responsible, hardworking and honest person, and always makes an effort to do excellent work.  Carlin is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because with the support that they have provided he will be able to buy a wardrobe and a set of dining room furniture.  In this way he can improve his family's quality of life, little by little, and they can feel comfortable living in their home.  He will continue making efforts to provide for his family, and to offer them a better future.

loans.use: to buy a wardrobe and a set of dining room furniture.

loans.name: Erika Magali

texts.es: Magali es una joven de 23 años de edad ella vive con sus padres que se dedican a la a agricultura, en la actualidad se encuentra estudiando gastronomía que dice que es la carrera que a ella le gusta mucho, Magali tiene chanchos para ayudarse en los gastos diarios sobre todo de estudio, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos y aspira que su negocio sea más productivo ya que esta a puertas de hacer la tesis de y es cuando más necesita dinero.
texts.en:
Magali, age 23, lives with her parents, and they work in agriculture.  She is currently studying gastronomy, which is a career that she likes a lot.  

Magali has pigs to help with the daily expenses, especially her education.

She will use the loan to buy pigs.  She wishes for her business to be more productive.  She is on the threshold of doing her thesis, and that is when she needs money the most.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Mauricio Antonio

texts.es:
Mauricio se dedica a la agricultura, trabajo que aprendió de su padre desde que era un pequeño y gracias a ello ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante, él cultiva 14,000 metros cuadrados  de maíz, y también siembra frijoles, el lugar del cultivo está a una distancia de 20 minutos de su vivienda.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para realizar la limpieza del terreno y lo restante será para comprar venenos,  abono y pago a los mozos que le ayudaran a sembrar la postrera,  él también siembra frijol. 

Su sueño principal es salir adelante con los compromisos que tiene, ya que con ello tendrá la oportunidad de trabajar para sacar adelante a su familia, darle una vida digna y mejorar sus ingresos y brindarle la educación necesaria a sus hijos para que salgan adelante.
texts.en: Mauricio works in agriculture, which is the work that he learned from his father when he was a young child.  Thanks to this work he has been able to support his family.  He grows 14,000 square meters of corn, and also plants beans.  The place where he grows his crops is about 20 minutes away from his house.  The loan that he is requesting is to clear land, and with the rest to buy pesticides and manure, and to pay workers to plant the final crop, which will be beans.  His main dream is to fulfill his commitments, so that he will have the opportunity to work to support his family, provide them with a good life, and offer to his children the education that they need in order to get ahead.

loans.use: to clear land, and with the rest to buy pesticides and manure, and to pay workers to plant the final crop, which will be beans.

loans.name: Iris Lisseth

texts.es:
Iris de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casada su esposo trabaja como jardinero para una empresa privada, son padres de un niño de dos años de edad, viven en su casa propia y solo su hijo de penden directamente de ellos.
 
Ella tiene un año de trabajar para le empresas atunera en el área de limpieza del atún, anteriormente trabajo para una panadería. Su horario de trabajo es por la noche trabaja de 6:00 pm hasta 2:00 AM su esposo le ayuda con los ingresos del hogar y él cuida el niño por la noche.


EL dinero será utilizado para comprar madera para realizar las divisiones, ya que harán 2 habitaciones, uno para ellos y el otro para su hijo esto les permitirá tener más ordenada su vivienda.


Su principal sueño es siempre que los dos puedan mantener sus trabajos para garantizar, de esta manera el sustento de su familia y garantizar la educación de sus hijos, todo esto saben que lo pueden lograr dando cada día lo mejor de ellos en su respectivos trabajos.
texts.en:
Iris, age 25, went to school through the fourth grade.  She is married, and her husband works as a gardener for a private company.  They have a two year old son.  They live in their own house, and only their son is directly dependent upon them.

She has been working for one year at a tuna company cleaning tuna.  She previously worked at a bakery.  Her work schedule is in the evening.  She works from 6:00 p.m. until 2:00 a.m.  Her husband helps her with the household income.  He takes care of their son at night.

The loan will be used to buy wood to make divisions.  They will make two rooms, one for them and the other for their son.  This will allow them to have a more orderly house.

Her main dream is for the two of them to always be able to keep their jobs in order to, in this way, support their family and guarantee their children’s education.  They know that they are able to achieve all of this giving the best of themselves every day in their respective jobs.

loans.use: to buy wood to divide the house into two rooms.

loans.name: Flor Estefany

texts.es:
Flor es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos maravillosos quienes son su mayor motivación para salir adelante y por quienes al encontrarse sola tuvo que luchar para poder sacarlos adelante.
Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación inauguró una pequeña tienda en su casa y le va muy bien porque es muy trabajadora, responsable, honesta y siempre atiende con mucho respeto a los clientes.
Flor está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para surtir el negocio y ofrecer variedad de productos. Gracias a esto sus ventas se incrementarán y seguirá esforzándose para poder más adelante: "Ampliar su negocio"
texts.en:
Flor is an enterprising woman. She is 28 years old, is single, and lives in Ica with her family. She is a single mother of two wonderful children who are her main motivation to succeed and, upon finding herself alone, she had to fight to be able to support them. 

With a lot of effort and dedication, she started a small store in her house. The business is going very well since she is responsible, honest and a hard worker, and she always serves her clients with respect.

Flor is grateful to the Kiva loaners because with the help they have given her, she will be able to buy merchandise to supply her business and offer a variety of products. Thanks to this, her sales will increase and she will continue her efforts to be able to later, "expand her business."

loans.use: to buy merchandise to supply her store

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia es una señora trabajadora que vive con su esposo que trabaja de chofer y sus 4 hijas de 17, 13, 7 y 5 años que se encuentran estudiando, Cecilia se dedica al comercio de edredones y cobijas de puerta en puerta y sobre todo a sus amigas y familiares, el crédito lo va a utilizar comprando mercadería en cobijas y edredones, del negocio que espera mejorar sus ingresos y que no le haga falta el  dinero para los gastos de educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a hardworking woman who lives with her husband, who works as a driver, and her four daughters ages 17, 13, 7 and 5, who are in school.  Cecilia makes a living selling comforters and blankets door to door, especially selling to friends and family. 

She will use the loan to buy merchandise, blankets and comforters.  From this business she hopes to improve her income so that she will not lack money for education expenses for her daughters.

loans.use: to buy blankets

loans.name: Norsiana

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Norsiana works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of crabs business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming rice and selling fish. Norsiana is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional crabs to sell. 

Norsiana has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional crabs to sell

loans.name: Nersita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Nersita works hard to support her family.

She has a business weaving bamboo in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and from farming vegetables. Nersita is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more bamboo to weave for her business.

Nersita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to weave.

loans.name: Okeyeso Nyame Group

texts.en:
This group of six members belongs to the group called Okeyeso Nyame. The group members live in the same neighborhood. Their main business activity is retail (ready-made dresses, electrical part, lubricants, dry fish, frozen food and rubber products.

Gloria, the one standing on the far right in the photo, is 39 years old. She is married and has two children.

She works by operating a cold store. She buys fish, meats and chicken to resell in her neighborhood. She has been in this business for some time and is very experienced. With her loan, she will buy more fish, meat and chicken to sell to her customers.

Thanks to her revenues, she helps ensure her family’s well-being by helping her husband with everyday expenses as well as their children’s school fees and healthcare expenses. She is also growing her savings with ID-Ghana.

The group members will hold each other accountable for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To  buy more fish, meat and chicken to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more meat to restock her butcher shop and to help her husband buy wood for his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Xiomara Yenisel

texts.es:
Xiomara de 41 años de edad, es una señora dedicada a los oficios domésticos, estudio hasta 3° año de educación básica.

Esta acompañada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, sus tres hijos están estudiando.  

El negocio de Xiomara es trabajar en la agricultura junto a su esposo, son los dos quienes trabajan,  porque necesitan ingresos para que estudien sus hijos esfuerzo que nunca pensó hacerlo, pero por el bien de su esposo no se le dificulta, el trabajadero esta a unos 15 minutos de la casa, relativamente cerca por lo que trabaja seis horas diarias bajo sol.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar seis sacos de abono para fertilizar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y preparar el terreno para sembrar frijol.  Así asegura los granos básicos,  tendrá más oportunidad de que en el futuro pueda tener recursos para sus hijos que seguirán estudiando.

El gran sueño de Xiomara, es que sus tres hijos tengan la oportunidad de seguir estudiando; porque su objetivo es ver a sus hijos unos profesionales, pero esto lo lograra si el crédito es aprobado de lo contrario no se puede.
texts.en:
Xiomara, 41, is dedicated to domestic chores. She studied until the 3rd grade. 

Her husband works in agriculture. Her three children are in school. 

Xiomara's works in farming with her husband. They are the two that work. They need the income so that their children can study. This is an effort she never thought she would do however thanks to her husband it is easy. 

The work place is about 15 minutes from the house, relatively close. They work six hours a day under the sun. 

She is requesting a loan from Credicampo to buy 6 sacks of fertilizer, 14,000 cubic meters of corn and to prepare the ground to plant beans. 

Planting basic grains ensures that in the future they will have resources so that their children can keep studying. 

Her big dream is that her three children have the opportunity to keep studying. Her goal is to see her children become professionals. This will be achieved if the loan is approved, otherwise it will not be possible.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacks of fertilizer, 14,000 cubic meters of corn and to prepare the ground to plant beans.

loans.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en:
Mabel, a businesswoman and a mother of two school-age kids, is in her 30s. She is married and supporting her family with the operation of drinking spot business, where she has been selling soft drinks. She has been managing her enterprise since 2009 and is able to make a good profit each month. Mabel starts business at 6 am and goes until after midnight.

She will share this loan with her loan group member called Gifty. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

She is requesting her eighth loan from Kiva partner's ID-Ghana, which she will use to buy more soft drinks for her bar. Mabel dreams that one day she will be able to make her business well known.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks for her bar.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He is married to Jennifer and together they have been blessed with two children. He operates a retail store where he sells clothes and shoes, a business he has done for the last eight years, earning a monthly income of 18,000 KES.

Joseph has asked for his first loan of 20,000 KES which he will use to purchase stock of rubber shoes, shoe polish and rubber soles. Joseph will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to have a sustainable family as well as adequate finances.

loans.use: to purchase stock of rubber shoes, shoe polish and rubber soles

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Rosalinda is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries for resale at her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries for resale.

loans.name: Rubi Esmeralda

texts.es: Esmeralda es una señora trabajadora que se dedica 7 años al negocio de ganado, ella es madre soltera y vive con sus 3 hijos de 13, 8 y 5 años de edad que están asistiendo a la escuela, esmeralda cuenta que compra terneros en el campo y luego los vende en las ferias de la ciudad de donde ella reside,   el crédito lo va a utilizar comprando terneros para mejorar su negocio y seguir luchando y trabajando duro para que sus hijos tengan un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is a hard working woman who has dedicated 7 years to the livestock business. 

She is a single mother and lives with her three children aged 13, 8 and 5. They all attend school. 

Esmeralda explains that she buys calves in the country side and then sells them in the city fairs where she lives. 

She will use the loan to buy calves to improve her business and to keep fighting and working hard so that her children can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough goods such as rice, vita and oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plantain, fish, and flour to sell.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
Eleuterio de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está acompañada y su esposa se dedica al trabajo domésticos tienen 5 hijos; solo tres viven con ellos los otros dos trabajan para una empresa de bebidas gaseosas. Directamente de él solo dependen su esposa y sus tres hijos, el lugar donde viven es propio.
 
Eleuterio es agricultor trabajo que aprendió de su padre.  Él cultiva 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 7,000 de frijol de estas cosechas dependen los ingresos de la familia, también Eleuterio se dedica a la pesca pero solo para el consumo.  Donde él vive hay una laguna cerca que le permite llevar el sustento a su familia, el lugar donde cultiva se encuentra a una distancia de 25 minutos caminando, sus dos hijos que trabajan también le ayudan con algunos ingresos económicos para la familia.        

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para cancelar el arrendamiento del terreno donde cultivara, para cancelar a las personas que le ayudaran a limpiar la tierra donde sembrara, también comprara los herbicidas y fertilizantes necesarios para lograr tener una buena cosecha.

Su sueño principal es que Dios le permita obtener una buena cosecha, tanto de maíz como de frijol para hacer frente a los compromisos adquiridos y así asegurar tanto la seguridad alimentaria de la familia como los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante, algo muy importante que junto a su esposa planean es brindarle la educación necesaria a sus hijos para que tengan una mejor calidad de vida, ellos son muy consiente que esto lo pueden lograr con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo de parte de toda la familia.
texts.en: Eleuterio is 46 years old, and went to school until the second grade.  He lives with his spouse, who is a stay-at-home parent.  They have five children; only three live with them, and the others work for a soft drink company.  Only his spouse and his three children are dependent on him, and they own their own house.  Eleuterio works in agriculture, which he learned from his father.  He grows 14,000 square meters of corn, and 7,000 of beans.  His family's income depends on his harvest.  Eleuterio also fishes, but only for personal consumption.  There is a lagoon near the place where he lives, which allows him to provide food for his family.  The place where he grows his crops is a 25-minute walk away.  His two children who work also help provide some income for the family.  The loan that he is requesting through CREDICAMPO is to pay the rent on the land that he cultivates, to pay people to help him clear the land where he will plant, and also to buy herbicides and fertilizers that are necessary in order for him to have a good harvest.  His main dream is that God will allow him to have a good harvest of both corn and beans, so that he can fulfill his commitments, ensure his family's food security, and have the income necessary to get ahead.  It is very important to him and his spouse that they provide their children with the education that they need to have a better quality of life.  They are very aware that they can accomplish this a lot of work and effort from all of the family.

loans.use: to pay the rent on the land that he cultivates, to pay people to help him clear the land where he will plant, and also to buy herbicides and fertilizers that are necessary in order for him to have a good harvest.

loans.name: Ramadana Al- Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ramadana Al- Hodeidah. It consists of four ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Ramadana is a hardworking woman. She is a 43-year-old widow and a mother of six children. Her oldest child is 19 years old and the youngest one is nine years old. She is the leader of the group. 

Ramadana started her business of sewing and selling women clothes door-to-door many years ago. After her husband passed away several years ago, Ramadana assumed the sole responsibility of caring for her children. She started her business with a small amount of capital. Year by year, her business improves, but most of what she earns from profits go to the expenses of the family. 

She has good experience in the business. Thanks to experience, she deals with her own business with ease. Unfortunately, the income of this business is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family, and she wants to improve her business further. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more sewing materials, such as fabric, thread, buttons and zippers, in order to sew clothes and sell in her area. 
She looks forward to expanding her business by opening a large store for sewing clothes and selling them. She hopes to purchase more dressmaking machines to increase her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more tailoring material, such as thread, buttons, zippers and fabric, in order to sew clothes and sell in her area.

loans.name: Samara

texts.en:
Samara is a 24-year-old single lady, who graduated as a graphic designer. In October of 2013, she established her own shoe and bag shop as her own small business to cover her living expenses and as a step forward towards developing her future career.

Samara is a hard worker, who puts so much effort towards developing herself and her business. Since she is new in the business domain, she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with newly released summer shoes and bags at encouraging prices.

She hopes to develop this existing business properly so that one day she can establish her own printing company that fits with her field of study.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with newly released summer shoes and bags.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 49 years old. She is married, and together with her spouse, has been blessed with six children. Joyce operates a retail store, a business she has done for the last 20 years, earning a monthly income of 6,000 KES.

Joyce has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of 15,000 KES, which she will use to purchase flour and sugar. With the anticipated profits, Joyce will be able to open another business. Her hope and dream for the future is to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase flour and sugar

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin es un hombre de 37 años de edad casado, padre de cinco hijos y se dedica a la pesca con red.
Él es una persona dedicada a su trabajo y su familia, su carácter es gentil, la pesca la realiza en el lago Titicaca a casi cuatro mil metros sobre el nivel del mar, en bote y con red.
Edwin es de estatura mediana tez morena cabello negro corto, su casa está ubicada en la comunidad ‘Chilaya Chico’ a orillas del lago Titicaca, el clima del lugar es frío y los rayos solares son fuertes, es muy común que la gente del lugar utilice colores negros para vestirse porque este retiene el calor del sol.
Su familia está compuesta por su esposa y cinco hijos quienes se ocupan del comercio y la pesca, su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos para realizarlo necesita comprar un bote y nuevas redes de pesca.
Es por esos motivos que Edwin solicita un préstamo para la compra de un bote y redes de pesca para cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en: Edwin is 37 years old, is married, and is the father of five children.  He works at fishing with a net.  He is dedicated to his work and to his family, and has a kind personality.  He fishes in Lake Titicaca, at almost four thousand meters above sea level, in a boat using a net.  Edwin is of medium height, with a dark complexion and short black hair.  His house is located in the community of "Chilaya Chico", on the shore of Lake Titicaca.  The climate there is cold, and the sun's rays are strong, so it is very common for people to dress in black because it retains heat from the sun. His family is made up of his wife and his five children, who work in commerce and in fishing.  His dream is to improve the quality of life for his children, and in order to do this he needs to buy a boat and some new fishing nets.  For these reasons, Edwin is requesting a loan to buy a boat and some fishing nets, in order to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy a boat and some fishing nets, in order to achieve his dreams.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle used in her transport business.

Rosalina has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Rosalina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of seven children, Betty works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables and raising pigs. Betty is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items for resale, such as shampoo and groceries, at her general store.

Betty has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items for resale, such as shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Gold Group

texts.en:
This group of six members belongs to Gold Group. It consists of dynamic people who live in the same neighborhood and in surrounding areas. For the most part, their income-generating activities revolve around commercial endeavors (vegetables, soft drinks, grocery, cooking oil, phone card and food stuff). 

Felicia, age 58, is the member standing on the far right in the group photo. She is married with one child who is a dependent. 

She plans to use her loan to buy more vegetables for sale to customers. The profits earned will be used to bolster her savings and to help with day-to-day expenses.

This group will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for sale to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the lease of the land where they farm, and to pay for the people that help do the work to prepare the land, and to buy fertilizers, herbicides and seeds.

loans.name: Avilia

texts.es:
Avilia es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera, y vive en San Juan de Lurigancho junto a su familia.
Tiene dos hijos quienes son su mayor orgullo y por quienes lucha día a día para poder brindarles lo mejor.
Desde hace más de 1 año trabaja como Operaria en un Taller de estampados y le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajadora, emprendedora y sobre todo porque siempre se esfuerza por obtener resultados favorables en el trabajo.
Avilia está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá arreglar el piso de su vivienda ya que en estos momentos se encuentra en malas condiciones. Con este arreglo estaría mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia y seguirá esforzándose para más adelante cumplir su gran sueño: "Terminar de construir su vivienda".
texts.en: Avilia is a hard-working single woman who is 32 years old.  She lives in San Juan de Lurigancho with her family.  She has children who are her pride and joy, and for whom she struggles from day to day to provide the best.  She has worked for more than a year in a printing workshop, which is going very well because she is very responsible, hard-working and enterprising, and above all because she always make en effort to get positive results in her work.  Avilia is grateful to Kiva lenders, because with the support that they have provided she will be able to repair the floor of her house, which is presently in poor condition.  With this repair she will improve the living conditions for her family, and continue making efforts to some day achieve her great dream:  to finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to repair the floor of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coal for resale.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila is a 55-year-old farmer from R/Tabo. As a Babban Gona member, Samaila, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Samaila can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Samaila is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Samaila said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; auwalu, shaibu,  and  halima, and in 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods for resale, such as fish, pig feet, meat, cube salt and oil for cooking.

loans.name: Sony Group

texts.en:
Nelly is married, aged early fifties, and has two daughters who are in school. She is a businesswoman running a business selling cooking oil (sunflower oil), purchased in boxes from up country. Previously, she has only been able to manage 30 boxes due to low capital, but now she wants to increase to 70 with a loan from Kiva. Nelly desires to grow to more than 100 boxes (which totals 400 gallons of oil). Nelly also sells fabrics, a business she has been with for ten years now. 

This is her tenth loan request via Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, successfully repaid, to order more boxes (fifty boxes) which she sold. She earned extra income which she used to cover school fees and household expenses, and to build a brick fence surrounding her house. She dreams that one day her business will grow. Nelly will use this loan to buy 70 boxes of sunflower oil to resell. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, Sony,  which consists of two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy 70 boxes of sunflower oil to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tin sheeting and support beams.

loans.name: Amar

texts.en:
Amar is a 27-year-old single lady who established her own shop in 2010, selling mobile phones to improve her standard of living. In addition to mobile phones and their requested accessories, Amar also sells prepaid mobile phones cards, perfume, and gel.

Today, she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special release mobile phones accessories, prepaid cards and perfume, as well as many other attractive items before the end of Holy month of Ramadan celebrations.

Her father opened this business for Amar, and she is working hard to develop it. She hopes that one day she can expand her working sector and move to a larger shop, where she can diversify her products and increase her income.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Felicita

texts.es:
La señora María es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta refrescos y destazo de cerdos, desde hace 10 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive.
Doña María necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos para aumentar la producción su negocio y de esta manera seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le ayuda mucho está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de cerditos y refrescos para tener más producto que ofrecerles a los clientes que las visitan.
Doña María espera que sus ventas aumenten y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes,  gracias a esto espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar y que su hijo tenga los estudios necesarios, para que pueda tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Julio del  2014
texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking and responsible person. She lives in a community in Southern Honduras, together with her family. She has been selling beverages and cut up pork for ten years. Maria works from her home. She needs the loan to purchase more products in order to increase her business and keep working, which she really needs. She will invest the money in the purchase of piglets and beverages to offer to her customers.
Maria hopes her sales will increase and she meets the demands of her customers. Thanks to this, she will improve the quality of life for her family once she receives a higher income and will make sure her son can study and have better opportunities in life.


Choluteca, Honduras – July  2014

loans.use: to purchase beverages and pigs for her business.

loans.name: Cristian Orlando

texts.es: Cristian es un joven de 21 años de edad, el vive con sus abuelitos ya que su madre falleció y su padre por cuestiones de trabajo vive muy lejos, el se dedica a la crianza de terneros junto a las vacas que tiene su abuelita, a Cristian le gusta mucho el deporte, cuenta que a concursado en algunos carreras atléticas a nivel  nacional y que en la que participo hace un mes llego en tercer lugar  misma en la que  habían concursantes de  todo Ecuador, con el dinero del crédito va a comprar terneros para aumentar su negocio, Cristian espera seguir trabajando y entrenando para que mejore sus ingresos y llegar a ser bien reconocido mediante el deporte.
texts.en:
Cristian is a young man of 21. He lives with his grandparents since his mother passed away and his father, for work reasons, lives very far away. He makes a living raising calves along with the cattle that this grandmother has.

Cristian likes sports a lot. He comments that he has competed in some athletic competitions at the national level and that he came in third place in the one he participated in one month ago, where there were competitors from all of Ecuador.

With the money from the loan, he's going to buy calves to grow his business. Cristian hopes to continue working and training in order to improve his income and become well known through sports.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora. María es una socia amable y gentil que forma parte del grupo de crédito Pauteñitas, se encuentra en su tercer crédito, este grupo está formado por amigas que viven por los alrededores del cantón de Paute, este cantón se caracteriza por la belleza natural de sus paisajes, es de clima templado, en sus tierras se cultivan las más hermosas flores, su gente es de un corazón muy cálido y amable. Todos tienen una meta en común la cual es mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares. 
La Señora María tiene 52 años de edad, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, dos de ellos son casados y viven independientes, sus dos hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña María desde muy joven se dedica a la cría de cuyes, cerdos y gallinas así como también se dedica a la agricultura que es para el consumo de su casa y si existe un sobrante lo vende. Ela está repitiendo el crédito y lo va a  invertir en la compra de cuyes, cerdos y en alimento para animales. Su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a friendly and gentle member who forms part of the Pauteñitas village bank. She is in her third loan. This group is formed by friends who live in the surrounding areas of the Paute canton. This canton is characterized by the natural beauty of its landscapes. It is a temperate climate, in its lands the most beautiful flowers are grown, its people are of a very warm and friendly heart. All of them have a common goal, which is to improve the economic stability of their homes.

María is 52, widowed, and in her free union she has conceived 4 children, two of whom are married and live independently. Her two single children work and help her financially. The house that she lives in is hers.

Since a young age, María has worked in raising guinea pigs, pigs and hens. She also works in agriculture, which is for the consumption of her house and, if a surplus exists, she sells it. She is repeating the loan and she is going to invest it in the purchase of guinea pigs, pigs and animal feed. Her goal is to grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to remodel her house so that it will be more comfortable for her children.

loans.name: Bradley Dylan

texts.es: Un joven trabajador es Dylan, el se dedica al comercio de zapatos y vive con su hermano que también se dedica a la misma a actividad,  Dylan tiene 20 años de edad y son 7 años que se dedica a comercializar zapatos, comenta que le va bien en este negocio, saca su mercadería a las ciudades más cercanas los días de feria, Dylan va a invertir su crédito en la compra de mercadería en zapatos, del mismo que espera ahorran y en algún momento comprarse un carro para transportar su mercadería y cuenta que en este momento está acabando de pagar de la licencia de conducir que saco hace un mes.
texts.en:
Dylan is a young, 20-year-old worker who has been selling shoes for 7 years. He lives with his brother who also sells shoes. Dylan delivers his merchandise to nearby towns on market days, and he says he is doing well with his business. 

Dylan will use the loan to buy shoes. He is also hoping to save money and in time buy a car to transport his merchandise. At the moment he is finishing to pay his driver's license which he received one month ago.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a 67-year-old widow and supports eight children aged between 24 and 38 years. She sells paraffin, a business she has done for the last eight years, earning a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

Teresia has requested a loan of 5,000 KES, which she will use to buy paraffin to sell. Her hope and dream for the future of her business is to open a shop in order to diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy paraffin to sell

loans.name: Artesanas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ARTESANAS” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Bibiana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: elaboración de trajes para danzas típicas, venta de ropa, trenzado de mantas, venta de frutas, servicio de construcción, venta de batidos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Bibiana es integrante, ella indica que es el quinto año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura de polleras (faldas nativas); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su tía, a quien apoyaba desde niña, cuando ella se casó decide emprender un negocio independiente. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Artesanas" [Artisans] communal bank will start its fifth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional office. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board, of which Bibiana is the President. The members of the association are moving ahead with a variety of businesses. Among them are: making suits for typical dances, weaving blankets, selling fruit, construction services, selling shakes.

The loan they will take out will benefit small microbusinesswomen, of whom Bibiana is one. She says that this her fifth year in Pro Mujer; she joined at the invitation of a friend who is a customer of the institution. Currently she has a business that is a workshop for making polleras (native skirts); she says that she learned this business from her aunt, who supported her from the time she was a girl. When she got married, she decided to start an independent business.

The loan she will now take out is to increase capital by buying wholesale fabric, which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto. After production, she will sell it at her customers' request. This form of work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is married and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fabric

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 34 years old, married and the mother of three children. She has been running a posho mill and at the same time sells dry maize and maize flour. She has been in this business for the last four years and earns an income of 20,000 KES.

She has applied for her second loan of 30,000 KES to buy more dry maize and to service her posho mill. With the anticipated profit, she will buy land and start animal farming. She hopes to grow her business and venture into animal keeping.

loans.use: to buy dry maize and to service her posho mill

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 58 years old. She is married and she and her husband have been blessed with seven children aged between 34 years and 20 years. Elizabeth sells poultry as well as other goods, a business she has done for the last ten years, earning a monthly income of 18,000 KES.

Elizabeth has requested her first loan of 40,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya,which she will use to buy poultry as well as other farm products to sell. Elizabeth's hope and dream for the future is to open a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy poultry and farm products

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. James joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children. James is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, James will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, James can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” James is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his long-term goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, hygiene products, and other products.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Yakubu, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Yakubu  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family” expressed Yakubu   With this loan, Yakubu is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane works as a retailer, selling groceries and assorted soaps in a small kiosk in her neighborhood. She has been performing this work for the past three years. She begins her duties at 6:30 a.m. and finishes at 9:30 p.m., working this same schedule from Monday to Sunday. She performs this job to maintain her home and provide for her family. 

Jane is requesting a loan from ID Ghana, which she will use to purchase groceries and assorted soaps at wholesale, which will increase her working capital and her earnings, providing her a better standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and assorted soaps at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase grocery goods to re-sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bread, coconut, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en: Maryamu is a 45-year-old farmer from R/Tabo. As a Babban Gona member, Maryamu, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Maryamu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Maryamu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 37 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Maryamu said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; hassan, alheri ,  and  tafita, and in 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Flor De Rosas Mariscal Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE ROSAS MARISCAL” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Concepción es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de kerosenne, venta de verduras, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, tienda de refrescos, venta de salchipapa, venta de pescado, venta de awayos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Concepción es integrante, ella indica que es el quinto año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de tejido de awayos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, quien tenía este negocio y ella apoyaba en su comercio. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de hilo por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen esta ausente una de las clientes, la misma que se encontraba en el consultorio de salud en el momento de la imagen.
texts.en: The Flor de Rosas Mariscal communal bank will begin its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of Centro Focal de Los Andes. It is made up of eight members and is run by an executive committee, of which Concepcion is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run vary, among them kerosene sales, fruit sales, food sales, a neighborhood store, a soft drink store, fried potato with hot dog sales, fish sales, and woven textile sales. The loan that they will take out will benefit small business owners, one of whom is Concepcion. She says that this is her fifth year as a member of Pro Mujer, which she joined at the invitation of a consultant of the institution who went to visit her. Currently she has a workshop where textiles are woven. She shares that she learned this business from her mother, who had this business, and she supported her in her sales. The loan that she will take out now is to increase capital (purchase thread wholesale from the wholesale venders in the city of El Alto) and after production she will sell it to her clients made-to-order. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is single and has two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the savings that the institution offers. In the photograph one of the clients is absent, one who was at the health clinic at the time the picture was taken.

loans.use: to buy thread wholesale.

loans.name: Zavkiya

texts.ru: Завкия родилась в 1981 году. Она замужем и воспитывает 6 детей. У нее очень большая семья. Завкия хочет организовать бизнес и найти источника дохода, так как для обеспечения 6 детей требуется много денег. Она хочет организовать бизнес скотоводством, так как она живет в аграрном районе и имеет  возможность для развития данного бизнеса. Она будет откармливать крупно-рогатого скота. Ее дети будут помогать ей по откармливанию скота. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки скота. С полученного дохода она будет улучшать условию проживания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zavkiya was born in 1981. She is married and is raising six children. She has a very large family. Zavkiya wants to start a business and find a source of income, since six children cost a lot of money. She wants to start a cattle business since she lives in an agricultural area and has the opportunity to develop this business. She will fatten cattle. Her children will help her fatten cattle. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 somoni to buy cattle. With the influx on new income, she will be able to improve her family's living conditions. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: buy cattle to start a new business.

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Мадина молодая и умная девушка. Она начитанная девушка, которая живет вместе со своими родителями на юге страны. Она студентка 3 курса Медицинского Университета Таджикистана. Мадина учится на отличные оценки. Мадина приезжает домой во время каникул. Ее родители простые рабочие и поэтому не в состоянии оплатить за ее учебный договор. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1100 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Madina is a young and intelligent girl. She is a well-read woman who lives with her parents in the south of the country. She is a 3rd year student at the Medical University of Tajikistan. Madina makes very high grades. Madina comes home during the holidays. Her parents are ordinary workers and therefore are unable to pay her tuition. She is requesting a loan of $1,100 US to pay tuition. She is waiting for your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: pay tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fabric.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah used the previous loan to stock poultry birds. She has continued with the same business alongside growing bananas and coffee, and rearing cows for milk production. She faces challenges of limited capital and changes in weather. Besides that, she hopes to expand her poultry business. Sarah needs a loan to improve on her banana plantation.

loans.use: to improve on her banana plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her house

loans.name: Digna Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Digna es una socia amable y gentil que forma parte del grupo de crédito Cruzloma, está en su segundo crédito, vive en una comunidad del cantón Paute, se encuentra ubicado en la ruta de unión natural entre la sierra y el oriente Ecuatoriano, tiene un clima templado y su gente es muy amable.
La Señora Digna tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 4 y 3 años, su esposo labora como operador de maquinaria pesada, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros de manera independiente.
Doña Digna se dedica a la venta de comida rápida los fines de semana, el resto de la semana se dedica al cuidado de su familia y también a la cría de gallinas de postura y cuyes. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de gallinas, cuyes y una carreta para ampliar su negocio. Su meta es tener un negocio más grande y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Digna is a kind and gentle member of the Cruzloma lending group.  She is on her second loan.  She lives in the Paute canton, which is located on the route that links the mountains and the eastern region of Ecuador.  It has a temperate climate and the people are very kind. 

Digna is 22 years old, is married and has two children, ages 4 and 3, from this marriage.  Her husband works operating heavy machinery.  They do not own their own home, therefore they currently live in her in-laws home.  Digna works selling fast food on the weekends.  The rest of the week, she takes care of her family, and raises hens and guinea pigs.

The money from this loan will be used to purchase hens, guinea pigs and a cart to expand her business.  Her goal is to have a larger business and get ahead with her family.

loans.use: purchase chickens, guinea pigs and a cart.

loans.name: Istifanus

texts.en: Istifanus remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Istifanus like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Istifanus,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  Istifanus expressed that “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” With this loan, Istifanus is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coal, cold water and rice for resale.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 38-year-old married father of two. He is an Egyptian citizen who established his own charcoal selling business in 2011, after he was an employee for 14 years in this industry. Ayman is a hard worker, who is putting so much effort into developing his business and improving his family's standard of living.

His business is going on just fine, but his family's needs are increasing and his income is becoming a lot less than what he has to pay. For this reason, he has to improve his business in order to cover his needs.

Today Ayman is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his business capital through buying more quantities of charcoal at special encouraging prices.

He hopes that in the future he can move to a larger place where he can increase his charcoal stock and store the charcoal in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Jhon Christian

texts.es:
Jhon es un joven emprendedor, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive en San Juan de Lurigancho junto a su familia. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Desde hace más de 2 años trabaja como albañil en las distintas obras que hay en la Ciudad y le va muy bien ya que es muy trabajador, atento, responsable y tiene mucho trabajo ya que brinda servicios de calidad.
Jhon está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar electrodomésticos como una lavadora para su mamá ya que por temporada de invierno es muy difícil lavar y secar la ropa. De esta manera será una gran ayuda para su madre y él seguirá esforzándose para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jhon is an enterprising young man. He is 20 years old, single, and lives in San Juan de Lurigancho with his family. He is someone who really wants to get ahead. For over two years, he has worked as a builder in the different construction projects that there are in the city, and he is doing very well because he is very hardworking, attentive, and responsible and he has a lot of work since he offers quality services. 

Jhon is grateful to Kiva lenders because with the support that they have given him he will be able to buy home appliances like a washing machine for his mother, because in the winter it is very difficult to wash and dry clothes. In this way he will be a great help to his mother and he will continue working hard to be able to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy appliances (washing machine).

loans.name: Digna Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora. Digna es una socia alegre y colaborativa que forma parte del grupo de crédito Cruzloma, le gusta esta forma de grupos por la unión y solidaridad que existen entre todas, ya que se apoyan mutuamente en sus necesidades. Vive en una comunidad del cantón Paute que se encuentra ubicado en la ruta de unión natural entre la sierra y el oriente Ecuatoriano, tiene un clima templado y su gente es muy amable.
La Señora Digna tiene 20 años de edad, vive en unión libre y fruto de esa unión ha concebido una hija de 6 años que está estudiando en una escuelita del sector, su esposo labora como mecánico industrial, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres de manera independiente.
Doña Dignas trabaja cuatro días a la semana pelando pollos, esta actividad le permite tener solvencia económica, también se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cuyes. El dinero de su crédito es para el pago de una cuota de un terreno que adquirió. Su meta es tener más animales y también su propia casa.
texts.en:
Digna is a a happy and collaborative member of the Cruzloma lending group.  She enjoys this type of group because of the unity and solidarity that exists among them since they support each other with their needs.  She lives in a community in the Paute canton, which is located on the route between the mountains and eastern region of Ecuador.  The area has a temperate climate and the people are very kind. 

Digna is 20 years old, lives in a common-law marriage, and has a six-year-old daughter who attends a local school.  Her husband works as an industrial mechanic.  They do not have their own home, therefore they live in her parents' home.  Digna works four days a week plucking chickens.  This job provides her with financial solvency.  She also raises hens and guinea pigs.

The money from this loan will be used to pay the fee on a plot of land she acquired.  Her goal is to have more animals and her own home.

loans.use: pay the fees on her property.

loans.name: Rahel

texts.en:
Rahel is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Rahel has operated a fish selling business for more than ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces major challenges of seasonality and perishability, leading to losses.

With the loan of 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 31 years old, married, and blessed with one child .She has been running a retail shop and has also been selling vegetables as a secondary business for the past 15 years. She earns a monthly income of 22,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 
She has applied for her third loan of 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy more stock of sugar, salt, sweets, and flour for resale.

 With the profits, she will educate her child. She hopes to grow her business and be financially stable

loans.use: to add more stock of sugar, salt, flour, and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Iamze

texts.en:
Iamze, who is a 68-year-old married woman, lives in the village of Gelati. She lives alone and earns a living by cultivating her own agricultural land and working as a sick-nurse. She generates approximately GEL 250-300 and she plans to expand the areas in her agricultural business. 

Iamze requested a loan and was approved with the start-up program that gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses. She will purchase pigs, raise them, and sell them at good prices. This new activity will give Iamze a chance to increase her productivity and, in the future, expand her activity using the money saved.

She will be really grateful for the help that Kiva lenders can provide and she will greatly appreciate it.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potato greens for resale.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is 45 years old. She lives with her husband in the small village of Sagarejo district, Kakheti region, East Georgia. Leila works as a housekeeper and her husband is a security guard. Leila has two cows and produces cheese products to sell locally. She wants to open a small shop in her village near house. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,200 GEL to purchase inventory for the shop. Leila will run the shop and will be able to increase the income of her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a shop.

loans.name: Idi

texts.en: Idi is a 38-year-old farmer from Daudu.  As a Babban Gona member, Idi is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Idi can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Idi is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 34 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Idi is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Isuhu,  and  Rahab. Idi’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Yunana

texts.en: Yunana remembers not being able to build a new house  during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Yunana like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Yunana,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season due to the quality inputs that he will obtain with this loan. When asked about the future, Yunana said: “In 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.” With this loan, Yunana is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Ishaku

texts.en: Ishaku is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Ishaku joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Bilhatu, Murna, and  Hannatu. Ishaku is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Ishaku will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Ishaku can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Ishaku is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his long-term goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Los Ayllus De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS AYLLUS DE SAN JERONIMO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Jerónimo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana Bertha la socia continua dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia  cultiva papa, maíz, habas entre otros productos, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar abono, semillas entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, tienda de abarrotes, crianza de animales.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Los Ayllus de San Jeronimo communal bank. This bank is located in the San Jeronimo district, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. The member is Juana Bertha. The member continues to make a living in agriculture, growing potato, corn, and beans, among other products. For years the member has made a living in this business, and she is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day. The member wants to be able to continue working in this way in order to keep supporting her family.

The member requests the loan to buy manure and seeds, among other things. The other members make a living in agriculture, a general store, and raising animals. The member thanks those who are part of this dream through this medium and commits to complying with the payment of her installments during the established term.

loans.use: to buy manure and seeds, among other things.

loans.name: Obadiah Murtala

texts.en: Obadiah Maitala remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Obadiah Maitala, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Obadiah Maitala  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community” expressed Obadiah Maitala. With this loan, Obadiah Maitala is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Le'atu Indo

texts.en: Le'atu Indo remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Le'atu Indo, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Le'atu Indo  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family” expressed Le'atu Indo   With this loan, Le'atu Indo is well on her way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is a 28-year-old farmer from Daudu.  As a Babban Gona member, Ayuba, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Ayuba can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Ayuba is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 50 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Ayuba is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Ibrahim,  and  Matina. Ayuba’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to make more money for myself and my family”, he expressed.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bread, cookies, chips, flour and other food items to sell.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 41 years old. She is married with four children between 8 and 16 years old. She has been selling rice, sugar and beans for the past eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Las Agiles Vicuñitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS AGILES VICUÑITAS” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Panfila es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: hilado de lana de vicuña, panadería, venta de ropa americana, venta de ropa, venta de comida, venta de perfumes, venta de fruta, venta de carteras, venta de jugo de quinua, costura de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Panfila es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución.
