En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  panadería; da a conocer que este negocio fue familiar y lo trabajo desde niña, conjuntamente sus padres, cuando conoció a su esposo ambos decidieron seguir con el mismo de forma independiente. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina por mayor) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, las capacitaciones y los microcréditos que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Las Agiles Vicuñitas" lending group is entering its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of its Santiago II regional office.  The group is made up of 10 members, and is led by a board of directors of which Panfila is the president.  The members are involved in a variety of businesses which include: spinning vicuña wool, bakery, selling American clothing, selling clothing, selling food, selling perfume, selling fruit, selling purses, selling quinoa juice, tailoring. 

The loan that they are seeking will be used to help the businesses that Panfila is a member of.  She states that she has been in Pro Mujer for two years, having joined after being invited by a friend who is a member of the institution.  Currently, she owns a bakery.  She tells us that this is a family business and she has worked in it with her parents since she was a young girl.  When she met her husband, they both decided to continue in the same field on their own.

The loan that they are requesting will be used to purchase flour in bulk, which she will obtain from wholesale distributors in the city of El Alto.  After baking her products, she will sell them in her store.  This line of work allows her to earn an income to support her family financially since she is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she enjoys the health center, the training, and the micro loan that the institution offers.

loans.use: purchase flour in bulk.

loans.name: Pragati Group

texts.en:
Rashmita, 28 years of age, is the leader of a group that hails from Rental Colony, Baramunda of Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. She is living with her husband and one son age seven. The member standing first from the right with her hand raised is Rashmita.

Rashmita is running a sari shop on a month-to-month rental basis.  Her husband helps her to purchase saris from different towns. Rashmita, along with the other four members of her locality, formed a group to take a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their existing business.  Now, she is very much confident in running her business and has developed her business significantly. At present, her monthly income is about Rs.7,000. She wants to take a further loan to purchase a huge amount of saris from Ahmedabad and Mumbai to add her business.  She has long desired to have her own shop in her locality.

The other four members of her groups are Saroj, Uttama, Kabita and Subhalaxmi who are doing tailoring work in their houses.

loans.use: to purchase a huge amount of saris

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is 35 years old and  married, with four children and one dependent: his mother, who is old and widowed. 

Frank does cattle-fattening and milking as his major source of income. He has managed to look after his family with the basic necessities and he also constructed a permanent house.

Frank is applying for a loan of UGX 5,000,000 to buy more cows to fatten and also to construct a dam for his cows. His major challenge is the dry season, which leaves his entire farm dry, with minimum water, if any, hence making him move from one place to another, looking for water.

He wants to be the leading supplier of milk and beef in his region.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en: Saratu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Saratu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Antony, Habila,  and  Yahuza,. Saratu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Saratu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, she would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Saratu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Saratu said “I plan to use the money I make this year to expand my farmland”. Saratu is not thinking about just this year; she said, "In 5 years, I  want to make more money for myself and my family.”

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Ibrahim Mati

texts.en: Ibrahim Mati remembers not being able to pay his children's school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim Mati like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Ibrahim Mati,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 40 bags per hectare this season due to the inputs he will access with this loan, such as improved seeds. When asked about his plans for the future,  Ibrahim Mati said: “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Ibrahim Mati is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Micah

texts.en: Micah remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Micah like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Micah,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  Micah expressed that “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family.” With this loan, Micah is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Santa Luisa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Luisa está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty, la cual es una zona que aun se encuentra en crecimiento es un nuevo Distrito.  Por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Vidalina es una de las integrantes, ella tiene un negocio donde todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas, ella lucha por su familia para poder darles todo lo que no pudo tener, y que no tengan que pasar por necesidades. Vidalina tiene una despensa bien surtida que monto con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo, y que hoy es el sostén de la familia de ella.  Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de la fundación pueda crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Solicita de este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su despensa, como verduras, carne, bebidas, frutas, lácteos y demás ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con su lucha y esfuerzo por mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
The group named “Santa Luisa” is in its second loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. The members are from the city of Curuguaty, an area that is growing since it is a new district. For this reason, the members of this group want to keep growing so that they can make their area a better place to live. They are progressing gradually.

Sra. Vidalina is one of the members. She has a business where she works every day, beginning in the early morning hours. Vidalina works on behalf of her family in order to provide them everything that she was not able to have so that they don’t feel deprived. She has a well-stocked food pantry that she established through great sacrifice and effort. Today it serves as the source of income for her family. As time passes and with the help of Fundación Paraguaya, she wants to grow and improve her living conditions.

Vidalina is requesting a loan in order to buy inventory for her food pantry such as vegetables, meat, beverages, fruit, dairy products, and other products. With determination and effort, she can continue to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, beverages, fruit, dairy products, and other products.

loans.name: Prudence

texts.en:
Prudence is 32 years old and is married with three children between three and 11 years old. For the past nine years, she has sold biscuits and sugar.

Prudence is requesting a loan to purchase more items such as sugar, rice, and utensils to sell. She will use the profit from her loan to buy a plot of land for cultivation.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, utensils and other items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food like oil and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy slippers, bags, and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila is a 50-year-old farmer from Gayya.  As a Babban Gona member, Rahila is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Rahila can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Rahila is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, she will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Rahila is hopeful about what the future holds; she  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, she will finally be able to afford to educate her children; Mary,  and  Annah. Rahila’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to make more money for myself and my family”, she expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en: Hauwa remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This is before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Hauwa like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Hauwa,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  Hauwa expressed that “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family.” With this loan, Hauwa is well on her way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: María Lucila

texts.es:
La Señora María forma parte del grupo de crédito Pauteñitas y se encuentra en su segundo crédito, vive por los alrededores del cantón de Paute, este cantón se caracteriza por la belleza natural de sus paisajes, es de clima templado, en sus tierras se cultivan las más hermosas flores, su gente de un corazón muy cálido y amable. 
La Señora. María tiene 42 años de edad, está divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos de 24, 21, 19, 18, 17 y 14 años, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, su segunda hija estudia enfermería, su tercer hijo pasa en casa ayudando a los quehaceres de la casa, sus tres últimos hijos estudian en un colegio del sector, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña María se dedica a la cría de cuyes, gallinas y cerdos,  también a la agricultura que es para su venta y para su hogar, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres y ahora le permite solventar los gastos de su hogar. Ella está repitiendo el crédito para invertir en la compra de gallinas, cuyes y cerdos para seguir creciendo en esta actividad. Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the "Pauteñitas" communal bank and she is on her second loan. She lives in the canton of Paute, which is characterized by the  natural beauty of its landscapes. It has a mild climate. The most beautiful flowers are grown in these lands. The people are very kind and warmhearted.

Maria is 42 years old and divorced. From her marriage she has six children aged 24,  21, 19, 18, 17 and 14. Her oldest son is married and lives independently. The second daughter is a nursing student. The third son is at home helping with household chores. The youngest three are students in a local school. She owns the house in which she lives.

Maria makes a living raising guinea pigs, hens, and pigs, and she is also a farmer growing crops for sale and for household consumption. She learned this activity from her parents and now it allows her to meet household expenses. 

She is repeating the loan to invest in the purchase of hens, guinea pigs and pigs, in order to keep expanding this activity. Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy hens, guinea pigs and pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice and coal

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel remembers not being able to feed his family as a result of a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Daniel like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Daniel is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season as a result of the high quality inputs that he will obtain with his loan. When asked about his future plans, Daniel said; “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family.” With this loan, Daniel is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Mu'azu

texts.en: Mu'azu is a 35-year-old farmer from Sona.  As a Babban Gona member, Mu'azu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Mu'azu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Mu'azu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, his said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Sani, Madina, and  Falalu. My overall goal is to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy used clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items like gas, rice, oil and bouillon cubes to sell.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is 38 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of two and fourteen. Constance runs a food market. 

Constance is requesting a loan to buy more rice, cooking oil and beans to sell. She will use the profits from her loan to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil and beans to sell

loans.name: Rosa Esther

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa forma parte del grupo de crédito Pauteñitas, está realizando su segundo crédito, vive por los alrededores del cantón de Paute, este cantón se caracteriza por la belleza natural de sus paisajes, es de clima templado, en sus tierras se cultivan las más hermosas flores, su gente de un corazón muy cálido y amable. 
La Señora Rosa tiene 49 años de edad, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos mayores de edad, una de sus hijas es casada y vive independiente, uno de sus hijos trabaja y le ayuda en la económicamente, uno de sus hijos pasa en casa ayudando en los quehaceres del hogar, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 
Doña Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, a la cría de aves de corral y cuyes, así como también a la agricultura que es para la venta y para el consumo de su hogar, estas  actividades le han brindado la oportunidad de salir en adelante con su familia. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la construcción de un galpón para cuyes y en la compra de cuyes y `pollos. Su meta es crecer en esta actividad y conservar su salud.
texts.en:
Rosa is part of the credit group Pauteñitas, and is making her second loan request.  She lives in the area around the Paute canton, a canton characterized by the natural beauty of its landscapes.  The area has a temperate climate, the most beautiful flowers grow on its land, and its people are warm and kind-hearted.

Rosa is 49 years old, is widowed and from her relationship has given birth to 3 children who are now adults: one of her daughters is married and lives separately from Rosa, one of her children works and helps her financially, and one stays home helping with the chores of the house. She does not own her own house and therefore rents living space.

Rosa works doing housework, raising chickens and guinea pigs, as well as in agriculture both for sale and for consumption in her home.  This work has given her the opportunity for her family to get ahead.  The money from her loan will go to invest in the construction of a shed for guinea pigs and in the purchase of both guinea pigs and chickens.  Her goal is to expand her work and maintain her health.

loans.use: to build a shed and purchase guinea pigs and chickens

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 38 years old. She is married with three children. She is a tailor, and has been in the business for the past five years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more fabric to make school uniforms for the students. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in her sewing business.

loans.use: To buy more fabric for making more clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs, concentrated feed, and to pay for structural repairs.

loans.name: Gambo

texts.en: Gambo is a 30-year-old farmer from Sona.  As a Babban Gona member, Gambo is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Gambo can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Gambo is ambitious and is aiming to reap 60 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, his said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Samaila, Nafiu, and  Barau. My overall goal is to make more money for myself and my family”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more attachments and wig for fixing hair.

loans.name: Los Girasoles  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Los Girasoles está formado por 7 socias, cada una de ellas aporta activamente al grupo, se encuentran unidas hace varios años, su objetivo principal es mejorar su estabilidad económica y que sus familias lleguen a tener más oportunidades de superación. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que goza de una belleza natural y arquitectónica, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, es cuna de grandes deportistas y escritores.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Miryam, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 9 y 5 años que estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo es de profesión sastre, la casa es propia.
Doña Miryam se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y aportar a la economía de su casa cría y vende cerdos, cuyes y gallinas de postura, también se dedica a la agricultura que es para la venta y para el consumo de su hogar. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de cerdos y alimento para sus animales, así como para el estudio de sus hijos. Su sueño es no tener deudas.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Los Girasoles" (The Sunflowers) is formed by 7 members. Each of them actively contributes to the group. They have been together several years and their main goal is to improve their financial stability and provide more opportunities for their families to get ahead. They live in the city of Cuenca, which boasts natural and architectural beauty. The city has been named a World Heritage City since December 1999 and it is the birthplace of great sportsmen and writers.
One of the members of this group is Miryam. She is 27 years old, married and has 2 children aged 9 and 5 who study at a local school. Her husband is a tailor and they own their house.
Miryam works as a housewife and in order to contribute to the household economy she raises and sells pigs, guinea pigs and laying hens. She also works as a farmer, producing crops for selling and for family consumption. The loan money is to purchase pigs and animal feed as well as to pay for her children's studies. Her dream is to be debt-free.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and animal feed and to pay for her children's studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover treatment and medicine needs.

loans.name: Evarist

texts.en:
Evarist is 29 years old.  He is married and has two children. He deals in agricultural produce, buying beans, as his major source of income. He is also active in farming and most of the beans are from his garden.

He is applying for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX in order to buy more beans for his business.  This will enable him to increase his sales to better meet his customers’ needs and increase his profits.  Evarist is hardworking.

His main challenge is the inadequate amount of land for farming as he enjoys agriculture.  If he receives this loan, he will be able to increase his sales and later hopes to buy land for agricultural purposes.

He wants to be the leader in supplying high quality beans in his region.

loans.use: to buy dry beans for resale.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. María forma parte del grupo Cruzloma, vive en una comunidad del cantón Paute que se encuentra ubicado en la ruta de unión natural entre la sierra y el oriente Ecuatoriano, tiene un clima templado y su gente es muy amable. Su grupo de crédito es unido y todos luchan por un mismo objetivo el cual es la superación en su hogar.
La Señora María tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 23, 21, 19 y 16 años, sus tres hijos son casados y viven independientes, su ultima hija está estudiando en un colegio de la localidad, su esposo es operador de una maquinaria pesada, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña María se dedica a la cría de cerdos y pollos que los vende pelados y en pie, también a  la agricultura, la siembra hierba y la vende como alimento para los animales. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de cerdos. Su meta es agrandar su galpón de pollos.
texts.en:
María is part of the Cruzloma group.  She lives in a community in the Paute canton, which is located on the route between the mountains and the eastern coast of Ecuador.  The region has a temperate climate, and the people are very kind.  Her lending group is unified and they all fight for the same objective, succeeding at home.

María is 40 years old, is married has four children, ages 23, 21, 19 and 16, from the marriage.  Her three sons are married and live on their own, and her last daughter is attended school in the community.  Her husband is a heavy machinery operator.  They own the house that they live in.  María works raising pigs and chickens that she sells already plucked and alive.  She also does some farming, growing herbs that she sells as animal feed.

The money from this loan will be used to purchase hogs.  Her goal is to expand her chicken coop.

loans.use: purchase pigs.

loans.name: Sabougnouma V Group

texts.fr:
Les  06 membres du groupe  SABOUGNOUMA V  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 24 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DRAKORO-DOUMBA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide le riz et le mil avec   SOKOLOMBA, 1ère personne  assise de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the SABOUGNOUMA V  group are married women and they are, on average, 24 years old with two children each. They all live in polygamous families in Drakoro-Doumba, a village located in the commune of Ouelessebougou (second administrative region of Mali). They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth farming loan with the institution.

Sokolomba, a member of the group, grows groundnut, rice and millet. In the photo, she is in the front row, first from the right. She is planning to use her loan to buy some agricultural inputs and seeds, and also to cover the cost of plowing on two hectares of land. After the harvest, she sells her crop at the market, to consumers as well as resellers.  She is expecting to make an average profit of 195,000 CFA francs per planting season. She will use her profit to repay her loan and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover her plowing costs and buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Richary Anteña Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “RICCHARY ANTEÑA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Roalbina  tiene 59 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de  productos como arroz, azúcar entre otros, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar gaseosas entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de panificadora, venta de frutas, internet, venta de carne.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde  a la reunión por  motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to the communal bank "RICCHARY ANTEÑA". This bank is located in the Anta District, belonging to the Anta Province and the Department of Cusco.
The partner Rosalbina, 59, has two children and is married.  The partner alternates her daily activities with a grocery shop business.  She sells different types of products such as rice and sugar among other things.  She has been doing this business, which goes well due to the effort she puts into it every day, for years.  She wishes to be able to continue working this way in order to support her family.
The partner is asking for this loan to buy sodas among other things.
The other partners make a living in bakery, fruit sales, internet, and meat sales businesses.
The partners who stand out in the attached photo requested permission to arrive late due to work.
The partner thanks those who are part of this dream in this way and promises to fulfill the payments of her fees according to the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy sodas among other things.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is a 41-year-old widow from Rustavi city.  She lives alone and, for the past two years, Manana has worked as a baker.  She pays part of her salary to the owner.

In order to increase her productivity and generate more income, Manana decided to open her own Georgian traditional bakery.  She has requested a loan from MFO Credo, which gives people a chance to be involved in their own businesses through its start-up program.  So, Manana plans to purchase flour and firewood and start her own business in a place that she has already repaired.  This experienced and motivated woman will do her best to improve her living conditions and to establish some financial savings for further development. 

Manana relies on the good will of lenders and awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase flour and firewood in order to open her own bakery.

loans.name: Victor Kenny

texts.es:
Victor es un empresario próspero, tiene 33 años, es soltero y vive en Huaraz junto a su familia.
Desde hace más de 4 años se dedica a la venta de ropa en un pequeño negocio que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado formalizar y le va muy bien ya que es muy trabajador, emprendedor, responsable y siempre ofrece productos de calidad a los clientes. Con el dinero obtenido apoya a su familia en los gastos del hogar.
Victor está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá mercadería por temporada de invierno para que de esta manera pueda obtener mayores ganancias y continúe apoyando a su familia. Gracias a esto seguirá luchando para más adelante poder cumplir uno de sus más grandes sueños: "Tener su casa propia".
texts.en:
Victor is a successful business owner.  He is 33 years old, single, and lives in Huaraz with his family.  For the past four years, he has worked selling clothing in a small business that through a lot of effort and dedication, he has been able to establish.  It has gone very well for him because he is very hardworking, enterprising, responsible, and always offers quality products to his customers.  With his earnings, he is able to support his family with the household expenses.

Victor is grateful for the Kiva lenders because with their support, he will be able to purchase seasonal merchandise for this winter so that he will be able to generate greater earnings and continue to support his family.  Thanks to this, he will continue striving so that in the future he will be able to achieve his greatest dream of owning his own home.

loans.use: purchase seasonal merchandise to run his clothing store.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: Adamu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Adamu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children. Adamu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Adamu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Adamu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Adamu is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS PALMERAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Yobana la socia continua  con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como leche, azúcar, arroz entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de azucar, leche entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tejidos de chompas, negocio de servicio de taxi, negocio de restaurante, venta de mates, venta de verduras.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
Las personas que sale con la cara tapada no pertenecen al banco comunal.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Las Palmeras" communal bank. This bank is located in Cusco, in Cusco province and state. One of the members, Yobana, continues with her grocery store business. She sells basic food items such as milk, sugar, rice, and other items. Her business is going well thanks to the efforts she puts into it every day. She wishes to continue working to support her family. She seeks a loan to buy sugar, milk, and other items.

The other members have businesses selling artisan products, knitting sweaters, providing taxi service, a restaurant business, selling teas, and selling vegetables. The members in the photo whose faces are covered do not belong to the communal bank.

Yobana is thankful to those who have supported her dream through this loan and she promises to make the loan payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk and other items.

loans.name: Dúo Los Encantos Group

texts.es:
DUO LOS ENCANTOS
Doña Catarina, es originaria del municipio de tecpan, ella tiene 54 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de refacciones y venta de frutas.
Desde hace años ella empezó su propio negocio y gracias a Dios poco apoco a podido crecer con su negocio, con el esfuerzo de ella y de su hijo.
Gracias al apoyo de sus hijos y el esfuerzo de ella a podido salir adelante, ya que hoy en dia hay mucha competencia en el mercado.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio, ofrecer mas variedad de productos a sus clientes ya que asi obtendrá mejores ganancias y poder mejorar su calidad de vida, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de frutas para la venta.
texts.en:
One of the members of the loan group "Duo los encantos" is Catarina. She is originally from the town of Tecpan and is 54 years old. She works selling fruits and refreshments. She started this business many years ago and thankfully, due to the effort she and her son have put forth, it has grown little by little over the years. Since there is a lot of competition in this sector, it is thanks to the support of her children and thanks to her own hard work that she has gotten ahead.

Catarina's dream is to expand her business and offer a greater variety of products to her customers, as this will mean greater earnings and will improve her quality of life. That is why she is asking for this loan to buy fruits to sell.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough goods such as rice, cubes and oil to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 28 years old. She is married with two children between three and six years old. She runs a photocopy machine business. She wants the loan to buy extra photocopy machines for use in the business. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business of photocopiers.

loans.use: To buy extra photocopiers for use in the business.

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en: Marie Chantal is 30 years old. She is married with three children. She sells sugar, rice and biscuits. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar and rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and rice to sell

loans.name: La Fortuna Group

texts.es:
Don Tomas, tiene 64 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 5 hijos, reside en una comunidad que pertenece al municipio de San Pedro Sula. Toda su vida la ha dedicado a la agricultura, cultivando maíz, frijoles y café. Esta actividad ha sido su fuente de ingresos. La producción es vendida a intermediarios o mercados locales. El préstamo que solicita es por 12,000 lempiras en forma grupal con este préstamo va comprar abonos para fertilizar la finca de café y darle un mantenimiento general para poder sacar mejor cosecha. Su idea es tecnificar la producción, que sus hijos puedan estudiar y mejorar su situación económica.
El grupo se llama La Fortuna, integrado por 13 personas que se dedican al cultivo de café y otros granos en la misma zona. El préstamo grupal suma 128,000 Lempiras con el cual compraran abonos para brindar asistencia a la finca. En al foto esta Santos a la izquierda, sigue Jacobo, Gregorio, Tomas, Gladys, Miltton, María Lucrecia, María Santos, Maria Isabel, Jose Edgardo, José Armando, José Martín y Mártir a la derecha.
texts.en:
Tomas, is 64 and lives with his common-law wife, with whom he has 5 children. He lives in a community that is part of the town of San Pedro Sula. He has spent his whole life working in agriculture, growing maize, beans and coffee. This has been his source of income. He sells his produce to intermediaries or at local markets.

He is asking for a loan of of 12,000 HNL via a group loan. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers for his coffee farm and secure better general maintenance so he can obtain a better harvest. His aim is to modernize production so his children will be able to get an education and improve their economic situation. 

The group is called La Fortuna and consists of 13 people who are all involved in cultivating coffee and other grains, and who come from the same area. The group loan is for 128,000 HNL, which they will use to buy fertilizer to help with their farms. In the photo, Santos is on the left, and then there is Jacobo, Gregorio, Tomas, Gladys, Miltton, María Lucrecia, María Santos, Maria Isabel, Jose Edgardo, José Armando, José Martin and then Martir on the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee farm and to bring about better maintenance.

loans.name: Villa Real Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario lo integran cuatro socias laboriosas y lo coordina la señora Sudelba de 48 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijos de los cuales ninguno depende económicamente de ella, es propietaria de una pulpería desde hace veinte años además comercializa cosechas de frutas, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de aguacate, mamón, nancite y tamarindo, además invertirá en lácteos, pan dulce, pan simple, arroz, aceite, etc., con los créditos anteriores le ha permitido ampliar su negocio y diversificar los productos que ofrece en su negocio. Otra de las socias es la señora Celeste de 21 años de edad comerciante de frutas y propietaria de un mini cafetín en el colegio de su comunidad, la señora Ines de 28 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace cuatro años, y la señora María Dolores de 35 años de edad quien se dedica a la comercialización de derivados del maíz en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace diez años.
texts.en: The solidarity group is formed by four hardworking members and is coordinated by Sudelba. She is 48 years old, married and the mother of three children, who do not depend financially of her. She has owned a grocery store for more than twenty years and she also sells harvests of fruits. She is requesting the loan to buy the harvest of avocado, Spanish lime (mamon), nance and tamarind. She will also invest it in dairy products, sweet bread, plain bread, rice, oil, etc. With her previous loans she has been able to grow her business and diversify the products she offers in her business. Another member is Celeste, 21 years old, fruit merchant and owner of a small cafe in her community high school; Ines, 28 years old, who has worked for four years buying and selling harvests at the district; and Maria Dolores, 35 years old, who has worked for ten years selling corn products at the district market.

loans.use: To buy the harvest of avocado, Spanish lime (mamon), nance and tamarind.

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
El Sr. Eladio proviene de una familia humilde, se inicio primeramente en  la  agricultura siendo muy joven, con el fruto de su trabajo se hizo de capital  y  empezó su venta ambulante, donde hoy cuenta con 100 clientes.
El comenta que también da trabajo a otras personas y que da fuentes de trabajo. Es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas, calzados, artículos de bazar y demás productos, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar cada día.
texts.en: Eladio comes from a humble family. He started farming as a young man. With the fruit of his work had saved his money and started a business as a street vendor, where today he has 100 clients. He says that he also hires others, providing employment. His is a hard-working and enterprising person who wishes to be successful. He seeks this loan to buy clothing, shoes, and other items to sell, as in this way he will be able to continue his sales, fighting to improve every day.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Igualdad Group

texts.es:
En Oaxaca, existe una zona cañera donde se encuentra el ingenio la Margarita. Desde el año 2010 se formó un grupo llamado “IGUALDAD” el cual ahora esta conformado por 19 personas de las cuales cada una tiene una actividad, con las ganancias obtenidas aportan para cubrir los gastos de la casa y cubrir los pagos correspondientes del préstamo en tiempo y forma.

Maria- Venta De Refrescos, Reyna- Venta De Comida Y Cosmeticos, Soledad- Antojitos, Cesarea- Venta De Cosmeticos, Magdalena- Venta De Postres, Martha- Venta De Ropa, Alicia- Venta De Pizzas, Cecilia- Venta De Antojitos, Araceli- Venta De Calzado, Daniel- Servicio De Soldadura Y Herreria, Maria Del Consuelo- Venta De Calzado Escolar, Claudia-Venta De Abarrotes, Maria Teresa-Venta De Tacos, Dolores Del Carmen-Dulcería,  Modesta- Venta De Plata, Maria Leonarda- Venta De Antojitos, Xochitl Del Mar-Venta De Calzado, Carlos- Venta De Calzado, Sarai- Venta De Papeleria.

Doña Soledad es una señora muy alegre, solo estudió la secundaria y desde hace ya mas de 20 años se ha dedicado a vender antojitos en un pequeño local que adecuó en la comodidad de su hogar lo cual le es muy viable puesto que vive frente a la carretera. Es muy conocida en la comunidad así como en lugares aledaños. "Gracias Vison Fund por haberme otorgado el primer préstamo desde hace ya 10 ciclos pues no he dejado de invertir en la compra de materia prima para la preparación de los antojitos". Desde hace 10 años, Soledad compra aceite, tortillas, platos desechables, papel aluminio, ajos, arroz, jitomate, entre otros.

De esta manera, los miembros del grupo pueden seguir brindando más oportunidades a su familia.
texts.en:
Oaxaca is an area where sugar cane is produced and is also home to the historical "La Margarita". The group "Igualdad", which was formed in 2010, now has 19 members who all have their own line of work.  They use their income to cover household expenses and to pay off the loans on time. 

Maria sells soft drinks; Reyna sells food and cosmetics; Soledad sells traditional corn-based foods; Cesarea sells cosmetics; Magdalena sells desserts; Martha sells clothes; Alicia sells pizzas; Cecilia also sells traditional corn-based dishes; Araceli sells footwear; Daniel provides a soldering and metalwork service; Maria del Consuelo sells footwear for school; Claudia sells groceries; Maria Teresa sells tacos; Dolores del Carmen sells candy; Modesta sells silver jewellery; Maria Leonarda sells traditional corn-based dishes; Xochitl del Mar sells footwear; Carlos sells footwear; and Sarai sells stationery.

Soledad is a very cheerful woman who only studied to secondary school level.  For more than 20 years, she has been selling traditional corn-based dishes in a small stall located comfortably in her own home.  This is very convenient because she lives on a main road.  She is well-known in the community as well as nearby areas. She gives thanks to "Vision Fund" for giving her her first loan ten cycles ago.  She has been consistently using the money to invest in supplies for making her dishes. Since ten years ago, Soledad has been buying oil, tortillas, disposable plates, tin foil, garlic, rice, tomatoes and other things.

loans.use: to buy oil, tortillas, disposable plates, tin foil and other supplies for their food sales.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel, ve en los créditos una herramienta útil para invertir en su negocio, por lo que se decidió por solicitar más capital que le servirá para comprar semilla, fertilizantes, plaguicidas, insecticidas y abono, para realizar los cultivos de maíz, y frijol.
El financiamiento anterior le ayudo a Daniel a comprar materiales agrícolas con los que preparo el terreno y protegió sus cultivos de plagas. Su estilo de vida ha mejorado y ha ido cancelando sus deudas.
texts.en:
Daniel sees loans as a helpful tool to invest in his business. For this reason, he decided to request another loan, which he will use to buy seeds, pesticides, insecticides, and inorganic and organic fertilizers to grow corn and beans.

The previous loan helped Daniel to buy agricultural supplies with which he prepared the field and protected his crops against pests. His way of life has improved, and he has been paying off his debts.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides, insecticides, and inorganic and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Basiru

texts.en: Basiru is a 25-year-old farmer from Doka.  As a Babban Gona member, Basiru is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Basiru can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Basiru is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 50 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Basiru is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Zaharadinu,  and  Nasiru. Basiru’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Saguazu Group

texts.es:
El grupo Saguazu está en su ciclo número 2 de la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, son luchadoras y sacrificadas que están luchando por sus familias y seres queridos. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, ya que de esa forma podrá conocer la situación de cada una y trabajar conforme a eso.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Patricia, quien se dedica a la costura, es muy buena en lo que hace ya que se hizo ya de muy buena clientela., y es bastante conocida en el barrio. Esta trabajado arduamente para poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres, etc., ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus confecciones cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Saguazu group is on its second cycle to eliminate poverty. They are hard working and self-sacrificing, fighting for their families and loved ones. They are striving to eliminate poverty, and in this way know each person's unique situation and work to meet their goals.

One of the members is Patricia, who is a seamstress. She is very good at what she does and has developed a very good clientele. She is rather well-known in the neighborhood. She is working hard to be able to improve her and her family's living conditions. She seeks this loan to be able to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc. and in this way be able to continue making clothing to meet her customer's orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a porch on her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls, buckets and general stock for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, cubes, oil, salt, pepper, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Joanna

texts.es:
Joanna vive con sus padre  y hermanos en la ciudad de San Lorenzo,su madre es enfermera y su padre es empleado de una empresa.
Joanna comenta que esta estudiando la carrera de enfermería, ya que siempre quiso poder ayudar a las demás personas por medio de su trabajo. Sus metas futuras son la de trabajar y seguir estudiando para  poder mantenerse  y ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de manutención, como ser fotocopias de materiales, pasaje de ómnibus y demás gastos que pueda surgir.
texts.en: Joanna lives with her parents and siblings in the city of San Lorenzo. Her mother is a nurse and her father is an employee at a business. Joanna says that she is studying nursing as she always wanted to be able to help other people through her work. Her future goals are to work and to continue studying to be able to support herself and help her family. She is applying for this loan to cover her living expenses such as photocopying materials, bus tickets, and other expenses as they arise.

loans.use: to pay for living expenses such as photocopies of materials, bus tickets, and other expenses as they arise.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, es estudiante de la carrera de Administración de empresas, es una persona que esta luchando por poder salir adelante y ser alguien en la vida.
Maria quiere ser una profesional útil a la sociedad, para que por medio de su conocimiento pueda ayudar a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Maria is from the city of Caaguazú. She is a student in the field of business administration. She is a person who is striving to get ahead and be someone in life. Maria wants to be a useful professional in society so that she can use her knowledge to help others. She is applying for this loan to invest it in university tuition and this way can continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Alive For Health Group

texts.en: Alive is a group of two people who live in the same district. The group's representative, Kwabena (the one with camera in the picture), is 44 years old. Kwabena is married to Joyce. The couple have three dependent children. Kwabena has been a photographer for 25 years.  This is the fifth time that Kwabena will benefit from a loan from ID-Ghana. Kwabena aims to increase his working service and his level of business so that he can better respond to his customers' needs. This is why Kwabena is requesting a loan from ID-Ghana, together with another member. He will use this loan to purchase a digital video camera to serve customers better.

loans.use: To purchase a digital video camera to serve customers better.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, pure water and juice for resale.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un estudiante de la carrera de química farmacéutica, es una persona muy luchadora que se esta esforzando por ser alguien en la vida, y por medio de su profesión poder ayudar a las demás personas. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en pagar las clases de su universidad y también las cuotas, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, ya que tiene ese gasto que quiere cumplir, y lo cual le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Juan is a pharmaceutical chemistry degree student. He is a hardworking person who is striving to be someone in life and through his profession can help other people. He says that his previous loan was used to pay for university classes and fees which helped him a lot. Today he requests a new loan to be able to cover degree expenses since he has this cost that he would like to cover. It will be very helpful.

loans.use: to pay for degree expenses.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama 8 de diciembre, es un grupo nuevo, están entusiasmadas para poder capacitarse y poder crecer los trabajos que cada una hace. Son mujeres jefas de familia que están luchando por poder crecer y salir adelante.
Simona es parte de este grupo, ella es vendedora, y comenta que se dedica a la venta de zapatillas que ella misma borda y que después vende en su barrio y alrededores, es una señora humilde, pero que quiere mejorar su vida. Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de zapatillas, lentejuelas, canutillos, pinzas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This loan group is called "Eighth of December." It is a new group. They are excited about being able to be trained and to grow the businesses that each one works in. They are women who are the heads of their families and are striving to be able to grow and advance.

Simona is part of this group. She is a retailer, she she comments that she sells casual shoes that she herself decorates and then sells in her neighborhood and its surroundings. She is a humble woman, but she wants to improve her life. She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of casual shoes and spangles, beads, tweezers, and other items, so that she can continue with her work, striving to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy casual shoes and spangles, beads, tweezers, and other items to decorate them

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El  Sr. Francisco es  de la ciudad de Concepción, tiene una despensa en su casa donde todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día, ya que tiene muchos clientes. Comenta que al principio le fue un poco difícil, pero que fue abriéndose camino.
Francisco pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos varios para su despensa, como ser carne, pollo, verduras, bebidas, y otros, de manera a poder seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes, ya que tiene mucha demanda.
texts.en:
Señor Francisco is from the city of Concepción. He has a grocery store in his house where he works every day from a very early hour of the day, since he has many customers. He comments that at the beginning it was a little difficult for him, but he forged ahead.

Francisco is requesting this loan for the purchase of various supplies for his store, such as meat, chicken, vegetables, beverages, and other items, so that he can continue offering a good variety to his customers, since he has a lot of demand.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, beverages, and other items for his store

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Renacer se formo en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, ellas se unieron con el objetivo de poder trabajar juntas y ayudarse las unas a las otras. Están también dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les ayudará a mejorar sus vidas.
Rosa, una de ellas, se dedica a la costura, comenta que todos los días trabaja en su pequeño taller que monto con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo. Rosa es una persona muy emprendedora que está luchando por poder salir adelante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Este préstamo lo pide para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás, con lo cual podrá seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Renacer was formed in Mariano Roque Alonso city. They united with the objective of being able to work together and help each other out. They are also in the program to eliminate poverty, which will help them improve their lives.

Rosa, one of the members, is a seamstress. She shares that she works every day in her small workshop with great sacrifice and effort. Rosa is a very hard-working person who is fighting to be able to get ahead and improve her living conditions. She is asking for this loan to invest in buying fabric, thread, buttons, and other items which will enable her to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sugar, milk, biscuits and cigarettes for resale.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nueva Esperanza 2 está en su ciclo número 1, es un grupo nuevo que tiene las mejores expectativas para poder ir mejorando las condiciones de vida de cada una. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder seguir trabajando.
Iris es miembro de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales que vende de manera ambulante, ella es una mujer muy humilde, pero que se esta esforzando por poder salir adelante, ya que ella es el sostén de su casa y su familia. Esta contenta por esta oportunidad que tiene que le permitirá seguir creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios naturales, ya que así podrá seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group, "Nueva Esperanza" is in their first cycle. It is a new group that has the highest expectations to be able to improve the conditions of each woman. They are completing a survey on the elimination of poverty to be able to know the situation of each woman and act accordingly to continue working. 

Iris is a member of the group. She sells natural remedies as a street vendor. She is a very humble woman but is striving to get ahead as she is the foundation of her house and family. She is happy to have this opportunity that will allow her to continue growing. She requests this loan to invest in the purchase of natural remedies so she can continue her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas  está en el 1er ciclo,  Están iniciando con muchas expectativas que quieren invertir para poder tener más ingresos en la casa y así  poder salir de la pobreza. 
María se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropas, tiene todo tipo de prendas que ofrece a sus clientes, comenta que es muy difícil el mercado ya que hay mucha competencia, pero que ella se esfuerza para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos poder medio de su trabajo. Pide este préstamo para comprar jeans, remeras, pantalones y demás, para que de esa forma siga dando a su clientela una buena variedad.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas group is in its first cycle. They are starting with many expectations and want to invest in a business in order to be able to have more income in their homes and be able to get out of poverty.

María sells clothing as a street vendor. She sells all kinds of clothing to her customers, and she says it is very difficult in the market because of the competition but she is making the effort to be able to help her family and loved ones through her work. She seeks this loan to buy jeans, t-shirts, pants and other items and in this way continue giving her customers a good variety.

loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts, pants, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, meat, beverages and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, butter, sugar, milk,etc. for baking to sell.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Cayetano está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo de todas las integrantes, el grupo está alcanzando la estabilidad. 
La Sra. Juana es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas del día para preparar las comidas que ella sale luego a vender. Juana pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer comidas, y venderlas luego. Necesita comprar carne, verduras, condimentos, hortalizas y demás.
texts.en:
The group called "San Cayetano" is in their second program cycle with this committee where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. Through the efforts and continuous work of all the members, the group is achieving stability.

Juana is one of the members of the group. She is a very hardworking woman that begins work each day in the early hours of the morning to prepare the foods that she later goes out to sell. Juana requests this loan to be able to buy supplies to make food and later sell them. She needs to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, produce, and more.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, produce, and more.

loans.name: Sembrando Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEMBRANDO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Lidia la socia continua con su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia continua vendiendo a pedido a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de colonias entre otros.
 La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de cremas, perfumes entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de restaurant, negocio de taller de carpintería, imprenta, negocio de venta de pasteles.
En la foto grupal salen dos niños.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Sembrando." This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

One of the members is Señora Lidia. She continues with her business of selling beauty products. She has been working in this business for quite some time, and it brings her economic as well as personal satisfaction. She continues selling on order to all the customers who come to her. She wants to be able to continue working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family.

She is applying for the loan to purchase colognes, creams, and perfumes, among other items. 

The other members work in grocery store, restaurant, carpentry workshop, printing, and pastry-selling businesses.

In the photo there are two children.

The bank member [Señora Lidia] is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means, and she promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy cologne and other items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Sheraton Group

texts.en:
Rukia, in her late thirties, is married and a mother of three sons who are at school. She supports her family by running a business. She buy chickens, fries them and sells them from morning to 11 p.m. daily. Rukia is able to make a good profit each month. She is so happy with Kiva's support and she believes her business will grow more with it. Rukia is so thankful with everyone who supports her group. Rukia has been in this business for ten years. 

This will be Rukia's seventh loan request via Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, which she repaid successfully, to buy more chickens for her business. Rukia earned profit, which she used to build a house and to cover part of school fees and household expenses. In the coming years, Rukia would like to raise her own chickens instead of buying, and become better off in life. She will use her new loan to buy chickens to be fried and sold. 

Rukia and the other Sheraton group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chickens to be fried and sold.

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru: Халима опытная портниха, так как уже более 10 лет занимается шитьем женской одежды. Ей 61 лет. Она имеет одну дочь. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами она работает упорно с раннего утра до позднего вечера.  Халима с бизнесом справляется сама. Она уже давно хочет отремонтировать свой дом, так как ее дом в плохом состоянии. Халима запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, краски и т.п. Она надеется на вас и вашу доброту.
texts.en: Halima is an experienced seamstress, as she has been sewing women's dresses for over ten years. She is 68 years old and has one daughter. In order to provide for her family she works hard from early morning until late at night. Halima takes care of her business by herself. For a long time she wanted to renovate her home as it is in bad shape. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to purchase building materials such as lumber, cement and paint. She hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials as cement, wood, paints and etc.

loans.name: Nodirakhon

texts.ru: Нодирахон родилась в 1984 году. Она замужем, но еще не имеет детей. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина. Нодирахон более 2 лет занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она шьет национальные женские платья. Нодирахон в течение нескольких лет накопила деньги, чтобы отремонтировать дом, но ее деньги не хватают для завершения ремонтных работ. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, краски и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nodirakhon was born in 1984. She is married, but has no children. She is a very hard working woman. For two years she has been sewing Tajik national dresses for women. Nodirakhon has saved up money over this time to renovate her house, but her money run out before all the work was completed. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to purchase building materials such as cement, lumber, paints etc. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials, such as cement, lumber, paints etc.

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es:
Clemente tiene 56 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos y esposa en el Distrito de San Juan de Bigote, una comunidad de clima calurosa, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña de guayaquil, comercio de animales menores, ubicada en el distrito de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y animales menores, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de productos para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Clemente is 56 years old. He lives in his own house along with his children and his wife in the district of San Juan de Bigote, a community with a hot climate. Its people raise Guayaquil cane [similar to bamboo] and sell small animals. It is located in the district of Morropon, which belongs to the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.

He sells groceries and small animals. His business is located in his home. He has applied to Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 4000 PEN to purchase a larger quantity of products to stock his business and in this way generate greater income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of products to stock his business

location.town: San Juan de Bigote - Morropon - Piura

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchases more ladies' bags, slippers and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Tagoygul

texts.ru: Тагойгул 54-летняя женщина с высшим образованием. Она более 15 лет работает в родильном доме своего городка Вахдат. Ее муж тоже врач. У них имеются трое детей в возрасте 29, 28 и 21 года. Все их дети сейчас находятся в России. Двое старших работают, а младший сын студент. Он учится в Медицинском Университете города Самары Российской Федерации. Он тоже пошел по стопам родителей и в будущем хочет стать профессиональным врачом. Его ежегодное обучение в ВУЗе стоит очень дорого. Из-за нехватки финансов Тагойгул обратилась за кредитом. Из запрашиваемой суммы 2400 долларов США пойдут на оплату годового обучения, а 100 долларов на покупку учебных принадлежностей сына. Семья Тагойгул с надеждой ждут финансовой поддержки.
texts.en: Tagoygul is a 54 year old woman with a college degree. She has been working for 15 years in the maternity ward of Vahdat. Her husband is also a doctor and they have three children of 29, 28 and 21 years of age. All of their kids are in Russia right now. The oldest ones are working and the youngest son is a college student. He is attending the Medical University of Samara in Russian Federation. He chose to follow his parents' footsteps and become a physician. His yearly tuition is very expensive, and Tagoygul has turned to KIVA for a loan. She plans to use 2,400 US dollars to pay for tuition and a 100 US dollars to purchase supplies for her son. Tagoygul's family is awaiting your help and financial assistance.

loans.use: to pay the annual college tuition for her son and purchase school supplies

loans.name: Ranokhon

texts.ru: Ранохон вдова. Она родилась в 1966 году. Ранохон работает в средней школе своего района учительницей, так как она окончила педагогический университет. Ранохон работает в школе более 19 лет. Она имеет большой опыт. Ранохон уже в течение нескольких лет строит дом для своей семьи, так как ее семья большая. У нее 5 детей. Ранохон запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки древесины для постройки нового дома. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ranokhon is a widow. She was born in 1966 and received her degree in education, so she now works as a high school teacher in her town. She has been working for the school for over 19 years and has a lot of experience. Over the last few years Ranokhon has been trying to build a house for her large family. She has five children. She is now requesting a loan of 6,000 somoni to purchase lumber for building the house. She hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy lumber for building a new house

loans.name: Angela Sarai

texts.es:
Angela es una mujer luchadora, tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Tiene una pequeña hija y al ser madre soltera tiene que velar por su bienestar y luchar día a día para que no le falte nada a su pequeña. Sus padres la ayudan en todo lo que pueden, pero como son de escasos recursos económicos no les alcanza, es por ello que Angela busca la manera de sacar a su hija adelante. Desde hace varios años trabaja vendiendo carne de res en un puesto que tiene en el mercado. Le va muy bien porque es muy trabajadora, luchadora, responsable y siempre brinda productos de calidad y es muy amable con los clientes.
Angela está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una cama para su hija. De esta manera estará mejorando su la calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para poder brindarle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Angela is a tenacious 30 year old woman. She is single and lives with her family in Ica. She has a young daughter and being a single mother she has to watch over her well-being and struggle from day to day so that her daughter doesn't lack anything. Her parents help her all they can but as they have low economic resources there isn't enough so Angela has to look for ways to get her daughter ahead.

For the past several years she has been selling beef in a stall she has at the market. Things are going well for her as she is hard-working responsible, a fighter who always provides quality products and is very friendly with her customers.

Angela is grateful to the lenders at Kiva as with the support they offer she can buy a bed for her daughter. By doing this she can improve their quality of living and security striving to provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a bed for her daughter.

loans.name: Jackeline Janet

texts.es:
Jackeline Janet tiene 40 años de edad, vive con sus hijos en casa familiar en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos desde hace 2 años, en el sector Cerro León, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cerdos para engorde del mismo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jackeline Janet is 40 years old. She lives with her children in the family home in a large community in the urban zone of Cayalti. Its people work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock raising. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

She has been raising pigs for 2 years in the Cerro León sector. She has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN to purchase pigs to fatten and in this way generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy small pigs to stock her business

loans.name: Antonio Alexander

texts.es:
Antonio tiene 21 años de edad vive en el cantón San Miguel provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Guapo estado civil soltero vive con su esposa y su hijo de 10 meses de edad.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Rural Las Guardias que se dedica a la agricultura.

El se dedica a la agricultura y siembra de frejol y maíz. Utilizara el dinero del crédito para la compra de fertilizantes para sus siembras. Realiza las compras en las  ciudades de San Pablo,su sueño es tener su propio negoció y una casa propia, su desafió son las plagas, en los tiempos libres el se dedica al deporte.
texts.en: Antonio is 21 years old. He lives in the San Miguel Canton, province of Bolivar in the Guapo community. He is single and lives with his wife and 10 month old son. He is a member of the solidarity group Las Guardias which works in agriculture. He works in agriculture and grows beans and corn. He will use the loan money to buy fertilizers for his crops. He does his purchases in the city of San Pablo. His dream is to have his own business and his own house. His challenges are the plagues. In his free time he plays sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more slippers, blouses and panties to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drink, pure water, ovaltine and milk for resale.

loans.name: Zaynalbi

texts.ru:
Зайналби 64 года. Несмотря на свой пожилой возраст она все еще трудолюбивая способная женщина. Зайналби умеет вышивать женские национальные одежды и хочет это свое умение использовать в прибыльный бизнес. Зайналби решила у себя на дому открыть ателье. Вместе с ней будет работать ее невестка. 
Зайналби живет в городе Куляб с мужем, дочерью, двумя сыновьями и двумя невестками. У них большая, но сплоченная семья, где каждый помогает друг другу.  
Зайналби не хочет чувствовать себя старой и ненужной, хотя в семье никто не дает ей повода так думать. Зайналби собирается открыть свой швейный бизнес, но чтобы начать бизнес, она нуждается в кредите. Зайналби за счет кредита хочет купить модернизированную швейную машинку и приступить к делу вместе с невесткой. Благодаря кредиту в их семье еще два человека приобретут работу и принесут новый источник дохода, что улучшит экономическое положение их семьи.
texts.en: Zaynalbi is 64 years old. Despite her age, she is a hardworking and calm woman. Zaynalbi knows how to embroider Tajik dresses and wants to use her talent for a lucrative business. She decided to open a sewing studio in her home, where she will work together with her daughter-in-law. Zaynalbi lives in Kulob with her husband, daughters, two sons and two daughters-in-law. They have a large, but tight-knit family where everyone helps each other out. Zaynalbi doesn't want to feel old and useless, even though her family never makes her feel that way. As she wants to open the sewing business, she need a loan, which she will use to buy an automated sewing and embroidery machine and start working. Because of this loan two more people in the household will be able to earn money, which will improve the economic situation of the whole household.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine so she and her daughter-in-law can work

loans.name: Kotognontala 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe KOTOGNONTALA 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à ZOUMAYERE une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame SALI débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  KOTOGNONTALA 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 3 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
