The five members of the KOTOGNONTALA 3 group are married women and they are, on average, 33 years old with five children each. Most of them live in traditional families in Zoumayere, a commune located in the Sikasso Cercle (third administrative region of Mali). They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their eleventh farming loan with the institution and have duly repaid all their previous loans.

Sali, a member of the group, grows groundnut. In the photo, she is the woman in the middle of the standing row.  She is planning to use her loan to buy three 50-kilo bags of fertilizers, three cans of herbicide, and also to cover the cost of plowing on 0.75 hectare of land. After the harvest, she sells her crop in her village and in Sikasso.  She sells to both men and women and gets paid in cash and on credit.  Sali is expecting to make an average profit of 105,000 CFA francs per planting season. She will use her profit to repay her loan and the interest, and also to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and also to cover her plowing costs.

loans.name: Riziki Group

texts.en:
Elisi, in her thirties, is married and, with her husband, has a boy and a girl, one in school and the other still young. For the past seven years, Elisi has been supporting her family by managing a charcoal store and frying cassava to sell. She is doing great and is known more and more because of her business. Elisi operates her business from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit each month.

Elisi has been a longtime customer of Tujijenge Tanzania. She has received several loans and has managed to successfully repay them all. Elisi used the previous loans to buy business inventory: sacks of charcoal and cassava. She used the extra income from the business to start building and to cover part of school fees and household expenses. Elisi will use this loan to buy stocks of cassava and charcoal for selling. She dreams that one day she will be able to grow her business even more.

Elisi will share this loan with her loan group"Riziki', which consists of ten members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stocks of cassava and charcoal for selling.

loans.name: Kotognontala 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe KOTOGNONTALA 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à ZOUMAYERE une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame FANTA débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  KOTOGNONTALA 4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 3 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the KOTOGNONTALA 4 group are married women and they are, on average, 39 years old with three children each. Most of them live in traditional families in Zoumayere, a commune located in the Sikasso Cercle (third administrative region of Mali). They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their eleventh farming loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Fanta, a member of the group, grows groundnut. In the photo, she is in the standing row, second from the right. She is planning to use her loan to buy three 50-kilo bags of fertilizers, three cans of herbicide, and also to cover the cost of plowing on 0.75 hectare of land. After the harvest, she sells her crop in her village and in Sikasso. She sells to both men and women and gets paid in cash and on credit. Fanta is expecting to make an average profit of 105,000 CFA francs per planting season. She will use her profit to repay her loan and the interest, and also to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and to cover her plowing costs.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 37 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Morropon, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de plátano, arroz y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado y abarrotes, sus clientes en la mayoría son sus vecinos y moradores de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de abarrotes que le permitan ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Maribel is 37 years old and lives in Morropon District, located in the Province of the same name, which belongs to Piura Region on the North Coast of Peru. The people of this community with a hot climate work in agriculture, commerce and raise livestock.

Maribel works selling fish and groceries. Her clients are mostly her neighbors and residents of the district. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 PEN to buy a variety of groceries that she can offer to her clients. In this way she can generate more revenue for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to stock her business.

loans.name: Kotognontala 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe KOTOGNONTALA 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à ZOUMAYERE une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame AWA assise à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  KOTOGNONTALA 5. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the KOTOGNONTALA 5 group are married women and they are, on average, 28 years old with three children each. Most of them live in traditional families in Zoumayere, a commune located in the Sikasso Cercle (third administrative region of Mali). They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their eleventh farming loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Awa, a member of the group, grows groundnut. In the photo, she is in the front row, second from the right. She is planning to use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizers, one can of herbicide, and also to cover the cost of plowing on 0.5 hectare of land. After the harvest, she sells her crop in her village and in Sikasso. She sells to both men and women and gets paid in cash and on credit. Awa is expecting to make an average profit of 74,000 CFA francs per planting season. She will use her profit to repay her loan and the interest, and also to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and also to cover her plowing costs.

loans.name: Maria Orfelina

texts.es:
María Orfelia tiene 51 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de helados así como la compra de gaseosas, agua mineral, galletas y con ello le generar mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: María Orfelia is 51 years old.  She lives is the Pomahuaca district, a community with a warm climate, located in Jaén Province, which belongs to the Cajamarca Region in Peru’s Northern Sierra.  The people are engaged in farming, trade, and raising cattle.  Maria is engaged in selling general groceries, and her business is located in her home.  She is requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase a large quantity of ice cream as well as soda, mineral water, and cookies.  With this investment, she will generate more income and, in this way, be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Kotognontala 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe KOTOGNONTALA 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à ZOUMAYERE une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame KLETIO assise à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  KOTOGNONTALA 6. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the KOTOGNONTALA 6 group are married women and they are, on average, 42 years old with five children each. Most of them live in traditional families in Zoumayere, a commune located in the Sikasso Cercle (third administrative region of Mali). They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their eleventh farming loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Kletio, a member of the group, grows groundnut. In the photo, she is in the front row, first from the left. She is planning to use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizers, one can of herbicide, and also to cover the cost of plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare of land. After the harvest, she sells her crop in her village and in Sikasso. She sells to both men and women and gets paid in cash and on credit. Kletio is expecting to make an average profit of 74,000 CFA francs per planting season. She will use her profit to repay her loan and the interest, and also to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to cover her plowing costs.

loans.name: Milena Katherine

texts.es:
Milena es una joven emprendedora, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y vive en San Juan de Lurigancho junto a su familia. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Desde hace casi un año trabaja como Teleoperadora de Cobranza en una prestigiosa empresa y le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajadora, honesta y porque siempre brinda una atención de calidad y es muy amable con los clientes. También, como tiene muchos deseos de superación está estudiando la carrera de Secretariado Ejecutivo y más adelante quiere ejercer su carrera en una importante empresa.
Milena está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un televisor para su casa, para que pueda disfrutar junto a su familia en sus momentos libres viendo sus programas preferidos. Con esto ella seguirá luchando para más adelante poder: Culminar sus estudios universitarios".
texts.en:
Milena is an entrepreneurial young woman. She is 24 years old. She is single and lives in San Juan de Lurigancho with her family. She is a person with a great will to get ahead. For almost a year she has been working as a telephone operator in collections at a prestigious business, and it is going very well for her because she is very responsible, hard-working, and honest and because she always offers quality attention and is very polite to the customers. She also has a great desire to achieve. She is studying in an executive secretary course, and in the future she wants to practice her career in an important business. 

Milena is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support that they have offered her, she will be able to buy a television for her home, so that she can enjoy it with her family in her free moments, watching her preferred programs. With this she will continue striving to be able to complete her university studies in the future.

loans.use: to buy a television
